A Whisper to [the Reader]225-the reader . There is [no character]226-no character , howsoever good and fine , but it can be destroyed by ridicule , howsoever poor and witless . Observe [the ass]227-the ass , for instance : [his]227-the ass character is about perfect , [he]227-the ass is the choicest spirit among all the humbler animals , yet see what ridicule has brought [him]227-the ass to . Instead of feeling complimented when [we]228-we are called [an ass]229-an ass , [we]228-we are left in [doubt.--Pudd'nhead Wilson]68-wilson 's Calendar . [A person who is ignorant of legal matters]230-a person who is ignorant of legal matters is always liable to make mistakes when [he]230-a person who is ignorant of legal matters tries to photograph a court scene with [his]230-a person who is ignorant of legal matters pen ; and so [I]0-i was not willing to let the law chapters in this book go to press without first subjecting them to rigid and exhausting revision and correction by [a trained barrister]231-a trained barrister -- if that is what they are called . These chapters are right , now , in every detail , for they were rewritten under the immediate eye of [William Hicks]69-william hicks , who studied law part of a while in [southwest Missouri]1-southwest missouri thirty - five years ago and then came over [here]232-here to [Florence]2-florence for [his]69-william hicks health and is still helping for exercise and board in [Macaroni Vermicelli]70-macaroni vermicelli 's horse - feed shed which is up [the back alley]233-the back alley as [you]234-you turn around the corner out of the [Piazza del Duomo]3-piazza del duomo just beyond [the house where that stone that [Dante]71-dante used to sit on six hundred years ago]235-the house where that stone that dante used to sit on six hundred years ago is let into the wall when [he]71-dante let on to be watching [them]236-them build [[Giotto]72-giotto 's campanile]237-giotto 's campanile and yet always got tired looking as soon as [Beatrice]73-beatrice passed along on [her]73-beatrice way to get a chunk of chestnut cake to defend [herself]73-beatrice with in case of a Ghibelline outbreak before [she]73-beatrice got to [school]238-school , at the same old stand where [they]236-them sell the same old cake to this day and it is just as light and good as it was then , too , and this is not flattery , far from it . [He]71-dante was a little rusty on [his]71-dante law , but [he]71-dante rubbed up for this book , and those two or three legal chapters are right and straight , now . [He]71-dante told [me]0-i so [himself]71-dante . Given under [my]0-i hand this second day of January , 1893 , at [the Villa Viviani]239-the villa viviani , [village of [Settignano]4-settignano]240-village of settignano , [three miles back of [Florence]2-florence]241-three miles back of florence , on [the hills]242-the hills -- the same certainly affording the most charming view to be found on [this planet]243-this planet , and with it the most dreamlike and enchanting sunsets to be found in [any planet]244-any planet or even in [any solar system]245-any solar system -- and given , too , in [the swell room of [the house]247-the house]246-the swell room of the house , with the busts of [Cerretani senators and other grandees of this line]248-cerretani senators and other grandees of this line looking approvingly down upon [me]0-i as [they]248-cerretani senators and other grandees of this line used to look down upon [Dante]71-dante , and mutely asking [me]0-i to adopt [them]248-cerretani senators and other grandees of this line into [[my]0-i family]249-my family , which [I]0-i do with pleasure , for [[my]0-i remotest ancestors]250-my remotest ancestors are but spring chickens compared with these robed and stately antiques , and it will be a great and satisfying lift for [me]0-i , that six hundred years will . [Mark Twain]74-twain . CHAPTER I. Pudd'nhead Wins [His]251-his Name . Tell the truth or trump -- but get the trick.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]68-wilson 's Calendar . The scene of this chronicle is [the town of [[Dawson]75-dawson 's landing 's Landing]75-dawson 's landing]252-the town of dawson 's landing , on [the [Missouri]1-southwest missouri side of [the Mississippi]7-the mississippi]253-the missouri side of the mississippi , half a day 's journey , per steamboat , below [St. Louis]8-st. louis . In 1830 [it]254-it was a snug little collection of [modest one- and two - story frame dwellings whose whitewashed exteriors were almost concealed from sight by climbing tangles of rose - vines , honeysuckles , and morning - glories]255-modest one- and two - story frame dwellings whose whitewashed exteriors were almost concealed from sight by climbing tangles of rose - vines , honeysuckles , and morning - glories . [Each of [these pretty homes]257-these pretty homes]256-each of these pretty homes had [a garden]258-a garden in front fenced with white palings and opulently stocked with hollyhocks , marigolds , touch - me - nots , prince's - feathers and other old - fashioned flowers ; while on the window - sills of [the houses]259-the houses stood wooden boxes containing moss - rose plants and terra - cotta pots in which grew a breed of geranium whose spread of intensely red blossoms accented the prevailing pink tint of [the rose - clad house]260-the rose - clad house - front like an explosion of flame . When there was room on the ledge outside of the pots and boxes for a cat , the cat was there -- in sunny weather -- stretched at full length , asleep and blissful , with [her]261-her furry belly to the sun and a paw curved over [her]261-her nose . Then [that house]262-that house was complete , and its contentment and peace were made manifest to [the world]263-the world by this symbol , whose testimony is infallible . [A home without a cat --]264-a home without a cat -- and a well - fed , well - petted and properly revered cat -- may be [a perfect home]265-a perfect home , perhaps , but how can it prove title ? All along [the streets]266-the streets , on both sides , at the outer edge of [the brick sidewalks]267-the brick sidewalks , stood locust - trees with trunks protected by wooden boxing , and these furnished shade for summer and a sweet fragrance in spring when the clusters of buds came forth . [The main street]268-the main street , one block back from [the river]269-the river , and running parallel with [it]269-the river , was [the sole business street]270-the sole business street . [It]268-the main street was six blocks long , and in [each block]271-each block [two or three brick stores three stories high]272-two or three brick stores three stories high towered above interjected bunches of [little frame shops]273-little frame shops . Swinging signs creaked in the wind , [the street]274-the street 's whole length . The candy - striped pole which indicates nobility proud and ancient along [the palace - bordered canals of [Venice]9-venice]275-the palace - bordered canals of venice , indicated merely [the humble barber shop along [the main street of [Dawson 's Landing]75-dawson 's landing]277-the main street of dawson 's landing]276-the humble barber shop along the main street of dawson 's landing . On [a chief corner]278-a chief corner stood a lofty unpainted pole wreathed from top to bottom with tin pots and pans and cups , [the chief tinmonger]279-the chief tinmonger 's noisy notice to [the world]263-the world ( when the wind blew ) that [[his]279-the chief tinmonger shop]281-his shop was on hand for business at [that corner]282-that corner . [[The hamlet]283-the hamlet 's front]284-the hamlet 's front was washed by the clear waters of [the great river]285-the great river ; [its]283-the hamlet body stretched itself rearward up a gentle incline ; [its]283-the hamlet most rearward border fringed itself out and scattered [[its]283-the hamlet houses about the base - line of [the hills]242-the hills]286-its houses about the base - line of the hills ; [the hills]242-the hills rose high , inclosing [the town]289-the town in a half - moon curve , clothed with forests from foot to summit . [Steamboats]290-steamboats passed up and down every hour or so . [Those belonging to [the little [Cairo]11-cairo line]292-the little cairo line and [the little [Memphis]12-memphis line]293-the little memphis line]291-those belonging to the little cairo line and the little memphis line always stopped ; [the big [Orleans]13-orleans liners]294-the big orleans liners stopped for hails only , or to land [passengers]295-passengers or freight ; and this was the case also with the great flotilla of " [transients . "]1421-transients . "[291-those belonging to the little cairo line and the little memphis line] These latter came out of [a dozen rivers]296-a dozen rivers -- [the Illinois]14-the illinois , [the Missouri]1-southwest missouri , [the Upper Mississippi]16-the upper mississippi , [the Ohio]17-the ohio , [the Monongahela]18-the monongahela , [the Tennessee]19-the tennessee , [the Red River]20-the red river , [the White River]21-the white river , and so on ; and were bound every whither and stocked with every imaginable comfort or necessity which [[the Mississippi]297-the mississippi 's communities]298-the mississippi 's communities could want , from [the frosty Falls of [St. Anthony]22-st. anthony]299-the frosty falls of st. anthony down through nine climates to torrid [New Orleans]23-new orleans . [[Dawson]75-dawson 's landing 's Landing]75-dawson 's landing was [a slaveholding town]300-a slaveholding town , with a rich slave - worked grain and [pork country back of [it]300-a slaveholding town]301-pork country back of it . [The town]289-the town was sleepy and comfortable and contented . [It]289-the town was fifty years old , and was growing slowly -- very slowly , in fact , but still it was growing . [The chief citizen]303-the chief citizen was [York Leicester Driscoll]76-york leicester driscoll , about forty years old , [judge of [the county court]305-the county court]304-judge of the county court . [He]76-york leicester driscoll was very proud of [his]76-york leicester driscoll old Virginian ancestry , and in [his]76-york leicester driscoll hospitalities and [his]76-york leicester driscoll rather formal and stately manners [he]76-york leicester driscoll kept up its traditions . [He]76-york leicester driscoll was fine and just and generous . To be [a gentleman]306-a gentleman -- [a gentleman without stain or blemish]307-a gentleman without stain or blemish -- was [his]76-york leicester driscoll only religion , and to it [he]76-york leicester driscoll was always faithful . [He]76-york leicester driscoll was respected , esteemed and beloved by [all the community]308-all the community . [He]76-york leicester driscoll was well off , and was gradually adding to [[his]76-york leicester driscoll store]309-his store . [He]76-york leicester driscoll and [[his]76-york leicester driscoll wife]310-his wife were very nearly happy , but not quite , for [they]311-they had [no children]312-no children . The longing for the treasure of [a child]313-a child had grown stronger and stronger as the years slipped away , but the blessing never came -- and was never to come . With [this pair]314-this pair lived [[the Judge]315-the judge 's widowed sister]316-the judge 's widowed sister , [Mrs. Rachel Pratt]77-mrs. pratt , and [she]316-the judge 's widowed sister also was childless -- childless , and sorrowful for that reason , and not to be comforted . [The women]317-the women were [good and commonplace people]318-good and commonplace people , and did [their]317-the women duty and had [their]317-the women reward in clear consciences and [the community]319-the community 's approbation . [They]317-the women were [Presbyterians]320-presbyterians , [the Judge]315-the judge was [a free - thinker]322-a free - thinker . [Pembroke Howard]78-howard , [lawyer]323-lawyer and [bachelor , aged about forty]324-bachelor , aged about forty , was [another old Virginian grandee with proved descent from [the First Families]326-the first families]325-another old virginian grandee with proved descent from the first families . [He]78-howard was [a fine , brave , majestic creature]327-a fine , brave , majestic creature , [a gentleman according to the nicest requirements of the [Virginia]24-virginia rule]328-a gentleman according to the nicest requirements of the virginia rule , [a devoted Presbyterian]329-a devoted presbyterian , [an authority on the " code , "]1422-an authority on the " code , "[78-howard] and [a man always courteously ready to stand up before [you]331-you in the field]330-a man always courteously ready to stand up before you in the field if any act or word of [his]78-howard had seemed doubtful or suspicious to [you]331-you , and explain it with any weapon [you]331-you might prefer from brad - awls to artillery . [He]78-howard was very popular with [the people]332-the people , and was [[the Judge]315-the judge 's dearest friend]334-the judge 's dearest friend . Then there was [Colonel Cecil Burleigh Essex]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex , [another F. F. V. of formidable caliber]335-another f. f. v. of formidable caliber -- however , with [him]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex [we]336-we have no concern . [Percy Northumberland Driscoll]80-percy northumberland driscoll , brother to [the Judge]315-the judge , and younger than [he]80-percy northumberland driscoll by five years , was [a married man]338-a married man , and had had [children]339-children around [[his]80-percy northumberland driscoll hearthstone]340-his hearthstone ; but [they]339-children were attacked in detail by measles , croup and scarlet fever , and this had given [the doctor]341-the doctor a chance with [his]80-percy northumberland driscoll effective antediluvian methods ; so the cradles were empty . [He]80-percy northumberland driscoll was [a prosperous man]342-a prosperous man , with a good head for speculations , and [his]80-percy northumberland driscoll fortune was growing . On the 1st of February , 1830 , [two boy babes]343-two boy babes were born in [[his]80-percy northumberland driscoll house]344-his house : [one]345-one to [him]80-percy northumberland driscoll , the other to [one of [[his]80-percy northumberland driscoll slave girls]347-his slave girls]346-one of his slave girls , [Roxana]81-roxy by name . [Roxana]81-roxy was twenty years old . [She]81-roxy was up and around the same day , with [her]81-roxy hands full , for [she]81-roxy was tending [both babies]348-both babies . [Mrs. Percy Driscoll]82-percy driscoll died within the week . [Roxy]81-roxy remained in charge of [the children]349-the children . [She]81-roxy had [her]81-roxy own way , for [Mr. Driscoll]83-tom soon absorbed [himself]83-tom in [his]83-tom speculations and left [her]81-roxy to [her]81-roxy own devices . In that same month of February , [Dawson 's Landing]75-dawson 's landing gained [a new citizen]350-a new citizen . This was [Mr. David Wilson]84-wilson , [a young fellow of Scotch parentage]351-a young fellow of scotch parentage . [He]84-wilson had wandered to [this remote region from [his]84-wilson birthplace in [the interior of [the State of New York]25-the state of new york]353-the interior of the state of new york]352-this remote region from his birthplace in the interior of the state of new york , to seek [his]84-wilson fortune . [He]84-wilson was twenty - five years old , college - bred , and had finished a post - college course in [an Eastern law school]354-an eastern law school a couple of years before . [He]84-wilson was [a homely , freckled , sandy - haired young fellow , with an intelligent blue eye that had frankness and comradeship in it and a covert twinkle of a pleasant sort]355-a homely , freckled , sandy - haired young fellow , with an intelligent blue eye that had frankness and comradeship in it and a covert twinkle of a pleasant sort . But for an unfortunate remark of [his]84-wilson , [he]84-wilson would no doubt have entered at once upon a successful career at [Dawson 's Landing]75-dawson 's landing . But [he]84-wilson made [his]84-wilson fatal remark the first day [he]84-wilson spent in [the village]356-the village , and it " gaged "[84-wilson] [him]84-wilson . [He]84-wilson had just made the acquaintance of [a group of citizens]357-a group of citizens when an invisible dog began to yelp and snarl and howl and make [himself]84-wilson very comprehensively disagreeable , whereupon [young Wilson]84-wilson said , much as one who is thinking aloud-- " [I]84-wilson wish [I]84-wilson owned half of that dog . "[84-wilson] " Why ? "[358-somebody] [somebody]358-somebody asked . " Because [I]359-the group would kill [my]359-the group half . "[359-the group] [The group]359-the group searched [his]84-wilson face with curiosity , with anxiety even , but found no light there , no expression that [they]359-the group could read . [They]359-the group fell away from [him]84-wilson as from something uncanny , and went into privacy to discuss [him]84-wilson . [One]345-one said : " ' [Pears]85-pears to be [a fool]1423-a fool . "[345-one] " ' [Pears]85-pears ? "[361-another] said [another]361-another . " Is , [I]345-one reckon [you]84-wilson better say . "[345-one] " Said [he]84-wilson wished [he]84-wilson owned half of the dog , [the idiot]1424-the idiot , "[362-a third] said [a third]362-a third . " What did [he]84-wilson reckon would become of the other half if [he]84-wilson killed [his]84-wilson half ? Do [you]84-wilson reckon [he]84-wilson thought it would live ? "[362-a third] " Why , [he]84-wilson must have thought it , unless [he]84-wilson is [the downrightest fool in [the world]263-the world]1425-the downrightest fool in the world ; because if [he]84-wilson had n't thought it , [he]84-wilson would have wanted to own the whole dog , knowing that if [he]84-wilson killed [his]84-wilson half and [the other half]1427-the other half died , [he]84-wilson would be responsible for that half just the same as if [he]84-wilson had killed that half instead of [his]84-wilson own . Do n't it look that way to [you]84-wilson , [gents]1428-gents ? "[345-one] " Yes , it does . If [he]84-wilson owned one half of the general dog , it would be so ; if [he]84-wilson owned one end of the dog and [another person]1429-another person owned the other end , it would be so , just the same ; particularly in the first case , because if [you]84-wilson kill [one half of a general dog]1430-one half of a general dog , there ai n't [any man that can tell whose half it was]1431-any man that can tell whose half it was , but if [he]84-wilson owned one end of the dog , maybe [he]84-wilson could kill [his]84-wilson end of it and-- "[345-one] " No , [he]84-wilson could n't either ; [he]84-wilson could n't and not be responsible if the other end died , which it would . In [my]362-a third opinion that [man]1432-man ai n't in [his]84-wilson right mind . "[362-a third] " In [my]345-one opinion [he]84-wilson hain't got any mind . "[345-one] [No . 3]363-no . 3 said : " Well , [he]84-wilson 's [a lummox]1433-a lummox , anyway . "[364-no . 4] " Yes , [sir]1436-sir , [he]84-wilson 's [a dam fool]1437-a dam fool , that 's the way [I]365-no . 5 put [him]84-wilson up , "[365-no . 5] said [No . 5]365-no . 5 . " [Anybody]1438-anybody can think different that wants to , but those are [my]365-no . 5 sentiments . "[365-no . 5] " [I]364-no . 4 'm with [you]1436-sir , [gentlemen]1439-gentlemen , "[364-no . 4] said No . 6 . " [Perfect jackass]1440-perfect jackass -- yes , and it ai n't going too far to say [he]84-wilson is [a pudd'nhead]1441-a pudd'nhead . If [he]84-wilson ai n't [a pudd'nhead]1441-a pudd'nhead , [I]364-no . 4 ai n't [no judge]1443-no judge , that 's all . "[364-no . 4] [Mr. Wilson]84-wilson stood elected . The incident was told all over [the town]289-the town , and gravely discussed by [everybody]367-everybody . Within a week [he]84-wilson had lost [his]84-wilson first name ; [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson took its place . In time [he]84-wilson came to be liked , and well liked too ; but by that time the nickname had got well stuck on , and it stayed . That first day 's verdict made [him]84-wilson [a fool]1423-a fool , and [he]84-wilson was not able to get it set aside , or even modified . The nickname soon ceased to carry any harsh or unfriendly feeling with it , but it held its place , and was to continue to hold its place for twenty long years . CHAPTER II . [Driscoll]83-tom Spares [[His]83-tom Slaves]369-his slaves . [Adam]87-adam was but human -- this explains it all . [He]84-wilson did not want the apple for the apple 's sake , [he]84-wilson wanted it only because it was forbidden . The mistake was in not forbidding the serpent ; then [he]84-wilson would have eaten the serpent.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson had a trifle of money when [he]84-wilson arrived , and [he]84-wilson bought [a small house on [the extreme western verge of [the town]289-the town]371-the extreme western verge of the town]370-a small house on the extreme western verge of the town . Between [it]370-a small house on the extreme western verge of the town and [[Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll 's house]373-judge driscoll 's house there was only [a grassy yard]374-a grassy yard , with a paling fence dividing [the properties]375-the properties in the middle . [He]84-wilson hired [a small office down in [the town]289-the town]376-a small office down in the town and hung out a tin sign with these words on it : [DAVID WILSON]84-wilson . ATTORNEY AND COUNSELOR - AT - LAW . SURVEYING , CONVEYANCING , ETC . But [his]84-wilson deadly remark had ruined [his]84-wilson chance -- at least in the law . [No clients]378-no clients came . [He]84-wilson took down [his]84-wilson sign , after a while , and put it up on [[his]84-wilson own house]379-his own house with the law features knocked out of it . [It]379-his own house offered [his]84-wilson services now in the humble capacities of land - surveyor and [expert accountant]380-expert accountant . Now and then [he]84-wilson got a job of surveying to do , and now and then [a merchant]381-a merchant got [him]84-wilson to straighten out [his]84-wilson books . With Scotch patience and pluck [he]84-wilson resolved to live down [his]84-wilson reputation and work [his]84-wilson way into the legal field yet . [Poor fellow]382-poor fellow , [he]84-wilson could not foresee that it was going to take [him]84-wilson such a weary long time to do it . [He]84-wilson had a rich abundance of idle time , but it never hung heavy on [his]84-wilson hands , for [he]84-wilson interested [himself]84-wilson in every new thing that was born into the universe of ideas , and studied it and experimented upon it at [[his]84-wilson house]344-his house . One of [his]84-wilson pet fads was palmistry . To another one [he]84-wilson gave no name , neither would [he]84-wilson explain to [anybody]1438-anybody what its purpose was , but merely said it was an amusement . In fact [he]84-wilson had found that [his]84-wilson fads added to [his]84-wilson reputation as [a pudd'nhead]1441-a pudd'nhead ; therefore [he]84-wilson was growing chary of being too communicative about [them]386-them . [The fad without a name]387-the fad without a name was one which dealt with [people]388-people 's finger - marks . [He]84-wilson carried in [his]84-wilson coat pocket a shallow box with grooves in it , and in the grooves strips of glass five inches long and three inches wide . Along the lower edge of each strip was pasted a slip of white paper . [He]84-wilson asked [people]388-people to pass [their]388-people hands through [their]388-people hair ( thus collecting upon [them]388-people a thin coating of the natural oil ) and then make a thumb - mark on a glass strip , following it with the mark of the ball of each finger in succession . Under this row of faint grease - prints [he]84-wilson would write a record on the strip of white paper -- thus : [John Smith]89-john smith , right hand-- and add the day of the month and the year , then take [Smith]89-john smith 's left hand on another glass strip , and add name and date and the words " left hand . "[84-wilson] The strips were now returned to the grooved box , and took their place among what [Wilson]84-wilson called [his]84-wilson " records . "[84-wilson] [He]84-wilson often studied [his]84-wilson records , examining and poring over them with absorbing interest until far into the night ; but what [he]84-wilson found there -- if [he]84-wilson found anything -- [he]84-wilson revealed to [no one]390-no one . Sometimes [he]84-wilson copied on paper the involved and delicate pattern left by the ball of a finger , and then vastly enlarged it with a pantograph so that [he]84-wilson could examine its web of curving lines with ease and convenience . One sweltering afternoon -- it was the first day of July , 1830 - -he was at work over a set of tangled account - books in [[his]84-wilson work - room]391-his work - room , which looked westward over [a stretch of vacant lots]392-a stretch of vacant lots , when a conversation outside disturbed [him]84-wilson . It was carried on in yells , which showed that [the people engaged in it]393-the people engaged in it were not close together : " Say , [Roxy]81-roxy , how does [yo]81-roxy ' baby come on ? "[81-roxy] This from the distant voice . " Fust - rate ; how does [you]84-wilson come on , [Jasper]90-jasper ? "[81-roxy] This yell was from close by . " Oh , [I]81-roxy 's middlin ' ; [hain't]1444-hain't got noth'n ' to complain of . [I]81-roxy 's gwine to come a - court'n ' [you]81-roxy bimeby , [Roxy]81-roxy . "[81-roxy] " [You]81-roxy is , [you]81-roxy black mud - cat ! [Yah]1445-yah -- yah -- yah ! [I]81-roxy got somep'n ' better to do den ' sociat'n ' wid niggers as black as [you]81-roxy is . Is [ole Miss Cooper]91-ole miss cooper 's [Nancy]92-nancy done give [you]81-roxy de mitten ? "[81-roxy] [Roxy]81-roxy followed this sally with another discharge of care - free laughter . " [You]81-roxy 's jealous , [Roxy]81-roxy , dat 's what 's de matter wid [you]81-roxy , [you]81-roxy hussy -- yah -- yah -- yah ! Dat 's de time [I]81-roxy got [you]81-roxy ! "[81-roxy] " Oh , yes , [you]81-roxy got [me]394-this idle and aimless jabber , hain't [you]81-roxy . ' Clah to goodness if [dat]1446-dat conceit o ' yo'n strikes in , [Jasper]90-jasper , it gwine to kill [you]90-jasper sho ' . If [you]90-jasper b'longed to [me]394-this idle and aimless jabber [I]394-this idle and aimless jabber 'd sell [you]90-jasper down [de river]1447-de river ' fo ' [you]90-jasper git too fur gone . Fust time [I]394-this idle and aimless jabber runs acrost [yo]90-jasper ' marster , [I]394-this idle and aimless jabber 's gwine to tell [him]90-jasper so . "[394-this idle and aimless jabber] [This idle and aimless jabber]394-this idle and aimless jabber went on and on , [both parties]395-both parties enjoying the friendly duel and each well satisfied with [his]396-his own share of the wit exchanged -- for wit [they]395-both parties considered it . [Wilson]84-wilson stepped to the window to observe [the combatants]397-the combatants ; [he]84-wilson could not work while [their]397-the combatants chatter continued . Over in [the vacant lots]398-the vacant lots was [Jasper]90-jasper , young , coal - black and of magnificent build , sitting on a wheelbarrow in the pelting sun -- at work , supposably , whereas [he]90-jasper was in fact only preparing for it by taking an hour 's rest before beginning . In front of [[Wilson]84-wilson 's porch]399-wilson 's porch stood [Roxy]81-roxy , with a local hand - made [baby - wagon]400-baby - wagon , in which sat [her]81-roxy two charges -- one at each end and facing each other . From [Roxy]81-roxy 's manner of speech , [a stranger]401-a stranger would have expected [her]81-roxy to be black , but [she]81-roxy was not . Only one sixteenth of [her]81-roxy was black , and that sixteenth did not show . [She]81-roxy was of majestic form and stature , [her]81-roxy attitudes were imposing and statuesque , and [her]81-roxy gestures and movements distinguished by a noble and stately grace . [Her]81-roxy complexion was very fair , with the rosy glow of vigorous health in the cheeks , [her]81-roxy face was full of character and expression , [her]81-roxy eyes were brown and liquid , and [she]81-roxy had a heavy suit of fine soft hair which was also brown , but the fact was not apparent because [her]81-roxy head was bound about with a checkered handkerchief and the hair was concealed under it . [Her]81-roxy face was shapely , intelligent and comely -- even beautiful . [She]81-roxy had [an easy , independent carriage]402-an easy , independent carriage -- when [she]81-roxy was among [her]81-roxy own caste -- and a high and " sassy "[81-roxy] way , withal ; but of course [she]81-roxy was meek and humble enough where [white people]403-white people were . To all intents and purposes [Roxy]81-roxy was as white as [anybody]1438-anybody , but the one sixteenth of [her]81-roxy which was black outvoted the other fifteen parts and made [her]81-roxy [a negro]405-a negro . [She]81-roxy was [a slave , and salable as such]406-a slave , and salable as such . [[Her]81-roxy child]407-her child was thirty - one parts white , and [he]407-her child , too , was [a slave]408-a slave , and by a fiction of law and custom [a negro]405-a negro . [He]407-her child had blue eyes and flaxen curls like [[his]407-her child white comrade]410-his white comrade , but even [the father of [the white child]412-the white child]411-the father of the white child was able to tell [the children]349-the children apart -- little as [he]411-the father of the white child had commerce with [them]349-the children -- by [their]349-the children clothes : for [the white babe]414-the white babe wore ruffled soft muslin and a coral necklace , while [the other]415-the other wore merely a coarse tow - linen shirt which barely reached to its knees , and no jewelry . [The white child]412-the white child 's name was [Thomas à Becket Driscoll]83-tom , [the other]415-the other 's name was [Valet de Chambre]94-valet de chambre : no surname -- [slaves]418-slaves had n't the privilege . [Roxana]81-roxy had heard that phrase somewhere , the fine sound of it had pleased [her]81-roxy ear , and as [she]81-roxy had supposed it was a name , [she]81-roxy loaded it on to [[her]81-roxy darling]419-her darling . It soon got shorted to " [Chambers]95-chambers , "[81-roxy] of course . [Wilson]84-wilson knew [Roxy]81-roxy by sight , and when the duel of wit began to play out , [he]84-wilson stepped outside to gather in a record or two . [Jasper]90-jasper went to work energetically , at once , perceiving that [his]90-jasper leisure was observed . [Wilson]84-wilson inspected [the children]349-the children and asked-- " How old are [they]349-the children , [Roxy]81-roxy ? "[84-wilson] " Bofe de same age , [sir]1436-sir -- five months . Bawn de fust o ' Feb'uary . "[84-wilson] " [They]349-the children 're [handsome little chaps]1449-handsome little chaps . [One]96-one 's just as handsome as [the other]415-the other , too . "[421-the girl] A delighted smile exposed [the girl]421-the girl 's white teeth , and [she]421-the girl said : " Bless [yo]1436-sir ' soul , [Misto Wilson]68-wilson , it 's pow'ful nice o ' [you]1436-sir to say dat , ' ca'se one of ['em]1451-'em ai n't on'y [a nigger]1452-a nigger . [Mighty prime little nigger]1453-mighty prime little nigger , [I]421-the girl al'ays says , but dat 's ' ca'se it 's [mine]421-the girl , o ' course . "[421-the girl] " How do [you]68-wilson tell [them]349-the children apart , [Roxy]81-roxy , when [they]349-the children have n't any clothes on ? "[81-roxy] [Roxy]81-roxy laughed a laugh proportioned to [her]81-roxy size , and said : " Oh , [I]81-roxy kin tell ['em]1451-'em ' part , [Misto Wilson]68-wilson , but [I]81-roxy bet [Marse Percy]97-marse percy could n't , not to save [his]83-tom life . "[81-roxy] [Wilson]68-wilson chatted along for awhile , and presently got [Roxy]81-roxy 's finger - prints for [his]68-wilson collection -- right hand and left -- on a couple of [his]68-wilson glass strips ; then labeled and dated them , and took the " records "[68-wilson] of [both children]422-both children , and labeled and dated them also . Two months later , on the 3d of September , [he]68-wilson took this trio of finger - marks again . [He]68-wilson liked to have a " series , "[68-wilson] two or three " takings "[68-wilson] at intervals during the period of childhood , these to be followed by others at intervals of several years . The next day -- that is to say , on the 4th of September -- something occurred which profoundly impressed [Roxana]81-roxy . [Mr. Driscoll]83-tom missed another small sum of money -- which is a way of saying that this was not a new thing , but had happened before . In truth it had happened three times before . [Driscoll]83-tom 's patience was exhausted . [He]83-tom was [a fairly humane man toward [slaves]418-slaves and other animals]423-a fairly humane man toward slaves and other animals ; [he]83-tom was [an exceedingly humane man toward the erring of [his]83-tom own race]425-an exceedingly humane man toward the erring of his own race . Theft [he]83-tom could not abide , and plainly there was [a thief]426-a thief in [[his]83-tom house]344-his house . Necessarily [the thief]428-the thief must be [one of [[his]83-tom negroes]430-his negroes]429-one of his negroes . Sharp measures must be taken . [He]83-tom called [[his]83-tom servants]431-his servants before [him]83-tom . There were three of these , besides [Roxy]81-roxy : [a man]432-a man , [a woman]433-a woman , and [a boy twelve years old]434-a boy twelve years old . [They]435-they were not related . [Mr. Driscoll]83-tom said : " [You]435-they have all been warned before . [It]1454-it has done no good . This time [I]83-tom will teach [you]435-they a lesson . [I]83-tom will sell [the thief]428-the thief . Which of [you]435-they is [the guilty one]1456-the guilty one ? "[83-tom] [They]435-they all shuddered at the threat , for here [they]435-they had [a good home]436-a good home , and a new one was likely to be a change for the worse . The denial was general . [None]437-none had stolen anything -- not money , anyway -- a little sugar , or cake , or honey , or something like that , that " [Marse Percy]97-marse percy would n't mind or miss , "[435-they] but not money -- never a cent of money . [They]435-they were eloquent in [their]435-they protestations , but [Mr. Driscoll]83-tom was not moved by [them]435-they . [He]83-tom answered each in turn with a stern " Name [the thief]428-the thief ! "[83-tom] The truth was , all were guilty but [Roxana]81-roxy ; [she]81-roxy suspected that [the others]438-the others were guilty , but [she]81-roxy did not know [them]438-the others to be so . [She]81-roxy was horrified to think how near [she]81-roxy had come to being guilty [herself]81-roxy ; [she]81-roxy had been saved in the nick of time by a revival in [the colored Methodist Church]439-the colored methodist church , a fortnight before , at which time and place [she]81-roxy " got religion . "[81-roxy] The very next day after that gracious experience , while [her]81-roxy change of style was fresh upon [her]81-roxy and [she]81-roxy was vain of [her]81-roxy purified condition , [[her]81-roxy master]440-her master left a couple dollars lying unprotected on [his]440-her master desk , and [she]81-roxy happened upon that temptation when [she]81-roxy was polishing around with a dust - rag . [She]81-roxy looked at the money awhile with a steady rising resentment , then [she]81-roxy burst out with-- " [Dad]98-dad blame [dat revival]1458-dat revival , [I]81-roxy wisht it had ' a ' be'n put off till to - morrow ! "[81-roxy] Then [she]81-roxy covered [the tempter]441-the tempter with a book , and [another member of the kitchen cabinet]442-another member of the kitchen cabinet got it . [She]81-roxy made this sacrifice as a matter of religious etiquette ; as a thing necessary just now , but by no means to be wrested into a precedent ; no , a week or two would limber up [her]81-roxy piety , then [she]81-roxy would be rational again , and the next two dollars that got left out in the cold would find a comforter -- and [she]81-roxy could name the comforter . Was [she]81-roxy bad ? Was [she]81-roxy worse than the general run of [her]81-roxy race ? No . [They]443-they had an unfair show in the battle of life , and [they]443-they held it no sin to take military advantage of [the enemy]444-the enemy -- in a small way ; in a small way , but not in a large one . [They]443-they would smouch provisions from [the pantry]445-the pantry whenever [they]443-they got a chance ; or a brass thimble , or a cake of wax , or an emery - bag , or a paper of needles , or a silver spoon , or a dollar bill , or small articles of clothing , or any other property of light value ; and so far were [they]443-they from considering such reprisals sinful , that [they]443-they would go to [church]446-church and shout and pray the loudest and sincerest with [their]443-they plunder in [their]443-they pockets . [A farm smoke - house]447-a farm smoke - house had to be kept heavily padlocked , for even [the colored deacon]448-the colored deacon [himself]448-the colored deacon could not resist a ham when [Providence]99-providence showed [him]448-the colored deacon in a dream , or otherwise , where such a thing hung lonesome and longed for [some one to love]449-some one to love . But with a hundred hanging before [him]448-the colored deacon [the deacon]450-the deacon would not take two -- that is , on the same night . On frosty nights [the humane negro prowler]451-the humane negro prowler would warm the end of a plank and put it up under the cold claws of chickens roosting in a tree ; a drowsy hen would step on to the comfortable board , softly clucking [her]452-her gratitude , and [the prowler]453-the prowler would dump [her]452-her into [his]453-the prowler bag , and later into [his]453-the prowler stomach , perfectly sure that in taking this trifle from [the man who daily robbed [him]453-the prowler of an inestimable treasure]454-the man who daily robbed him of an inestimable treasure -- [his]453-the prowler liberty -- [he]453-the prowler was not committing any sin that [God]100-god would remember against [him]453-the prowler in the Last Great Day . " Name [the thief]428-the thief ! "[83-tom] For the fourth time [Mr. Driscoll]83-tom had said it , and always in the same hard tone . And now [he]83-tom added these words of awful import : " [I]83-tom give [you]81-roxy one minute"--he[83-tom] took out [his]83-tom watch . " If at the end of that time [you]81-roxy have not confessed , [I]83-tom will not only sell all four of [you]81-roxy , but -- [I]83-tom will sell [you]81-roxy down [the river]269-the river ! "[83-tom] It was equivalent to condemning [them]455-them to hell ! [No Missouri negro]456-no missouri negro doubted this . [Roxy]81-roxy reeled in [her]81-roxy tracks and the color vanished out of [her]81-roxy face ; [the others]438-the others dropped to [their]438-the others knees as if [they]438-the others had been shot ; tears gushed from [their]438-the others eyes , [their]438-the others supplicating hands went up , and three answers came in the one instant : " [I]438-the others done it ! "[438-the others] " [I]458-the master done it ! "[458-the master] " [I]458-the master done it!--have mercy , [marster]1461-marster -- [Lord]1462-lord have mercy on [[us]1463-us po ' niggers]1464-us po ' niggers ! "[458-the master] " Very good , "[458-the master] said [the master]458-the master , putting up [his]458-the master watch , " [I]458-the master will sell [you]1461-marster here though [you]1461-marster do n't deserve it . [You]1461-marster ought to be sold down [the river]269-the river . "[458-the master] [The culprits]459-the culprits flung [themselves]459-the culprits prone , in an ecstasy of gratitude , and kissed [his]458-the master feet , declaring that [they]459-the culprits would never forget [his]458-the master goodness and never cease to pray for [him]458-the master as long as [they]459-the culprits lived . [They]459-the culprits were sincere , for like [a god]460-a god [he]458-the master had stretched forth [his]458-the master mighty hand and closed the gates of hell against [them]459-the culprits . [He]458-the master knew , [himself]458-the master , that [he]458-the master had done a noble and gracious thing , and was privately well pleased with [his]458-the master magnanimity ; and that night [he]458-the master set the incident down in [his]458-the master diary , so that [[his]458-the master son]461-his son might read it in after years , and be thereby moved to deeds of gentleness and humanity [himself]458-the master . CHAPTER III . [Roxy]81-roxy Plays a Shrewd Trick . Whoever has lived long enough to find out what life is , knows how deep a debt of gratitude [we]462-we owe to [Adam]87-adam , [the first great benefactor of [[our]462-we race]464-our race]463-the first great benefactor of our race . [He]87-adam brought death into the world.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]68-wilson 's Calendar . [Percy Driscoll]82-percy driscoll slept well the night [he]465-he saved [[his]465-he house - minions]466-his house - minions from going down [the river]269-the river , but no wink of sleep visited [Roxy]81-roxy 's eyes . A profound terror had taken possession of [her]81-roxy . [[Her]81-roxy child]407-her child could grow up and be sold down [the river]269-the river ! The thought crazed [her]81-roxy with horror . If [she]81-roxy dozed and lost [herself]81-roxy for a moment , the next moment [she]81-roxy was on [her]81-roxy feet flying to [[her]81-roxy child]407-her child 's cradle to see if it was still there . Then [she]81-roxy would gather it to [her]81-roxy heart and pour out [her]81-roxy love upon it in a frenzy of kisses , moaning , crying , and saying , " Dey sha'n't , oh , [dey]81-roxy sha'n't!--yo ' po ' mammy will kill [you]471-the other child fust ! "[81-roxy] Once , when [she]81-roxy was tucking it back in its cradle again , [the other child]471-the other child nestled in its sleep and attracted [her]81-roxy attention . [She]81-roxy went and stood over it a long time communing with [herself]81-roxy : " What has [[my]472-she po ' baby]1466-my po ' baby done , dat [he]471-the other child could n't have [yo]471-the other child ' luck ? [He]471-the other child hain't done noth'n ' . [God]100-god was good to [you]471-the other child ; why warn't [he]100-god good to [him]471-the other child ? [Dey]81-roxy ca n't sell [you]471-the other child down [de river]1447-de river . [I]472-she hates [yo]471-the other child ' pappy ; [he]471-the other child hain't got no heart -- for [niggers]1468-niggers [he]471-the other child hain't , anyways . [I]472-she hates [him]471-the other child , en [I]472-she could kill [him]471-the other child ! "[472-she] [She]472-she paused awhile , thinking ; then [she]472-she burst into wild sobbings again , and turned away , saying , " Oh , [I]472-she got to kill [[my]472-she chile]1469-my chile , [dey]81-roxy ai n't no yuther way,--killin ' [him]471-the other child would n't save de chile fum goin' down [de river]1447-de river . Oh , [I]472-she got to do it , [yo]471-the other child ' po ' mammy 's got to kill [you]471-the other child to save [you]471-the other child , [honey"--she]101-honey"--she[472-she] gathered [[her]472-she baby]473-her baby to [her]472-she bosom , now , and began to smother it with caresses--"Mammy 's got to kill [you]471-the other child -- how kin [I]472-she do it ! But [yo]471-the other child ' mammy ai n't gwine to desert [you]471-the other child -- no , no ; dah , do n't cry -- [she]472-she gwine wid [you]471-the other child , [she]472-she gwine to kill [herself]472-she too . Come along , [honey]1471-honey , come along wid [mammy]1472-mammy ; [we]1473-we gwine to jump in [de river]1447-de river , den de troubles o ' dis worl ' is all over -- [dey]472-she do n't sell po ' niggers down [the river]269-the river over yonder . "[472-she] [She]472-she started toward the door , crooning to [the child]474-the child and hushing it ; midway [she]472-she stopped , suddenly . [She]472-she had caught sight of [her]472-she new Sunday gown -- a cheap curtain - calico thing , a conflagration of gaudy colors and fantastic figures . [She]472-she surveyed it wistfully , longingly . " [Hain't]1476-hain't ever wore it yet , "[472-she] [she]472-she said , " en it 's jist lovely . "[472-she] Then [she]472-she nodded [her]472-she head in response to a pleasant idea , and added , " No , [I]472-she ai n't gwine to be fished out , wid [everybody]367-everybody lookin ' at [me]472-she , in dis mis'able ole linsey - woolsey . "[472-she] [She]472-she put down [the child]474-the child and made the change . [She]472-she looked in the glass and was astonished at [her]472-she beauty . [She]472-she resolved to make [her]472-she death - toilet perfect . [She]472-she took off [her]472-she handkerchief - turban and dressed [her]472-she glossy wealth of hair " like [white folks]1478-white folks "[472-she] ; [she]472-she added some odds and ends of rather lurid ribbon and a spray of atrocious artificial flowers ; finally [she]472-she threw over [her]472-she shoulders a fluffy thing called a " cloud "[472-she] in that day , which was of a blazing red complexion . Then [she]472-she was ready for [the tomb]476-the tomb . [She]472-she gathered up [[her]472-she baby]473-her baby once more ; but when [her]472-she eye fell upon [its]473-her baby miserably short little gray tow - linen shirt and noted the contrast between its pauper shabbiness and [her]472-she own volcanic irruption of infernal splendors , [[her]472-she mother]478-her mother - heart was touched , and [she]472-she was ashamed . " No , [dolling]1479-dolling , mammy ai n't gwine to treat [you]1479-dolling so . [De angels]1480-de angels is gwine to ' mire [you]1479-dolling jist as much as [dey]1480-de angels does [[yo]1479-dolling ' mammy]1481-yo ' mammy . Ai n't gwine to have ['em]1480-de angels putt'n ' [dey]1480-de angels han 's up ' fo ' [dey]1480-de angels eyes en sayin ' to [David]84-wilson en [Goliah]1482-goliah en [dem]1480-de angels yuther prophets , ' Dat chile is dress ' too indelicate fo ' dis place . ' "[472-she] By this time [she]472-she had stripped off the shirt . Now [she]472-she clothed the naked little creature in one of [Thomas à Becket]83-tom 's snowy long baby - gowns , with its bright blue bows and dainty flummery of ruffles . " Dah -- now [you]474-the child 's fixed . "[472-she] [She]472-she propped [the child]474-the child in a chair and stood off to inspect [it]474-the child . Straightway [her]472-she eyes began to widen with astonishment and admiration , and [she]472-she clapped [her]472-she hands and cried out , " Why , it do beat all!--I never knowed [you]474-the child was so lovely . [Marse Tommy]102-tom ai n't a bit puttier -- not a single bit . "[472-she] [She]472-she stepped over and glanced at [the other infant]480-the other infant ; [she]472-she flung a glance back at [her]472-she own ; then one more at [the heir of [the house]247-the house]481-the heir of the house . Now a strange light dawned in [her]472-she eyes , and in a moment [she]472-she was lost in thought . [She]472-she seemed in a trance ; when [she]472-she came out of it [she]472-she muttered , " When [I]472-she ' uz a - washin ' 'em in de tub , yistiddy , [[his]83-tom own pappy]1483-his own pappy asked [me]472-she which of 'em was [his'n]1483-his own pappy . "[472-she] [She]472-she began to move about like one in a dream . [She]472-she undressed [Thomas à Becket]83-tom , stripping [him]83-tom of everything , and put the tow - linen shirt on [him]83-tom . [She]472-she put [his]83-tom coral necklace on [her]472-she [own child]483-own child 's neck . Then [she]472-she placed [the children]349-the children side by side , and after earnest inspection [she]472-she muttered-- " Now who would b'lieve clo'es could do de like o ' dat ? [Dog]103-dog [my]472-she cats if it ai n't all [I]472-she kin do to tell t'other fum which , let alone [[his]83-tom pappy]1484-his pappy . "[472-she] [She]472-she put [her]472-she cub in [Tommy]83-tom 's elegant cradle and said-- " [You]83-tom 's young [Marse Tom]102-tom fum dis out , en [I]472-she got to practise and git used to ' memberin ' to call [you]83-tom dat , [honey]1471-honey , or [I]472-she 's gwine to make a mistake some time en git [us]1486-us bofe into trouble . [Dah]1487-dah -- now [you]83-tom lay still en do n't fret no mo ' , [Marse Tom]102-tom -- oh , thank [de good Lord]1488-de good lord in heaven , [you]83-tom 's saved , [you]83-tom 's saved!--dey ai n't [no man]1489-no man kin ever sell [mammy]1472-mammy 's po ' little honey down [de river]1447-de river now ! "[472-she] [She]472-she put the heir of [the house]247-the house in [[her]472-she own child]486-her own child 's unpainted pine cradle , and said , contemplating its slumbering form uneasily-- " [I]472-she 's sorry for [you]83-tom , [honey]1471-honey ; [I]472-she 's sorry , [God]100-god knows [I]472-she is,--but what kin [I]472-she do , what could [I]472-she do ? [[Yo]83-tom ' pappy]1493-yo ' pappy would sell [him]1493-yo ' pappy to [somebody]358-somebody , some time , en den [he]1493-yo ' pappy 'd go down [de river]1447-de river , sho ' , en [I]472-she could n't , could n't , could n't stan ' it . "[472-she] [She]472-she flung [herself]472-she on [her]472-she bed and began to think and toss , toss and think . By and by [she]472-she sat suddenly upright , for a comforting thought had flown through [her]472-she worried mind-- " ' Tain't no sin -- [white folks]1478-white folks has done it ! It ai n't no sin , glory to goodness it ai n't no sin ! [Dey]1493-yo ' pappy 's done it -- yes , en [dey]1493-yo ' pappy was [de]1493-yo ' pappy biggest quality in [de]1493-yo ' pappy whole bilin ' , too -- [kings]1497-kings ! "[472-she] [She]472-she began to muse ; [she]472-she was trying to gather out of [her]472-she memory the dim particulars of some tale [she]472-she had heard some time or other . At last [she]472-she said-- " Now [I]472-she 's got it ; now [I]472-she ' member . It was [dat ole nigger preacher]1498-dat ole nigger preacher dat tole it , [de]1493-yo ' pappy time [he]1498-dat ole nigger preacher come over here fum [Illinois]1499-illinois en preached in [de nigger church]1500-de nigger church . [He]1498-dat ole nigger preacher said [dey]1493-yo ' pappy ai n't [nobody]1501-nobody kin save [his]1493-yo ' pappy own self -- can't do it by faith , ca n't do it by works , ca n't do it no way at all . Free grace is de on'y way , en dat do n't come fum [nobody]1501-nobody but jis ' [de Lord]1503-de lord ; en [he]1493-yo ' pappy kin give it to [[anybody]1438-anybody [he]1493-yo ' pappy please]1505-anybody he please , [saint]1506-saint or [sinner]1507-sinner -- [he]1493-yo ' pappy do n't kyer . [He]1493-yo ' pappy do jis ' as [he]1493-yo ' pappy 's [a mineter]1508-a mineter . [He]1493-yo ' pappy s'lect out [anybody]1438-anybody [dat]1510-dat suit [him]1493-yo ' pappy , en put another one in [his]1493-yo ' pappy place , and make [de fust one]1511-de fust one happy forever en leave t'other one to burn wid [Satan]104-satan . [De preacher]1512-de preacher said it was jist like [dey]1512-de preacher done in [Englan]26-englan ' one time , long time ago . [De queen]1513-de queen [she]1513-de queen lef ' [[her]1513-de queen baby]473-her baby layin ' aroun ' one day , en went out callin ' ; en one o ' de niggers roun'-'bout de place dat was ' mos ' white , [she]1513-de queen come in en see [de chile]105-de chile layin ' aroun ' , en tuck en put [her]1513-de queen own chile 's clo'es on [de queen 's chile]1515-de queen 's chile , en put [de queen]1513-de queen 's chile 's clo'es on [her]1513-de queen own chile , en den lef ' [her]1513-de queen own chile layin ' aroun ' en tuck en toted [[de queen]1513-de queen 's chile]1515-de queen 's chile home to de nigger - quarter , en [nobody]1501-nobody ever foun ' it out , en [[her]1513-de queen chile]1520-her chile was [de king bimeby]1521-de king bimeby , en sole [de queen 's chile]1515-de queen 's chile down [de river]1447-de river one time when [dey]1524-dey had to settle up [de estate]1525-de estate . [Dah]1526-dah , now -- [de preacher]1512-de preacher said it [his]1512-de preacher own self , en it ai n't no sin , ' ca'se [white folks]1478-white folks done it . [Dey]1524-dey done it -- yes , [dey]1524-dey done it ; en not on'y jis ' [common white folks]1529-common white folks nuther , but de biggest quality [dey]1524-dey is in [de]1524-dey whole bilin ' . Oh , [I]472-she 's so glad [I]472-she ' member 'bout dat ! "[472-she] [She]487-her got up light - hearted and happy , and went to the cradles and spent what was left of the night " practising . "[487-her] [She]487-her would give [[her]487-her own child]486-her own child a light pat and say humbly , " Lay still , [Marse Tom]102-tom , "[487-her] then give [the real Tom]489-the real tom a pat and say with severity , " Lay still , Chambers!--does [you]102-tom want [me]487-her to take somep'n ' to [you]102-tom ? "[487-her] As [she]487-her progressed with [her]487-her practice , [she]487-her was surprised to see how steadily and surely the awe which had kept [her]487-her tongue reverent and [her]487-her manner humble toward [[her]487-her young master]490-her young master was transferring itself to [her]487-her speech and manner toward [the usurper]491-the usurper , and how similarly handy [she]487-her was becoming in transferring [her]487-her motherly curtness of speech and peremptoriness of manner to [the unlucky heir of [the ancient house of [Driscoll]83-tom]493-the ancient house of driscoll]492-the unlucky heir of the ancient house of driscoll . [She]487-her took occasional rests from practising , and absorbed [herself]487-her in calculating [her]487-her chances . " [Dey'll]490-her young master sell dese niggers to - day fo ' stealin ' de money , den dey'll buy some mo ' dat do n't know de chillen -- so dat 's all right . When [I]494-i takes [de chillen]1530-de chillen out to git de air , de minute [I]494-i 's roun ' [de]494-i corner [I]494-i 's gwine to [gaum]1531-gaum [dey]494-i mouths all roun ' wid jam , den dey ca n't [nobody]1501-nobody notice [dey]494-i 's changed . Yes , [I]494-i gwineter do dat till [I]494-i 's safe , if it 's a year . "[494-i] [Dey]494-i ai n't but one man dat [I]0-i 's afeard of , en dat 's dat [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson . [Dey]106-dey calls [him]86-wilson [a pudd'nhead]1441-a pudd'nhead , en says [he]86-wilson 's [a fool]1423-a fool . [My]0-i lan ' , [dat man]497-dat man ai n't no mo ' fool den [I]0-i is ! [He]497-dat man 's [de smartes ' man]498-de smartes ' man in [dis town]499-dis town , less'n it 's [Jedge Driscoll]107-jedge driscoll or maybe [Pem Howard]107-jedge driscoll . Blame [dat man]497-dat man , [he]497-dat man worries [me]0-i wid [dem]501-dem ornery glasses o ' hisn ; [I]0-i b'lieve [he]497-dat man 's [a witch]502-a witch . But nemmine , [I]0-i 's gwine to happen aroun ' dah one o ' dese days en let on dat [I]0-i reckon [he]497-dat man wants to print [de chillen]1530-de chillen 's fingers ag'in ; en if [he]497-dat man do n't notice [dey]497-dat man 's changed , [I]0-i bound [dey]497-dat man ai n't [nobody]1501-nobody gwine to notice it , en den [I]0-i 's safe , sho ' . But [I]0-i reckon [I]0-i 'll tote along a hoss - shoe to keep off de witch - work . " [The new negroes]1533-the new negroes gave [Roxy]81-roxy no trouble , of course . [The master]458-the master gave [her]81-roxy none , for one of [his]458-the master speculations was in jeopardy , and [his]458-the master mind was so occupied that [he]458-the master hardly saw [the children]349-the children when [he]458-the master looked at [them]349-the children , and all [Roxy]81-roxy had to do was to get [them]349-the children both into a gale of laughter when [he]458-the master came about ; then [their]349-the children faces were mainly cavities exposing gums , and [he]458-the master was gone again before the spasm passed and [the little creatures]1536-the little creatures resumed a human aspect . Within a few days the fate of the speculation became so dubious that [Mr. Percy]108-mr. percy went away with [[his]108-mr. percy brother]1537-his brother [the Judge]315-the judge , to see what could be done with it . It was a land speculation as usual , and it had gotten complicated with a lawsuit . [The men]1539-the men were gone seven weeks . Before [they]1539-the men got back [Roxy]81-roxy had paid [her]81-roxy visit to [Wilson]86-wilson , and was satisfied . [Wilson]86-wilson took the finger - prints , labeled them with the names and with the date -- October the first -- put them carefully away and continued [his]86-wilson chat with [Roxy]81-roxy , who seemed very anxious that [he]86-wilson should admire the great advance in flesh and beauty which [the babies]1540-the babies had made since [he]86-wilson took [their]349-the children finger - prints a month before . [He]86-wilson complimented [their]349-the children improvement to [her]81-roxy contentment ; and as they were without any disguise of jam or other stain , [she]81-roxy trembled all the while and was miserably frightened lest at any moment [he--]86-wilson But [he]86-wilson did n't . [He]86-wilson discovered nothing ; and [she]81-roxy went [home]1541-home jubilant , and dropped all concern about the matter permanently out of [her]81-roxy mind . CHAPTER IV . The Ways of [the Changelings]109-the changelings . [Adam]87-adam and [Eve]110-eve had many advantages , but the principal one was , that [they]349-the children escaped teething.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . There is this trouble about special providences -- namely , there is so often a doubt as to which [party]1542-party was intended to be [the beneficiary]1543-the beneficiary . In the case of [the children]349-the children , the bears and [the prophet]1545-the prophet , the bears got more real satisfaction out of the episode than [the prophet]1545-the prophet did , because [they]349-the children got the children.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . This history must henceforth accommodate itself to the change which [Roxana]81-roxy has consummated , and call [the real heir]1547-the real heir "[95-chambers] [Chambers]95-chambers " and [the usurping little slave]1548-the usurping little slave "[83-tom] [Thomas]83-tom à Becket"--shortening this latter name to "[83-tom] [Tom]83-tom , " for daily use , as [the people about [him]83-tom]1549-the people about him did . "[83-tom] [Tom]83-tom " was [a bad baby]1550-a bad baby , from the very beginning of [his]83-tom usurpation . [He]83-tom would cry for nothing ; [he]83-tom would burst into storms of devilish temper without notice , and let go scream after scream and squall after squall , then climax the thing with "[83-tom] holding [his]83-tom breath"--that frightful specialty of the teething nursling , in the throes of which the creature exhausts [its]83-tom lungs , then is convulsed with noiseless squirmings and twistings and kickings in the effort to get [its]83-tom breath , while the lips turn blue and the mouth stands wide and rigid , offering for inspection one wee tooth set in the lower rim of a hoop of red gums ; and when the appalling stillness has endured until [one]345-one is sure the lost breath will never return , [a nurse]1552-a nurse comes flying , and dashes water in [the child]474-the child 's face , and -- presto ! the lungs fill , and instantly discharge a shriek , or a yell , or a howl which bursts the listening ear and surprises [the owner of it]1554-the owner of it into saying words which would not go well with a halo if [he]1554-the owner of it had one . [The baby Tom]1555-the baby tom would claw [anybody who came within reach of [his]83-tom nails , and pound anybody [he]83-tom could reach with [his]83-tom rattle]1556-anybody who came within reach of his nails , and pound anybody he could reach with his rattle . [He]83-tom would scream for water until [he]83-tom got it , and then throw cup and all on the floor and scream for more . [He]83-tom was indulged in all [his]83-tom caprices , howsoever troublesome and exasperating [they]1557-they might be ; [he]83-tom was allowed to eat anything [he]83-tom wanted , particularly things that would give [him]83-tom the stomach - ache . When [he]83-tom got to be old enough to begin to toddle about and say broken words and get an idea of what [his]83-tom hands were for , [he]83-tom was [a more consummate pest]1558-a more consummate pest than ever . [Roxy]81-roxy got no rest while [he]83-tom was awake . [He]83-tom would call for anything and everything [he]83-tom saw , simply saying "[95-chambers] Awnt it ! " ( want it ) , which was a command . When it was brought , [he]83-tom said in a frenzy , and motioning it away with [his]83-tom hands , "[95-chambers] Do n't awnt it ! do n't awnt it ! " and the moment it was gone [he]83-tom set up frantic yells of "[95-chambers] Awnt it ! awnt it ! awnt it ! " and [Roxy]81-roxy had to give wings to [her]81-roxy heels to get that thing back to [him]83-tom again before [he]83-tom could get time to carry out [his]83-tom intention of going into convulsions about it . What [he]83-tom preferred above all other things was the tongs . This was because [[his]83-tom "[95-chambers] father]1559-his " father " had forbidden [him]83-tom to have them lest [he]83-tom break windows and furniture with [them]1560-them . The moment [Roxy]81-roxy 's back was turned [he]83-tom would toddle to the presence of the tongs and say "[95-chambers] Like it ! " and cock [his]83-tom eye to one side to see if [Roxy]81-roxy was observing ; then , "[95-chambers] Awnt it ! " and cock [his]83-tom eye again ; then , "[95-chambers] Hab it ! " with another furtive glance ; and finally , "[95-chambers] Take it!"--and the prize was [his]83-tom . The next moment the heavy implement was raised aloft ; the next , there was a crash and a squall , and the cat was off on three legs to meet an engagement ; [Roxy]81-roxy would arrive just as the lamp or a window went to irremediable smash . [Tom]83-tom got all the petting , [Chambers]95-chambers got none . [Tom]83-tom got all the delicacies , [Chambers]95-chambers got mush and milk , and clabber without sugar . In consequence [Tom]83-tom was [a sickly child]1561-a sickly child and [Chambers]95-chambers was n't . [Tom]83-tom was "[95-chambers] fractious , " as [Roxy]81-roxy called it , and overbearing ; [Chambers]95-chambers was meek and docile . With all [her]81-roxy splendid common sense and practical every - day ability , [Roxy]81-roxy was [a doting fool of]1562-a doting fool of [a mother]1563-a mother . [She]81-roxy was this toward [[her]81-roxy child]407-her child -- and [she]81-roxy was also more than this : by the fiction created by [herself]81-roxy , [he]407-her child was become [[her]81-roxy master]440-her master ; the necessity of recognizing this relation outwardly and of perfecting [herself]81-roxy in the forms required to express the recognition , had moved [her]81-roxy to such diligence and faithfulness in practicing these forms that this exercise soon concreted itself into habit ; it became automatic and unconscious ; then a natural result followed : deceptions intended solely for [others]1566-others gradually grew practically into self - deceptions as well ; the mock reverence became real reverence , the mock obsequiousness real obsequiousness , the mock homage real homage ; the little counterfeit rift of separation between [imitation - slave]1567-imitation - slave and [imitation - master]1568-imitation - master widened and widened , and became an abyss , and [a very real one]1569-a very real one -- and on one side of it stood [Roxy]81-roxy , the dupe of [her]81-roxy own deceptions , and on the other stood [[her]81-roxy child]407-her child , no longer [a usurper to [her]81-roxy]1571-a usurper to her , but [[her]81-roxy accepted and recognized [master]1573-master]1572-her accepted and recognized master . [He]407-her child was [[her]81-roxy darling]419-her darling , [[her]81-roxy master]440-her master , and [her]81-roxy deity all in one , and in [her]81-roxy worship of [him]407-her child [she]81-roxy forgot who [she]81-roxy was and what [he]407-her child had been . In babyhood [Tom]83-tom cuffed and banged and scratched [Chambers]95-chambers unrebuked , and [Chambers]95-chambers early learned that between meekly bearing it and resenting it , the advantage all lay with the former policy . The few times that [his]95-chambers persecutions had moved [him]95-chambers beyond control and made [him]95-chambers fight back had cost [him]95-chambers very dear at [headquarters]1576-headquarters ; not at the hands of [Roxy]81-roxy , for if [she]81-roxy ever went beyond scolding [him]95-chambers sharply for "[95-chambers] forgitt'n ' who [[his]505-his young marster]506-his young marster was , " [she]81-roxy at least never extended [her]81-roxy punishment beyond a box on the ear . No , [Percy Driscoll]82-percy driscoll was [the person]1577-the person . [He]1577-the person told [Chambers]95-chambers that under no provocation whatever was [he]1577-the person privileged to lift [his]1577-the person hand against [[his]1577-the person little master]1578-his little master . [Chambers]95-chambers overstepped the line three times , and got three such convincing canings from [the man who was [[his]95-chambers father]1580-his father]1579-the man who was his father and did n't know it , that [he]95-chambers took [Tom]83-tom 's cruelties in all humility after that , and made no more experiments . Outside of [the house]247-the house [the two boys]1582-the two boys were together all through [their]1582-the two boys boyhood . [Chambers]95-chambers was strong beyond [his]95-chambers years , and a good fighter ; strong because [he]95-chambers was coarsely fed and hard worked about [the house]247-the house , and [a good fighter]1584-a good fighter because [Tom]83-tom furnished [him]95-chambers plenty of practice -- on [white boys whom [he]95-chambers hated and was afraid of]1585-white boys whom he hated and was afraid of . [Chambers]95-chambers was [his]95-chambers constant body - guard , to and from [school]238-school ; [he]95-chambers was present on [the playground]1587-the playground at recess to protect [his]95-chambers charge . [He]95-chambers fought [himself]95-chambers into such a formidable reputation , by and by , that [Tom]83-tom could have changed clothes with [him]95-chambers , and "[95-chambers] ridden in peace , " like [Sir Kay]111-sir kay in [Launcelot]112-launcelot 's armor . [He]95-chambers was good at games of skill , too . [Tom]83-tom staked [him]95-chambers with marbles to play "[95-chambers] keeps " with , and then took all the winnings away from [him]95-chambers . In the winter season [Chambers]95-chambers was on hand , in [Tom]83-tom 's worn - out clothes , with "[95-chambers] holy " red mittens , and "[95-chambers] holy " shoes , and pants "[95-chambers] holy " at the knees and seat , to drag a sled up [the hill]1588-the hill for [Tom]83-tom , warmly clad , to ride down on ; but [he]95-chambers never got a ride [himself]95-chambers . [He]95-chambers built [snow men]1589-snow men and [snow fortifications]1590-snow fortifications under [Tom]83-tom 's directions . [He]95-chambers was [[Tom]83-tom 's patient target]1591-tom 's patient target when [Tom]83-tom wanted to do some snowballing , but [the target]1592-the target could n't fire back . [Chambers]95-chambers carried [Tom]83-tom 's skates to [the river]269-the river and strapped them on [him]83-tom , then trotted around after [him]83-tom on the ice , so as to be on hand when wanted ; but [he]95-chambers was n't ever asked to try the skates [himself]95-chambers . In summer the pet pastime of [the boys of [Dawson 's Landing]75-dawson 's landing]1594-the boys of dawson 's landing was to steal apples , peaches , and melons from [the farmers]1595-the farmers ' fruit - wagons,--mainly on account of the risk [they]1594-the boys of dawson 's landing ran of getting [their]1594-the boys of dawson 's landing heads laid open with the butt of the [farmer]1596-farmer 's whip . [Tom]83-tom was a distinguished adept at these thefts -- by proxy . [Chambers]95-chambers did [his]95-chambers stealing , and got the peach - stones , apple - cores , and melon - rinds for [his]95-chambers share . [Tom]83-tom always made [Chambers]95-chambers go in swimming with [him]83-tom , and stay by [him]83-tom as a protection . When [Tom]83-tom had had enough , [he]83-tom would slip out and tie knots in [Chambers]95-chambers 's shirt , dip the knots in the water and make them hard to undo , then dress [himself]83-tom and sit by and laugh while [the naked shiverer]1597-the naked shiverer tugged at the stubborn knots with [his]1597-the naked shiverer teeth . [Tom]83-tom did [[his]83-tom humble comrade]1598-his humble comrade these various ill turns partly out of native viciousness , and partly because [he]83-tom hated [him]1598-his humble comrade for [his]1598-his humble comrade superiorities of physique and pluck , and for [his]1598-his humble comrade manifold cleverness . [Tom]83-tom could n't dive , for it gave [him]83-tom splitting headaches . [Chambers]95-chambers could dive without inconvenience , and was fond of doing it . [He]95-chambers excited so much admiration , one day , among [a crowd of white boys]1599-a crowd of white boys , by throwing back somersaults from the stern of [a canoe]1600-a canoe , that it wearied [Tom]83-tom 's spirit , and at last [he]95-chambers shoved the canoe underneath [Chambers]95-chambers while [he]95-chambers was in the air -- so [he]95-chambers came down on [his]95-chambers head in the canoe - bottom ; and while [he]95-chambers lay unconscious , [several of [[Tom]83-tom 's ancient adversaries]1602-tom 's ancient adversaries]1601-several of tom 's ancient adversaries saw that [their]1601-several of tom 's ancient adversaries long - desired opportunity was come , and [they]1601-several of tom 's ancient adversaries gave [the false heir]1603-the false heir such a drubbing that with [Chambers]95-chambers 's best help [he]95-chambers was hardly able to drag [himself]95-chambers [home]1541-home afterward . When [the boys]1605-the boys were fifteen and upward , [Tom]83-tom was "[95-chambers] showing off " in [the river]269-the river one day , when [he]83-tom was taken with a cramp , and shouted for help . It was a common trick with [the boys]1605-the boys -- particularly if [a stranger]401-a stranger was present -- to pretend a cramp and howl for help ; then when [the stranger]1609-the stranger came tearing hand over hand to the rescue , [the howler]1610-the howler would go on struggling and howling till [he]1610-the howler was close at hand , then replace the howl with a sarcastic smile and swim blandly away , while [the town boys]1611-the town boys assailed [the dupe]1612-the dupe with a volley of jeers and laughter . [Tom]83-tom had never tried this joke as yet , but was supposed to be trying it now , so [the boys]1605-the boys held warily back ; but [Chambers]95-chambers believed [[his]95-chambers master]1614-his master was in earnest , therefore [he]95-chambers swam out , and arrived in time , unfortunately , and saved [his]95-chambers life . This was the last feather . [Tom]83-tom had managed to endure everything else , but to have to remain publicly and permanently under such an obligation as this to [a nigger]1452-a nigger , and to [this nigger of all niggers]1616-this nigger of all niggers -- this was too much . [He]83-tom heaped insults upon [Chambers]95-chambers for "[95-chambers] pretending " to think [he]95-chambers was in earnest in calling for help , and said that [anybody but a block - headed nigger]1617-anybody but a block - headed nigger would have known [he]95-chambers was funning and left [him]95-chambers alone . [[Tom]83-tom 's enemies]1618-tom 's enemies were in strong force here , so [they]1618-tom 's enemies came out with [their]1618-tom 's enemies opinions quite freely . [They]1618-tom 's enemies laughed at [him]83-tom , and called [him]83-tom coward , [liar]1619-liar , sneak , and other sorts of pet names , and told [him]83-tom [they]1618-tom 's enemies meant to call [Chambers]95-chambers by a new name after this , and make it common in the town--"Tom[83-tom] [Driscoll]83-tom 's niggerpappy,"--to signify that [he]83-tom had had a second birth into this life , and that [Chambers]95-chambers was [the author of [his]83-tom new being]1620-the author of his new being . [Tom]83-tom grew frantic under these taunts , and shouted-- "[83-tom] Knock [their]507-their heads off , [Chambers]95-chambers ! knock [their]507-their heads off ! What do [you]95-chambers stand there with [your]95-chambers hands in [your]95-chambers pockets for ? " [Chambers]95-chambers expostulated , and said , "[95-chambers] But , [Marse Tom]102-tom , [dey]508-dey 's too many of 'em -- dey's-- " "[102-tom] Do [you]102-tom hear [me]0-i ? " "[102-tom] Please , [Marse Tom]102-tom , do n't make [me]0-i ! [Dey]508-dey 's so many of 'em dat-- " [Tom]102-tom sprang at [him]102-tom and drove [his]102-tom pocket - knife into [him]102-tom two or three times before [the boys]1605-the boys could snatch [him]102-tom away and give [the wounded lad]1622-the wounded lad a chance to escape . [He]102-tom was considerably hurt , but not seriously . If the blade had been a little longer [his]102-tom career would have ended [there]1623-there . [Tom]102-tom had long ago taught [Roxy]81-roxy "[509-her] [[her]509-her place]510-her place . " It had been many a day now since [she]81-roxy had ventured a caress or a fondling epithet in [[his]102-tom quarter]1624-his quarter . Such things , from [a "[102-tom] nigger]1625-a " nigger , " were repulsive to [him]102-tom , and [she]81-roxy had been warned to keep [her]81-roxy distance and remember who [she]81-roxy was . [She]81-roxy saw [[her]81-roxy darling]419-her darling gradually cease from being [[her]81-roxy son]1627-her son , [she]81-roxy saw that detail perish utterly ; all that was left was [master]1573-master -- master , pure and simple , and it was not a gentle mastership , either . [She]81-roxy saw [herself]81-roxy sink from the sublime height of motherhood to the somber depths of unmodified slavery . The abyss of separation between [her]81-roxy and [[her]81-roxy boy]1629-her boy was complete . [She]81-roxy was merely [[his]102-tom chattel]1630-his chattel , now , [his]102-tom convenience , [[his]102-tom dog]1631-his dog , [[his]102-tom cringing and helpless slave]1632-his cringing and helpless slave , [the humble and unresisting victim of [his]102-tom capricious temper and vicious nature]1633-the humble and unresisting victim of his capricious temper and vicious nature . Sometimes [she]81-roxy could not go to sleep , even when worn out with fatigue , because [her]81-roxy rage boiled so high over the day 's experiences with [[her]81-roxy boy]1629-her boy . [She]81-roxy would mumble and mutter to [herself--]81-roxy "[511-he] [He]511-he struck [me]0-i , en [I]0-i warn't no way to blame -- struck [me]0-i in [de]512-de face , right before [folks]513-folks . En [he]511-he 's al'ays callin ' [me]0-i nigger - wench , en hussy , en all dem mean names , when [I]0-i 's doin' de very bes ' [I]0-i kin . Oh , [Lord]514-lord , [I]0-i done so much for [him]511-he -- [I]0-i lift ' [him]511-he away up to what [he]511-he is -- en dis is what [I]0-i git for it . " Sometimes when some outrage of peculiar offensiveness stung [her]81-roxy to the heart , [she]81-roxy would plan schemes of vengeance and revel in the fancied spectacle of [his]511-he exposure to [the world]263-the world as [an imposter]1636-an imposter and [a slave]408-a slave ; but in the midst of these joys fear would strike [her]81-roxy : [she]81-roxy had made [him]511-he too strong ; [she]81-roxy could prove nothing , and -- heavens , [she]81-roxy might get sold down [the river]269-the river for [her]81-roxy pains ! So [her]81-roxy schemes always went for nothing , and [she]81-roxy laid them aside in impotent rage against the fates , and against [herself]81-roxy for playing [the fool]1639-the fool on that fatal September day in not providing [herself]81-roxy with [a witness]1640-a witness for use in the day when such a thing might be needed for the appeasing of [her]81-roxy vengeance - hungry heart . And yet the moment [Tom]102-tom happened to be good to [her]81-roxy , and kind,--and this occurred every now and then,--all [her]81-roxy sore places were healed , and [she]81-roxy was happy ; happy and proud , for this was [[her]81-roxy son]1627-her son , [[her]81-roxy nigger son]1642-her nigger son , lording it among [the whites]1643-the whites and securely avenging [their]1643-the whites crimes against [her]81-roxy race . There were two grand funerals in [[Dawson]75-dawson 's landing 's [Landing]27-landing]1644-dawson 's landing that fall -- the fall of 1845 . One was that of [Colonel Cecil Burleigh Essex]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex , the other that of [Percy Driscoll]82-percy driscoll . On [his]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex death - bed [Driscoll]82-percy driscoll set [Roxy]81-roxy free and delivered [[his]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex idolized ostensible son]1645-his idolized ostensible son solemnly into the keeping of [[his]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex brother]1537-his brother , [the Judge]315-the judge and [[his]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex wife]310-his wife . [Those childless people]1649-those childless people were glad to get [him]1645-his idolized ostensible son . [Childless people]1650-childless people are not difficult to please . [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll had gone privately to [[his]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex brother]1537-his brother , a month before , and bought [Chambers]95-chambers . [He]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex had heard that [Tom]102-tom had been trying to get [[his]102-tom father]1580-his father to sell [the boy]1653-the boy down [the river]269-the river , and [he]79-colonel cecil burleigh essex wanted to prevent the scandal -- for public sentiment did not approve of that way of treating [family servants]1655-family servants for light cause or for no cause . [Percy Driscoll]82-percy driscoll had worn [himself]82-percy driscoll out in trying to save [[his]88-judge driscoll great speculative landed estate]1656-his great speculative landed estate , and had died without succeeding . [He]88-judge driscoll was hardly in [[his]88-judge driscoll grave]1657-his grave before the boom collapsed and left [his]88-judge driscoll hitherto envied young devil of [an heir]1658-an heir [a pauper]1659-a pauper . But that was nothing ; [[his]88-judge driscoll uncle]1660-his uncle told [him]88-judge driscoll [he]88-judge driscoll should be [[his]88-judge driscoll heir]1661-his heir and have all [his]88-judge driscoll fortune when [he]88-judge driscoll died ; so [Tom]102-tom was comforted . [Roxy]81-roxy had no [home]1541-home , now ; so [she]81-roxy resolved to go around and say good - by to [[her]81-roxy friends]1663-her friends and then clear out and see [the world]263-the world -- that is to say , [she]81-roxy would go chambermaiding on [a steamboat]1665-a steamboat , the darling ambition of [her]81-roxy race and sex . [Her]81-roxy last call was on the black giant , [Jasper]90-jasper . [She]81-roxy found [him]90-jasper chopping [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson 's winter provision of wood .
