" [He]83-tom sighed and groaned an hour or more away . Then "[95-chambers] [Chambers]95-chambers " came humbly in to say that breakfast was nearly ready . "[83-tom] [Tom]83-tom " blushed scarlet to see [this aristocratic white youth]2008-this aristocratic white youth cringe to [him]83-tom , [a nigger]1452-a nigger , and call [him]2008-this aristocratic white youth "[148-young marster] [Young Marster]148-young marster . " [He]83-tom said roughly-- "[148-young marster] Get out of [my]0-i sight ! " and when [the youth]2010-the youth was gone , [he]83-tom muttered , "[148-young marster] [He]686-the nigger has done [me]0-i no harm , [poor wretch]687-poor wretch , but [he]686-the nigger is an eyesore to [me]0-i now , for [he]686-the nigger is [Driscoll]83-tom [the young gentleman]688-the young gentleman , and [I]0-i am a -- oh , [I]0-i wish [I]0-i was dead ! " A gigantic irruption , like that of [Krakatoa]46-krakatoa a few years ago , with the accompanying earthquakes , tidal waves , and clouds of volcanic dust , changes the face of the surrounding landscape beyond recognition , bringing down [the high lands]2011-the high lands , elevating [the low]2012-the low , making fair lakes where [deserts]2013-deserts had been , and [deserts where green prairies]2014-deserts where green prairies had smiled before . The tremendous catastrophe which had befallen [Tom]83-tom had changed [his]83-tom moral landscape in much the same way . Some of [[his]83-tom low places]2015-his low places [he]83-tom found lifted to ideals , some of [his]83-tom ideals had sunk to [the valleys]2016-the valleys , and lay there with the sackcloth and ashes of pumice - stone and sulphur on [their]2017-their ruined heads . For days [he]83-tom wandered in [lonely places]2018-lonely places , thinking , thinking , thinking -- trying to get [his]83-tom bearings . It was new work . If [he]83-tom met [a friend]2019-a friend , [he]83-tom found that the habit of a lifetime had in some mysterious way vanished -- [his]83-tom arm hung limp , instead of involuntarily extending the hand for a shake . It was the "[0-i] nigger " in [him]83-tom asserting its humility , and [he]83-tom blushed and was abashed . And [the "[0-i] nigger]2020-the " nigger " in [him]83-tom was surprised when [the white friend]2021-the white friend put out [his]2021-the white friend hand for a shake with [him]83-tom . [He]83-tom found [the "[0-i] nigger]2020-the " nigger " in [him]83-tom involuntarily giving [the road]2023-the road , on [the sidewalk]2024-the sidewalk , to [a white rowdy and loafer]2025-a white rowdy and loafer . When [Rowena]118-rowena , the dearest thing [his]83-tom heart knew , [the idol of [his]83-tom secret worship]2026-the idol of his secret worship , invited [him]83-tom in , [the "[0-i] nigger]2020-the " nigger " in [him]83-tom made an embarrassed excuse and was afraid to enter and sit with [the dread white folks]2028-the dread white folks on equal terms . [The "[0-i] nigger]2020-the " nigger " in [him]83-tom went shrinking and skulking here and there and yonder , and fancying it saw suspicion and maybe detection in all faces , tones , and gestures . So strange and uncharacteristic was [Tom]83-tom 's conduct that [people]388-people noticed it , and turned to look after [him]83-tom when [he]83-tom passed on ; and when [he]83-tom glanced back -- as [he]83-tom could not help doing , in spite of [his]83-tom best resistance -- and caught that puzzled expression in [a person]2031-a person 's face , it gave [him]83-tom a sick feeling , and [he]83-tom took [himself]83-tom out of view as quickly as [he]83-tom could . [He]83-tom presently came to have a hunted sense and a hunted look , and then [he]83-tom fled away to [the hill - tops]2032-the hill - tops and [the solitudes]2033-the solitudes . [He]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom that the curse of [Ham]149-ham was upon [him]83-tom . [He]83-tom dreaded [his]83-tom meals ; [the "[0-i] nigger " in [him]83-tom]2034-the " nigger " in him was ashamed to sit at [the white folks]2035-the white folks ' table , and feared discovery all the time ; and once when [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll said , "[1452-a nigger] What 's the matter with [you]689-you ? [You]689-you look as meek as [a nigger]1452-a nigger , " [he]83-tom felt as [secret murderers]2036-secret murderers are said to feel when [the accuser]2037-the accuser says , "[689-you] [Thou]691-thou art [the man]692-the man ! " [Tom]83-tom said [he]83-tom was not well , and left the table . [His]83-tom ostensible "[691-thou] aunt 's " solicitudes and endearments were become a terror to [him]83-tom , and [he]83-tom avoided them . And all the time , hatred of [[his]83-tom ostensible "[689-you] uncle]2038-his ostensible " uncle " was steadily growing in [his]83-tom heart ; for [he]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom , "[693-his] [He]693-his is white ; and [I]0-i am [his]693-his chattel , [his]693-his property , [his]693-his goods , and [he]693-his can sell [me]0-i , just as [he]693-his could [his]693-his dog . " For as much as a week after this , [Tom]83-tom imagined that [his]83-tom character had undergone a pretty radical change . But that was because [he]83-tom did not know [himself]83-tom . In several ways [his]83-tom opinions were totally changed , and would never go back to what they were before , but the main structure of [his]83-tom character was not changed , and could not be changed . One or two very important features of it were altered , and in time effects would result from this , if opportunity offered -- effects of a quite serious nature , too . Under the influence of a great mental and moral upheaval [his]83-tom character and habits had taken on the appearance of complete change , but after a while with the subsidence of the storm both began to settle toward [their]2039-their former places . [He]83-tom dropped gradually back into [his]83-tom old frivolous and easy - going ways and conditions of feeling and manner of speech , and [no familiar of [his]83-tom]2040-no familiar of his could have detected anything in [him]83-tom that differentiated [him]83-tom from [the weak and careless Tom of other days]2041-the weak and careless tom of other days . The theft - raid which [he]83-tom had made upon [the village]356-the village turned out better than [he]83-tom had ventured to hope . It produced the sum necessary to pay [his]83-tom gaming - debts , and saved [him]83-tom from exposure to [[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle and another smashing of the will . [He]83-tom and [[his]83-tom mother]575-his mother learned to like [each other]2045-each other fairly well . [She]575-his mother could n't love [him]83-tom , as yet , because there "[693-his] warn't nothing to [him]694-him , " as [she]575-his mother expressed it , but [her]575-his mother nature needed something or [somebody]358-somebody to rule over , and [he]83-tom was better than nothing . [Her]575-his mother strong character and aggressive and commanding ways compelled [Tom]83-tom 's admiration in spite of the fact that [he]83-tom got more illustrations of them than [he]83-tom needed for [his]83-tom comfort . However , as a rule [her]575-his mother conversation was made up of racy tattle about [the privacies of [the chief families of [the town]289-the town]2048-the chief families of the town]2047-the privacies of the chief families of the town ( for [she]575-his mother went harvesting among [[their]2048-the chief families of the town kitchens]2050-their kitchens every time [she]575-his mother came to [the village]356-the village ) , and [Tom]83-tom enjoyed this . It was just in [his]83-tom line . [She]575-his mother always collected [her]575-his mother half of [his]83-tom pension punctually , and [he]83-tom was always at [the haunted house]1978-the haunted house to have a chat with [her]575-his mother on these occasions . Every now and then [she]575-his mother paid [him]83-tom a visit [there]1623-there on between - days also . Occasionally [he]83-tom would run up to [St. Louis]8-st. louis for a few weeks , and at last temptation caught [him]83-tom again . [He]83-tom won a lot of money , but lost it , and with it a deal more besides , which [he]83-tom promised to raise as soon as possible . For this purpose [he]83-tom projected a new raid on [[his]83-tom town]2054-his town . [He]83-tom never meddled with [any other town]2055-any other town , for [he]83-tom was afraid to venture into [houses whose ins and outs [he]83-tom did not know and the habits of whose households [he]83-tom was not acquainted with]2056-houses whose ins and outs he did not know and the habits of whose households he was not acquainted with . [He]83-tom arrived at [the haunted house]1978-the haunted house in disguise on the Wednesday before the advent of [the twins]1762-the twins -- after writing [[his]83-tom aunt]2059-his aunt [Pratt]77-mrs. pratt that [he]83-tom would not arrive until two days after -- and lay in hiding there with [[his]83-tom mother]575-his mother until toward daylight Friday morning , when [he]83-tom went to [[[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle 's house]2062-his uncle 's house and entered by the back way with [his]83-tom own key , and slipped up to [[his]83-tom room]1973-his room , where [he]83-tom could have the use of the mirror and toilet articles . [He]83-tom had a suit of [girl]2064-girl 's clothes with [him]83-tom in a bundle as a disguise for [his]83-tom raid , and was wearing a suit of [[his]83-tom mother]575-his mother 's clothing , with black gloves and veil . By dawn [he]83-tom was tricked out for [his]83-tom raid , but [he]83-tom caught a glimpse of [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson through the window over the way , and knew that [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson had caught a glimpse of [him]83-tom . So [he]83-tom entertained [Wilson]86-wilson with some airs and graces and attitudes for a while , then stepped out of sight and resumed the other disguise , and by and by went down and out [the back way]2066-the back way and started down [town]2067-town to reconnoiter the scene of [his]83-tom intended labors . But [he]83-tom was ill at ease . [He]83-tom had changed back to [Roxy]81-roxy 's dress , with the stoop of age added to the disguise , so that [Wilson]86-wilson would not bother [himself]86-wilson about [a humble old woman]2068-a humble old woman leaving [[a neighbor]2069-a neighbor 's house]2070-a neighbor 's house by the back way in the early morning , in case [he]86-wilson was still spying . But supposing [Wilson]86-wilson had seen [him]86-wilson leave , and had thought it suspicious , and had also followed [him]86-wilson ? The thought made [Tom]83-tom cold . [He]83-tom gave up the raid for the day , and hurried back to [the haunted house]1978-the haunted house by the obscurest route [he]83-tom knew . [[His]83-tom mother]575-his mother was gone ; but [she]575-his mother came back , by and by , with the news of the grand reception at [Patsy Cooper 's]117-aunt patsy , and soon persuaded [him]83-tom that the opportunity was like a special providence , it was so inviting and perfect . So [he]83-tom went raiding , after all , and made a nice success of it while [everybody]367-everybody was gone to [Patsy Cooper]117-aunt patsy 's . Success gave [him]83-tom nerve and even actual intrepidity ; insomuch , indeed , that after [he]83-tom had conveyed [his]83-tom harvest to [[his]83-tom mother]575-his mother in [a back alley]2075-a back alley , [he]83-tom went to [the reception]2076-the reception [himself]83-tom , and added several of the valuables of [that house]262-that house to [his]83-tom takings . After this long digression [we]2078-we have now arrived once more at the point where [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson , while waiting for the arrival of [the twins]1762-the twins on that same Friday evening , sat puzzling over the strange apparition of that morning -- [a girl in [young Tom Driscoll]83-tom 's bedroom]2080-a girl in young tom driscoll 's bedroom ; fretting , and guessing , and puzzling over it , and wondering who [the shameless creature]2081-the shameless creature might be . CHAPTER XI . [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson 's Startling Discovery . There are three infallible ways of pleasing [an author]2082-an author , and the three form a rising scale of compliment : 1 , to tell [him]2082-an author [you]2083-you have read one of [his]2082-an author books ; 2 , to tell [him]2082-an author [you]2083-you have read all of [his]2082-an author books ; 3 , to ask [him]2082-an author to let [you]2083-you read the manuscript of [his]2082-an author forthcoming book . No . 1 admits [you]2083-you to [his]2082-an author respect ; No . 2 admits [you]2083-you to [his]2082-an author admiration ; No . 3 carries [you]2083-you clear into [his]2082-an author heart.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . As to the Adjective : when in doubt , strike it out.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . [The twins]1762-the twins arrived presently , and talk began . It flowed along chattily and sociably , and under its influence the new friendship gathered ease and strength . [Wilson]86-wilson got out [his]86-wilson Calendar , by request , and read a passage or two from it , which [the twins]1762-the twins praised quite cordially . This pleased [the author]2086-the author so much that [he]86-wilson complied gladly when [they]1762-the twins asked [him]86-wilson to lend [them]1762-the twins a batch of the work to read at [home]1541-home . In the course of [their]1762-the twins wide travels [they]1762-the twins had found out that there are three sure ways of pleasing [an author]2082-an author ; [they]1762-the twins were now working the best of the three . There was an interruption , now . [Young Tom Driscoll]150-tom appeared , and joined [the party]1794-the party . [He]150-tom pretended to be seeing [the distinguished strangers]2090-the distinguished strangers for the first time when [they]2090-the distinguished strangers rose to shake hands ; but this was only a blind , as [he]150-tom had already had a glimpse of [them]2090-the distinguished strangers , at the reception , while robbing [the house]247-the house . [The twins]1762-the twins made mental note that [he]150-tom was smooth - faced and rather handsome , and smooth and undulatory in [his]150-tom movements -- graceful , in fact . [Angelo]120-angelo thought [he]150-tom had a good eye ; [Luigi]119-luigi thought there was something veiled and sly about it . [Angelo]120-angelo thought [he]150-tom had a pleasant free - and - easy way of talking ; [Luigi]119-luigi thought it was more so than was agreeable . [Angelo]120-angelo thought [he]150-tom was [a sufficiently nice young man]2093-a sufficiently nice young man ; [Luigi]119-luigi reserved [his]119-luigi decision . [Tom]150-tom 's first contribution to the conversation was a question which [he]150-tom had put to [Wilson]86-wilson a hundred times before . It was always cheerily and good - naturedly put , and always inflicted a little pang , for it touched a secret sore ; but this time the pang was sharp , since [strangers]533-strangers were present . "[693-his] Well , how does the law come on ? Had a case yet ? " [Wilson]86-wilson bit [his]86-wilson lip , but answered , "[693-his] No -- not yet , " with as much indifference as [he]86-wilson could assume . [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll had generously left the law feature out of the [Wilson]86-wilson biography which [he]88-judge driscoll had furnished to [the twins]1762-the twins . [Young Tom]150-tom laughed pleasantly , and said : "[693-his] [Wilson]86-wilson 's [a lawyer]695-a lawyer , [gentlemen]1439-gentlemen , but [he]86-wilson does n't practise now . " The sarcasm bit , but [Wilson]86-wilson kept [himself]86-wilson under control , and said without passion : "[86-wilson] [I]0-i do n't practise , it is true . It is true that [I]0-i have never had a case , and have had to earn a poor living for twenty years as [an expert accountant in [a town where [I]0-i ca n't get hold of a set of books to untangle as often as [I]0-i should like . But it is also true that [I]0-i did fit [myself]0-i well for the practice of the law]698-a town where i ca n't get hold of a set of books to untangle as often as i should like . but it is also true that i did fit myself well for the practice of the law]697-an expert accountant in a town where i ca n't get hold of a set of books to untangle as often as i should like . but it is also true that i did fit myself well for the practice of the law . By the time [I]0-i was [your]699-your age , [Tom]150-tom , [I]0-i had chosen a profession , and was soon competent to enter upon it . " [Tom]150-tom winced . "[0-i] [I]0-i never got a chance to try [my]0-i hand at it , and [I]0-i may never get a chance ; and yet if [I]0-i ever do get it [I]0-i shall be found ready , for [I]0-i have kept up [my]0-i law - studies all these years . " "[0-i] That 's it ; that 's good grit ! [I]0-i like to see it . [I]0-i 've a notion to throw all [my]0-i business [your]699-your way . [My]0-i business and [your]699-your law - practice ought to make [a pretty gay team]700-a pretty gay team , [Dave]84-wilson , " and [the young fellow]2096-the young fellow laughed again . "[84-wilson] If [you]699-your will throw-- " [Wilson]84-wilson had thought of [the girl in [[Tom]150-tom 's bedroom]2098-tom 's bedroom]2097-the girl in tom 's bedroom , and was going to say , "[699-your] If [you]699-your will throw the surreptitious and disreputable part of [your]699-your business [my]0-i way , it may amount to something ; " but thought better of it and said , "[699-your] However , this matter does n't fit well in a general conversation . " "[699-your] All right , [we]701-we 'll change the subject ; [I]0-i guess [you]699-your were about to give [me]0-i another dig , anyway , so [I]0-i 'm willing to change . How 's the Awful Mystery flourishing these days ? [Wilson]84-wilson 's got a scheme for driving plain window - glass out of the market by decorating it with greasy finger - marks , and getting rich by selling it at famine prices to the crowned heads over in [Europe]32-europe to outfit [[their]702-their palaces]703-their palaces with . Fetch it out , [Dave]84-wilson . " [Wilson]84-wilson brought three of [his]84-wilson glass strips , and said-- "[0-i] [I]0-i get the subject to pass the fingers of [his]84-wilson right hand through [his]84-wilson hair , so as to get a little coating of the natural oil on them , and then press the balls of them on the glass . A fine and delicate print of the lines in the skin results , and is permanent , if it does n't come in contact with something able to rub it off . [You]699-your begin , [Tom]150-tom . " "[699-your] Why , [I]0-i think [you]0-i took [my]0-i finger - marks once or twice before . " "[0-i] Yes ; but [you]0-i were [a little boy]704-a little boy the last time , only about twelve years old . " "[0-i] That 's so . Of course [I]0-i 've changed entirely since then , and variety is what [the crowned heads]705-the crowned heads want , [I]0-i guess . " [He]0-i passed [his]0-i fingers through [his]0-i crop of short hair , and pressed them one at a time on the glass . [Angelo]120-angelo made a print of [his]120-angelo fingers on another glass , and [Luigi]119-luigi followed with the third . [Wilson]84-wilson marked the glasses with names and date , and put them away . [Tom]150-tom gave one of [his]150-tom little laughs , and said-- "[0-i] [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would n't say anything , but if variety is what [you]150-tom are after , [you]150-tom have wasted a piece of glass . The hand - print of [one twin]706-one twin is the same as the hand - print of [the fellow - twin]707-the fellow - twin . " "[707-the fellow - twin] Well , it 's done now , and [I]0-i like to have [them]708-them both , anyway , " said [Wilson]84-wilson , returning to [his]0-i place . "[0-i] But look here , [Dave]84-wilson , " said [Tom]150-tom , "[84-wilson] [you]84-wilson used to tell [people]388-people 's fortunes , too , when [you]84-wilson took [their]388-people finger - marks . [Dave]84-wilson 's just [an all - round genius]710-an all - round genius -- [a genius of the first water]711-a genius of the first water , [gentlemen]1439-gentlemen ; [a great scientist]713-a great scientist running to seed here in [this village]714-this village , [a prophet with the kind of honor that prophets]715-a prophet with the kind of honor that prophets generally get at [home]1541-home -- for here [they]717-they do n't give shucks for [his]84-wilson scientifics , and [they]717-they call [his]84-wilson skull a notion - factory -- hey , [Dave]84-wilson , ai n't it so ? But never mind ; [he]84-wilson 'll make [his]84-wilson mark some day -- finger - mark , [you]84-wilson know , [he]84-wilson - [he]84-wilson ! But really , [you]84-wilson want to let [him]84-wilson take a shy at [your]84-wilson palms once ; it 's worth twice the price of admission or [your]84-wilson money 's returned at the door . Why , [he]84-wilson 'll read [your]84-wilson wrinkles as easy as a book , and not only tell [you]84-wilson fifty or sixty things that 's going to happen to [you]84-wilson , but fifty or sixty thousand that ai n't . Come , [Dave]84-wilson , show [the gentlemen]718-the gentlemen what an inspired Jack - at - all - science [we]719-we 've got in [this town]518-this town , and do n't know it . " [Wilson]84-wilson winced under this nagging and not very courteous chaff , and [the twins]1762-the twins suffered with [him]84-wilson and for [him]84-wilson . [They]1762-the twins rightly judged , now , that the best way to relieve [him]84-wilson would be to take the thing in earnest and treat it with respect , ignoring [Tom]150-tom 's rather overdone raillery ; so [Luigi]119-luigi said-- "[719-we] [We]719-we have seen something of palmistry in [our]719-we wanderings , and know very well what astonishing things it can do . If it is n't a science , and one of the greatest of [them]721-them , too , [I]0-i do n't know what its other name ought to be . In [the Orient--]48-the orient-- " [Tom]150-tom looked surprised and incredulous . [He]150-tom said-- "[0-i] That juggling a science ? But really , [you]0-i ai n't serious , are [you]0-i ? " "[0-i] Yes , entirely so . Four years ago [we]719-we had [our]719-we hands read out to [us]719-we as if [our]719-we palms had been covered with print . " "[719-we] Well , do [you]0-i mean to say there was actually anything in it ? " asked [Tom]150-tom , [his]150-tom incredulity beginning to weaken a little . "[0-i] There was this much in it , " said [Angelo]120-angelo : "[0-i] what was told [us]719-we of [our]719-we characters was minutely exact -- [we]719-we could not have bettered it [ourselves]719-we . Next , two or three memorable things that had happened to [us]719-we were laid bare -- things which [no one present]722-no one present but [ourselves]719-we could have known about . " "[723-they] Why , it 's rank sorcery ! " exclaimed [Tom]150-tom , who was now becoming very much interested . "[723-they] And how did [they]723-they make out with what was going to happen to [you]0-i in the future ? " "[723-they] On the whole , quite fairly , " said [Luigi]119-luigi . "[723-they] Two or three of the most striking things foretold have happened since ; much the most striking one of all happened within that same year . Some of the minor prophecies have come true ; some of the minor and some of the major ones have not been fulfilled yet , and of course may never be : still , [I]0-i should be more surprised if [they]723-they failed to arrive than if [they]723-they did n't . " [Tom]150-tom was entirely sobered , and profoundly impressed . [He]150-tom said , apologetically-- "[84-wilson] [Dave]84-wilson , [I]0-i was n't meaning to belittle that science ; [I]0-i was only chaffing -- chattering , [I]0-i reckon [I]0-i 'd better say . [I]0-i wish [you]84-wilson would look at [their]723-they palms . Come , wo n't [you]84-wilson ? " "[84-wilson] Why certainly , if [you]84-wilson want [me]0-i to ; but [you]84-wilson know [I]0-i 've had no chance to become [an expert]724-an expert , and do n't claim to be one . When a past event is somewhat prominently recorded in the palm [I]0-i can generally detect that , but [minor ones]725-minor ones often escape me,--not always , of course , but often,--but [I]0-i have n't much confidence in [myself]0-i when it comes to reading the future . [I]0-i am talking as if palmistry was a daily study with [me]0-i , but that is not so . [I]0-i have n't examined half a dozen hands in the last half dozen years ; [you]84-wilson see , [the people]332-the people got to joking about it , and [I]0-i stopped to let the talk die down . [I]0-i 'll tell [you]84-wilson what [we]727-we 'll do , [Count Luigi]119-luigi : [I]0-i 'll make a try at [your]84-wilson past , and if [I]0-i have any success there -- no , on the whole , [I]0-i 'll let the future alone ; that 's really the affair of [an expert]724-an expert . " [He]0-i took [Luigi]119-luigi 's hand . [Tom]150-tom said-- "[724-an expert] Wait -- don't look yet , [Dave]84-wilson ! [Count Luigi]119-luigi , here 's paper and pencil . Set down that thing that [you]84-wilson said was the most striking one that was foretold to [you]84-wilson , and happened less than a year afterward , and give it to [me]0-i so [I]0-i can see if [Dave]84-wilson finds it in [your]84-wilson hand . " [Luigi]119-luigi wrote a line privately , and folded up the piece of paper , and handed it to [Tom]150-tom , saying-- "[84-wilson] [I]0-i 'll tell [you]84-wilson when to look at it , if [he]84-wilson finds it . " [Wilson]84-wilson began to study [Luigi]119-luigi 's palm , tracing life lines , heart lines , head lines , and so on , and noting carefully their relations with the cobweb of finer and more delicate marks and lines that enmeshed them on all sides ; [he]84-wilson felt of the fleshy cushion at the base of the thumb , and noted its shape ; [he]84-wilson felt of the fleshy side of the hand between the wrist and the base of the little finger , and noted its shape also ; [he]84-wilson painstakingly examined the fingers , observing their form , proportions , and natural manner of disposing themselves when in repose . All this process was watched by [the three spectators]2100-the three spectators with absorbing interest , [their]2100-the three spectators heads bent together over [Luigi]119-luigi 's palm , and [nobody]1501-nobody disturbing the stillness with a word . [Wilson]84-wilson now entered upon a close survey of the palm again , and [his]84-wilson revelations began . [He]84-wilson mapped out [Luigi]119-luigi 's character and disposition , [his]119-luigi tastes , aversions , proclivities , ambitions , and eccentricities in a way which sometimes made [Luigi]119-luigi wince and [the others]438-the others laugh , but [both twins]2103-both twins declared that the chart was artistically drawn and was correct . Next , [Wilson]84-wilson took up [Luigi]119-luigi 's history . [He]84-wilson proceeded cautiously and with hesitation , now , moving [his]84-wilson finger slowly along the great lines of the palm , and now and then halting it at a "[0-i] star " or some such landmark , and examining [that neighborhood]2104-that neighborhood minutely . [He]84-wilson proclaimed one or two past events , [Luigi]119-luigi confirmed [his]119-luigi correctness , and the search went on . Presently [Wilson]84-wilson glanced up suddenly with a surprised expression-- "[84-wilson] Here is a record of an incident which [you]729-you would perhaps not wish [me]0-i to-- " "[0-i] Bring it out , " said [Luigi]119-luigi , good - naturedly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i promise [you]729-you it sha'n't embarrass [me]0-i . " But [Wilson]84-wilson still hesitated , and did not seem quite to know what to do . Then [he]84-wilson said-- "[0-i] [I]0-i think it is too delicate a matter to -- to -- [I]0-i believe [I]0-i would rather write it or whisper it to [you]729-you , and let [you]729-you decide for [yourself]729-you whether [you]729-you want it talked out or not . " "[0-i] That will answer , " said [Luigi]119-luigi ; "[0-i] write it . " [Wilson]84-wilson wrote something on a slip of paper and handed it to [Luigi]119-luigi , who read it to [himself]119-luigi and said to [Tom--]151-tom-- "[0-i] Unfold [your]729-you slip and read it , [Mr. Driscoll]83-tom . " [Tom]83-tom read : "[83-tom] It was prophesied that [I]0-i would kill [a man]432-a man . It came true before the year was out . " [Tom]83-tom added , "[152-great scott] [Great Scott]152-great scott ! " [Luigi]119-luigi handed [Wilson]84-wilson 's paper to [Tom]83-tom , and said-- "[152-great scott] Now read this one . " [Tom]83-tom read : "[152-great scott] [You]729-you have killed [some one]731-some one , but whether [man]1432-man , [woman]733-woman or [child]734-child , [I]0-i do not make out . " "[0-i] [Cæsar]153-cæsar 's ghost ! " commented [Tom]83-tom , with astonishment . "[0-i] It beats anything that was ever heard of ! Why , [a man]432-a man 's own hand is [[his]432-a man deadliest enemy]736-his deadliest enemy ! Just think of that -- [a man]432-a man 's own hand keeps a record of the deepest and fatalest secrets of [his]432-a man life , and is treacherously ready to expose [him]432-a man to [any black - magic stranger that comes along]738-any black - magic stranger that comes along . But what do [you]739-you let [a person]2031-a person look at [your]739-you hand for , with that awful thing printed on it ? " "[739-you] Oh , " said [Luigi]119-luigi , reposefully , "[739-you] [I]0-i do n't mind it . [I]0-i killed [the man]692-the man for good reasons , and [I]0-i do n't regret it . " "[0-i] What were the reasons ? " "[692-the man] Well , [he]692-the man needed killing . " "[692-the man] [I]0-i 'll tell [you]739-you why [he]692-the man did it , since [he]692-the man wo n't say [himself]692-the man , " said [Angelo]120-angelo , warmly . "[692-the man] [He]692-the man did it to save [my]0-i life , that 's what [he]692-the man did it for . So it was a noble act , and not a thing to be hid in the dark . " "[692-the man] So it was , so it was , " said [Wilson]84-wilson ; "[692-the man] to do such a thing to save [a brother]742-a brother 's life is a great and fine action . " "[692-the man] Now come , " said [Luigi]119-luigi , "[692-the man] it is very pleasant to hear [you]739-you say these things , but for unselfishness , or heroism , or magnanimity , the circumstances wo n't stand scrutiny . [You]739-you overlook one detail ; suppose [I]0-i had n't saved [Angelo]120-angelo 's life , what would have become of [mine]0-i ? If [I]0-i had let [the man]692-the man kill [him]692-the man , would n't [he]692-the man have killed [me]0-i , too ? [I]0-i saved [my]0-i own life , [you]739-you see . " "[0-i] Yes , that is [your]739-you way of talking , " said [Angelo]120-angelo , "[739-you] but [I]0-i know [you]739-you -- [I]0-i do n't believe [you]739-you thought of [yourself]739-you at all . [I]0-i keep that weapon yet that [Luigi]119-luigi killed [the man]692-the man with , and [I]0-i 'll show it to [you]739-you sometime . That incident makes it interesting , and it had a history before it came into [Luigi]119-luigi 's hands which adds to its interest . It was given to [Luigi]119-luigi by [a great Indian prince]745-a great indian prince , [the Gaikowar of [Baroda]49-baroda]746-the gaikowar of baroda , and it had been in [[his]119-luigi family]747-his family two or three centuries . It killed [a good many disagreeable people who troubled that hearthstone]748-a good many disagreeable people who troubled that hearthstone at one time and another . [It]749-it is n't much too look at , except that it is n't shaped like other knives , or dirks , or whatever it may be called -- here , [I]0-i 'll draw it for [you]739-you . " [He]0-i took a sheet of paper and made a rapid sketch . "[0-i] There it is -- a broad and murderous blade , with edges like a razor for sharpness . The devices engraved on it are the ciphers or names of [its long line of [possessors]751-possessors]750-its long line of possessors -- [I]0-i had [Luigi]119-luigi 's name added in Roman letters [myself]0-i with [our]752-our coat of arms , as [you]739-you see . [You]739-you notice what a curious handle the thing has . It is solid ivory , polished like a mirror , and is four or five inches long -- round , and as thick as [a large man]753-a large man 's wrist , with the end squared off flat , for [your]739-you thumb to rest on ; for [you]739-you grasp it , with [your]739-you thumb resting on the blunt end -- so -- and lift it aloft and strike downward . [The Gaikowar]154-the gaikowar showed [us]752-our how the thing was done when [he]154-the gaikowar gave it to [Luigi]119-luigi , and before that night was ended [Luigi]119-luigi had used the knife , and [the Gaikowar]154-the gaikowar was [a man short by reason of it]754-a man short by reason of it . The sheath is magnificently ornamented with gems of great value . [You]739-you will find the sheath more worth looking at than the knife itself , of course . " [Tom]83-tom said to [himself--]83-tom "[739-you] It 's lucky [I]0-i came [here]232-here . [I]0-i would have sold that knife for a song ; [I]0-i supposed the jewels were glass . " "[0-i] But go on ; do n't stop , " said [Wilson]84-wilson . "[752-our] [Our]752-our curiosity is up now , to hear about the homicide . Tell [us]752-our about that . " "[752-our] Well , briefly , the knife was to blame for that , all around . [A native servant]756-a native servant slipped into [[our]752-our room]757-our room in [the palace]758-the palace in the night , to kill [us]752-our and steal the knife on account of the fortune incrusted on its sheath , without a doubt . [Luigi]119-luigi had it under [his]119-luigi pillow ; [we]752-our were in bed together . There was a dim night - light burning . [I]0-i was asleep , but [Luigi]119-luigi was awake , and [he]119-luigi thought [he]119-luigi detected a vague form nearing the bed . [He]119-luigi slipped the knife out of the sheath and was ready , and unembarrassed by hampering bed - clothes , for the weather was hot and [we]752-our had n't any . Suddenly [that native]759-that native rose at the bedside , and bent over [me]0-i with [his]119-luigi right hand lifted and a dirk in it aimed at [my]0-i throat ; but [Luigi]119-luigi grabbed [his]119-luigi wrist , pulled [him]119-luigi downward , and drove [his]119-luigi own knife into [the man]692-the man 's neck . That is the whole story . " [Wilson]84-wilson and [Tom]83-tom drew deep breaths , and after some general chat about the tragedy , [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson said , taking [Tom]83-tom 's hand-- "[119-luigi] Now , [Tom]83-tom , [I]0-i 've never had a look at [your]83-tom palms , as it happens ; perhaps [you]83-tom 've got some little questionable privacies that need -- hel - lo ! " [Tom]83-tom had snatched away [his]83-tom hand , and was looking a good deal confused . "[119-luigi] Why , [he]119-luigi 's blushing ! " said [Luigi]119-luigi . [Tom]83-tom darted an ugly look at [him]119-luigi , and said sharply-- "[119-luigi] Well , if [I]0-i am , it ai n't because [I]0-i 'm [a murderer]761-a murderer ! " [Luigi]119-luigi 's dark face flushed , but before [he]119-luigi could speak or move , [Tom]83-tom added with anxious haste : "[761-a murderer] Oh , [I]0-i beg a thousand pardons . [I]0-i did n't mean that ; it was out before [I]0-i thought , and [I]0-i 'm very , very sorry -- [you]762-you must forgive [me]0-i ! " [Wilson]86-wilson came to the rescue , and smoothed things down as well as [he]86-wilson could ; and in fact was entirely successful as far as [the twins]1762-the twins were concerned , for [they]1762-the twins felt sorrier for the affront put upon [him]86-wilson by [[his]86-wilson guest]2106-his guest 's outburst of ill manners than for the insult offered to [Luigi]119-luigi . But the success was not so pronounced with [the offender]2107-the offender . [Tom]83-tom tried to seem at [his]83-tom ease , and [he]83-tom went through the motions fairly well , but at bottom [he]83-tom felt resentful toward [all the three witnesses of [his]83-tom exhibition]2108-all the three witnesses of his exhibition ; in fact , [he]83-tom felt so annoyed at [them]2108-all the three witnesses of his exhibition for having witnessed it and noticed it that [he]83-tom almost forgot to feel annoyed at [himself]83-tom for placing it before [them]2108-all the three witnesses of his exhibition . However , something presently happened which made [him]83-tom almost comfortable , and brought [him]83-tom nearly back to a state of charity and friendliness . This was a little spat between [the twins]1762-the twins ; not much of a spat , but still a spat ; and before [they]1762-the twins got far with it [they]1762-the twins were in a decided condition of irritation with [each other]2045-each other . [Tom]83-tom was charmed ; so pleased , indeed , that [he]83-tom cautiously did what [he]83-tom could to increase the irritation while pretending to be actuated by more respectable motives . By [his]83-tom help the fire got warmed up to the blazing - point , and [he]83-tom might have had the happiness of seeing the flames show up , in another moment , but for the interruption of a knock on the door -- an interruption which fretted [him]83-tom as much as it gratified [Wilson]86-wilson . [Wilson]86-wilson opened the door . [The visitor]2111-the visitor was [a good - natured , ignorant , energetic , middle - aged Irishman named [John Buckstone]155-buckstone]2112-a good - natured , ignorant , energetic , middle - aged irishman named john buckstone , who was [a great politician in a small way , and always took a large share in public matters of every sort]2113-a great politician in a small way , and always took a large share in public matters of every sort . One of [the town]289-the town 's chief excitements , just now , was over the matter of rum . There was [a strong rum party]2115-a strong rum party and a strong anti - rum party . [Buckstone]155-buckstone was training with [the rum party]2116-the rum party , and [he]83-tom had been sent to hunt up [the twins]1762-the twins and invite [them]1762-the twins to attend a mass - meeting of [that faction]2118-that faction . [He]83-tom delivered [his]83-tom errand , and said [the clans]2119-the clans were already gathering in [the big hall over [the market - house]2121-the market - house]2120-the big hall over the market - house . [Luigi]119-luigi accepted the invitation cordially , [Angelo]120-angelo less cordially , since [he]119-luigi disliked [crowds]2122-crowds , and did not drink the powerful intoxicants of [America]50-america . In fact , [he]119-luigi was even [a teetotaler]2123-a teetotaler sometimes -- when it was judicious to be one . [The twins]1762-the twins left with [Buckstone]155-buckstone , and [Tom Driscoll]83-tom joined company with [them]1762-the twins uninvited . In the distance one could see a long wavering line of torches drifting down [the main street]268-the main street , and could hear the throbbing of the bass drum , the clash of cymbals , the squeaking of a fife or two , and the faint roar of remote hurrahs . The tail - end of this procession was climbing [the market - house stairs]2126-the market - house stairs when [the twins]1762-the twins arrived in [[its]2126-the market - house stairs neighborhood]2128-its neighborhood ; when [they]1762-the twins reached [the hall]1795-the hall [it]1795-the hall was full of [people , torches , smoke , noise and enthusiasm]2130-people , torches , smoke , noise and enthusiasm . [They]1762-the twins were conducted to the platform by [Buckstone]155-buckstone -- [Tom Driscoll]83-tom still following -- and were delivered to [the chairman]2131-the chairman in the midst of a prodigious explosion of welcome . When the noise had moderated a little , [the chair]2132-the chair proposed that "[762-you] [[our]763-our illustrious guests]764-our illustrious guests be at once elected , by complimentary acclamation , to membership in [[our]763-our ever - glorious organization]765-our ever - glorious organization , the paradise of the free and the perdition of [the slave]766-the slave . " This eloquent discharge opened the flood - gates of enthusiasm again , and the election was carried with thundering unanimity . Then arose a storm of cries : "[762-you] Wet [them]764-our illustrious guests down ! Wet [them]764-our illustrious guests down ! Give [them]764-our illustrious guests a drink ! " Glasses of whisky were handed to [the twins]1762-the twins . [Luigi]119-luigi waved [his]119-luigi aloft , then brought it to [his]119-luigi lips ; but [Angelo]120-angelo set [his]119-luigi down . There was another storm of cries : "[762-you] What 's the matter with [the other one]767-the other one ? " "[767-the other one] What is [the blond one]768-the blond one going back on [us]763-our for ? " "[768-the blond one] Explain ! Explain ! " [The chairman]2131-the chairman inquired , and then reported-- "[768-the blond one] [We]763-our have made an unfortunate mistake , [gentlemen]1439-gentlemen . [I]0-i find that [the Count Angelo Capello]120-angelo is opposed to [our]763-our creed -- is [a teetotaler]2123-a teetotaler , in fact , and was not intending to apply for membership with [us]763-our . [He]120-angelo desires that [we]763-our reconsider the vote by which [he]120-angelo was elected . What is the pleasure of [the house]247-the house ? " There was a general burst of laughter , plentifully accented with whistlings and cat - calls , but the energetic use of the gavel presently restored something like order . Then [a man]432-a man spoke from [the crowd]2136-the crowd , and said that while [he]432-a man was very sorry that the mistake had been made , it would not be possible to rectify it at the present meeting . According to the by - laws it must go over to the next regular meeting for action . [He]432-a man would not offer a motion , as none was required . [He]432-a man desired to apologize to [the gentleman]2137-the gentleman in the name of [the house]247-the house , and begged to assure [him]432-a man that as far as it might lie in the power of [the Sons of Liberty]2139-the sons of liberty , [his]432-a man temporary membership in [the order]2140-the order would be made pleasant to [him]432-a man . This speech was received with great applause , mixed with cries of-- "[120-angelo] That 's the talk ! " "[120-angelo] [He]120-angelo 's [a good fellow]772-a good fellow , anyway , if [he]120-angelo is [a teetotaler]2123-a teetotaler ! " "[2123-a teetotaler] Drink [his]120-angelo health ! " "[2123-a teetotaler] Give [him]120-angelo a rouser , and no heeltaps ! " Glasses were handed around , and [everybody on the platform]2141-everybody on the platform drank [Angelo]120-angelo 's health , while [the house]247-the house bellowed forth in song : For [he]120-angelo 's a jolly good fel - low , For [he]120-angelo 's a jolly good fel - low , For [he]120-angelo 's a jolly good fe - el - low,-- Which [nobody]1501-nobody can deny . [Tom Driscoll]83-tom drank . It was [his]83-tom second glass , for [he]83-tom had drunk [Angelo]120-angelo 's the moment that [Angelo]120-angelo had set it down . The two drinks made [him]83-tom very merry -- almost idiotically so -- and [he]83-tom began to take a most lively and prominent part in the proceedings , particularly in the music and cat - calls and side - remarks . [The chairman]2131-the chairman was still standing at the front , [the twins]1762-the twins at [his]2131-the chairman side . The extraordinarily close resemblance of [the brothers]1809-the brothers to [each other]2045-each other suggested a witticism to [Tom Driscoll]83-tom , and just as [the chairman]2131-the chairman began a speech [he]2131-the chairman skipped forward and said with an air of tipsy confidence to the audience-- "[774-boys] [Boys]774-boys , [I]0-i move that [he]0-i keeps still and lets [this human philopena]775-this human philopena snip [you]774-boys out a speech . " The descriptive aptness of the phrase caught [the house]247-the house , and a mighty burst of laughter followed . [Luigi]119-luigi 's southern blood leaped to the boiling - point in a moment under the sharp humiliation of this insult delivered in the presence of [four hundred strangers]2150-four hundred strangers . It was not in [the young man]2151-the young man 's nature to let the matter pass , or to delay the squaring of the account . [He]83-tom took a couple of strides and halted behind [the unsuspecting joker]2152-the unsuspecting joker . Then [he]83-tom drew back and delivered a kick of such titanic vigor that it lifted [Tom]83-tom clear over the footlights and landed [him]83-tom on the heads of [the front row of [the Sons of Liberty]2139-the sons of liberty]2153-the front row of the sons of liberty . Even [a sober person]2155-a sober person does not like to have [a human being]2156-a human being emptied on [him]2155-a sober person when [he]2155-a sober person is not doing any harm ; [a person who is not sober]2157-a person who is not sober can not endure such an attention at all . The nest of [Sons of Liberty]2158-sons of liberty that [Driscoll]83-tom landed in had not a sober bird in it ; in fact there was probably not an entirely sober one in [the auditorium]2159-the auditorium . [Driscoll]83-tom was promptly and indignantly flung on to the heads of [Sons in the next row]2160-sons in the next row , and [these Sons]2161-these sons passed [him]83-tom on toward the rear , and then immediately began to pummel [the front - row Sons who had passed [him]83-tom to [them]2161-these sons]2162-the front - row sons who had passed him to them . This course was strictly followed by bench after bench as [Driscoll]83-tom traveled in [his]83-tom tumultuous and airy flight toward the door ; so [he]83-tom left behind [him]83-tom an ever [lengthening wake of raging and plunging and fighting and swearing humanity]2163-lengthening wake of raging and plunging and fighting and swearing humanity . Down went [group after group of torches]2164-group after group of torches , and presently above the deafening clatter of the gavel , roar of angry voices , and crash of succumbing benches , rose the paralyzing cry of "[775-this human philopena] Fire ! " The fighting ceased instantly ; the cursing ceased ; for one distinctly defined moment there was a dead hush , a motionless calm , where the tempest had been ; then with one impulse [the multitude]2165-the multitude awoke to life and energy again , and went surging and struggling and swaying , this way and that , its outer edges melting away through windows and doors and gradually lessening the pressure and relieving the mass . [The fire - boys]2166-the fire - boys were never on hand so suddenly before ; for there was no distance to go , this time , [[their]2166-the fire - boys quarters]2167-their quarters being in [the rear end of [the market - house]2121-the market - house]2168-the rear end of the market - house . There was [an engine company]2170-an engine company and [a hook - and - ladder company]2171-a hook - and - ladder company . Half of each was composed of [rummies]2172-rummies and [the other half of anti - rummies]2173-the other half of anti - rummies , after the moral and political share - and - share - alike fashion of [the frontier town]2174-the frontier town of the period . [Enough anti - rummies]2175-enough anti - rummies were loafing in [quarters]2176-quarters to man the engine and the ladders . In two minutes [they]2175-enough anti - rummies had [their]2175-enough anti - rummies red shirts and helmets on -- [they]2175-enough anti - rummies never stirred officially in unofficial costume -- and as the mass meeting overhead smashed through the long row of windows and poured out upon the roof of [the arcade]2177-the arcade , [the deliverers]2178-the deliverers were ready for [them]2175-enough anti - rummies with a powerful stream of water which washed some of [them]2175-enough anti - rummies off the roof and nearly drowned [the rest]2179-the rest . But water was preferable to fire , and still the stampede from the windows continued , and still the pitiless drenching assailed [it]2121-the market - house until [the building]2180-the building was empty ; then [the fire - boys]2166-the fire - boys mounted to [the hall]1795-the hall and flooded [it]1795-the hall with water enough to annihilate forty times as much fire as there was [there]1623-there ; for [a village fire - company]2184-a village fire - company does not often get a chance to show off , and so when it does get a chance it makes the most of it . [Such citizens of [that village]2186-that village as were of a thoughtful and judicious temperament]2185-such citizens of that village as were of a thoughtful and judicious temperament did not insure against fire ; [they]2175-enough anti - rummies insured against [the fire - company]2187-the fire - company . CHAPTER XII . The Shame of [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll . Courage is resistance to fear , mastery of fear -- not absence of fear . Except [a creature]2188-a creature be part coward it is not a compliment to say it is brave ; it is merely a loose misapplication of the word . Consider the flea!--incomparably the bravest of [all the creatures of [God]100-god]2189-all the creatures of god , if ignorance of fear were courage . Whether [you]2190-you are asleep or awake [he]88-judge driscoll will attack [you]2190-you , caring nothing for the fact that in bulk and strength [you]2190-you are to [him]88-judge driscoll as are the massed armies of [the earth]2191-the earth to [a sucking child]2192-a sucking child ; [he]88-judge driscoll lives both day and night and all days and nights in the very lap of peril and the immediate presence of death , and yet is no more afraid than is [the man who walks the streets of [a city that was threatened by an earthquake ten centuries before]2194-a city that was threatened by an earthquake ten centuries before . When [we]2195-we speak of [Clive]156-clive , [Nelson]157-nelson , and [Putnam]158-putnam as men who "[2216-the great lawyer"--an] did n't know what fear was , " [we]2195-we ought always to add the flea -- and put [him]88-judge driscoll at the head of [the procession.--Pudd'nhead Wilson 's Calendar]2196-the procession.--pudd'nhead wilson 's calendar]2193-the man who walks the streets of a city that was threatened by an earthquake ten centuries before . when we speak of clive , nelson , and putnam as men who " did n't know what fear was , " we ought always to add the flea -- and put him at the head of the procession.--pudd'nhead wilson 's calendar . [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll was in bed and asleep by ten o'clock on Friday night , and [he]88-judge driscoll was up and gone a - fishing before daylight in the morning with [[his]88-judge driscoll friend]1696-his friend [Pembroke Howard]78-howard . [These two]2198-these two had been [[boys]774-boys together in [Virginia]24-virginia when [that State]2201-that state still ranked as [the chief and most imposing member of [the Union]2203-the union]2202-the chief and most imposing member of the union]2200-boys together in virginia when that state still ranked as the chief and most imposing member of the union , and [they]2198-these two still coupled the proud and affectionate adjective "[2216-the great lawyer"--an] old " with [her]1696-his friend name when [they]2198-these two spoke of [her]1696-his friend . In Missouri a recognized superiority attached to [any person who hailed from [Old Virginia]51-old virginia]2204-any person who hailed from old virginia ; and this superiority was exalted to supremacy when [a person of such nativity]2205-a person of such nativity could also prove descent from [the First Families of [that great commonwealth]2207-that great commonwealth]2206-the first families of that great commonwealth . [The Howards]145-de howards and [Driscolls]144-de driscolls were of [this aristocracy]2208-this aristocracy . In [their]2198-these two eyes it was [a nobility]2209-a nobility . [It]2209-a nobility had its unwritten laws , and they were as clearly defined and as strict as any that could be found among the printed statutes of [the land]2210-the land . The F. F. V. was born [a gentleman]306-a gentleman ; [his]306-a gentleman highest duty in life was to watch over that great inheritance and keep it unsmirched . [He]306-a gentleman must keep [his]306-a gentleman honor spotless . Those laws were [his]306-a gentleman chart ; [his]306-a gentleman course was marked out on it ; if [he]306-a gentleman swerved from it by so much as half a point of the compass it meant shipwreck to [his]306-a gentleman honor ; that is to say , degradation from [his]306-a gentleman rank as [a gentleman]306-a gentleman . These laws required certain things of [him]306-a gentleman which [his]306-a gentleman religion might forbid : then [his]306-a gentleman religion must yield -- the laws could not be relaxed to accommodate religions or anything else . Honor stood first ; and the laws defined what it was and wherein it differed in certain details from honor as defined by church creeds and by the social laws and customs of some of the minor divisions of [the globe]2213-the globe that had got crowded out when the sacred boundaries of [Virginia]24-virginia were staked out . If [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll was [the recognized first citizen of [Dawson 's Landing]75-dawson 's landing]2214-the recognized first citizen of dawson 's landing , [Pembroke Howard]78-howard was easily [[its]75-dawson 's landing recognized second citizen]2215-its recognized second citizen . [He]78-howard was called "[2216-the great lawyer"--an] [the great lawyer"--an]2216-the great lawyer"--an earned title . [He]78-howard and [Driscoll]88-judge driscoll were of the same age -- a year or two past sixty . Although [Driscoll]88-judge driscoll was a free - thinker and [Howard]78-howard [a strong and determined Presbyterian]2217-a strong and determined presbyterian , [their]2218-their warm intimacy suffered no impairment in consequence . [They]2218-their were [men whose opinions were [their]2218-their own property and not subject to revision and amendment , suggestion or criticism , by [anybody]1438-anybody , even [[their]2218-their friends]2221-their friends]2219-men whose opinions were their own property and not subject to revision and amendment , suggestion or criticism , by anybody , even their friends . The day 's fishing finished , [they]2218-their came floating down stream in [their]2218-their skiff , talking national politics and other high matters , and presently met [a skiff]2222-a skiff coming up from [town]2067-town , with [a man in [it]2222-a skiff]2224-a man in it who said : "[0-i] [I]0-i reckon [you]0-i know one of [the new twins]776-the new twins gave [[your]0-i nephew]777-your nephew a kicking last night , [Judge]88-judge driscoll ? " "[88-judge driscoll] Did what ? " "[777-your nephew] Gave [him]777-your nephew a kicking . " [The old Judge]2225-the old judge 's lips paled , and [his]2225-the old judge eyes began to flame . [He]2225-the old judge choked with anger for a moment , then [he]2225-the old judge got out what [he]2225-the old judge was trying to say-- "[777-your nephew] Well -- well -- go on ! give [me]0-i the details ! " [The man]692-the man did it . At the finish [the Judge]315-the judge was silent a minute , turning over in [his]315-the judge mind the shameful picture of [Tom]83-tom 's flight over the footlights ; then [he]315-the judge said , as if musing aloud--"H'm[777-your nephew] -- [I]0-i do n't understand it . [I]0-i was asleep at [home]1541-home . [He]777-your nephew did n't wake [me]0-i . Thought [he]777-your nephew was competent to manage [his]777-your nephew affair without [my]0-i help , [I]0-i reckon . " [His]315-the judge face lit up with pride and pleasure at that thought , and [he]315-the judge said with a cheery complacency , "[0-i] [I]0-i like that -- it 's [the true old blood]779-the true old blood -- hey , [Pembroke]78-howard ? " [Howard]78-howard smiled an iron smile , and nodded [his]78-howard head approvingly . Then [the news - bringer]2228-the news - bringer spoke again-- "[78-howard] But [Tom]83-tom beat [the twin]780-the twin on the trial . " [The Judge]315-the judge looked at [the man]692-the man wonderingly , and said-- "[83-tom] The trial ? What trial ? " "[83-tom] Why , [Tom]83-tom had [him]777-your nephew up before [Judge Robinson]159-judge robinson for assault and battery . " [The old man]2231-the old man shrank suddenly together like [one who has received a death - stroke]2232-one who has received a death - stroke . [Howard]78-howard sprang for [him]2231-the old man as [he]78-howard sank forward in a swoon , and took [him]2231-the old man in [his]78-howard arms , and bedded [him]2231-the old man on [his]2231-the old man back in [the boat]1920-the boat . [He]78-howard sprinkled water in [his]2231-the old man face , and said to [the startled visitor--]2234-the startled visitor-- "[83-tom] Go , now -- don't let [him]777-your nephew come to and find [you]159-judge robinson here . [You]159-judge robinson see what an effect [your]159-judge robinson heedless speech has had ; [you]159-judge robinson ought to have been more considerate than to blurt out such a cruel piece of slander as that . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm right down sorry [I]0-i did it now , [Mr. Howard]160-mr. howard , and [I]0-i would n't have done it if [I]0-i had thought : but it ai n't slander ; it 's perfectly true , just as [I]0-i told [him]777-your nephew . " [He]2231-the old man rowed away . Presently [the old Judge]2225-the old judge came out of [his]2225-the old judge faint and looked up piteously into the sympathetic face that was bent over [him]2225-the old judge . "[0-i] Say it ai n't true , [Pembroke]78-howard ; tell [me]0-i it ai n't true ! " [he]0-i said in a weak voice . There was nothing weak in the deep organ - tones that responded-- "[78-howard] [You]78-howard know it 's a lie as well as [I]0-i do , [old friend]781-old friend . [He]777-your nephew is of the best blood of [the Old Dominion]782-the old dominion . " "[777-your nephew] [God]100-god bless [you]78-howard for saying it ! " said [the old gentleman]2236-the old gentleman , fervently . "[78-howard] Ah , [Pembroke]78-howard , it was such a blow ! " [Howard]78-howard stayed by [[his]78-howard friend]1696-his friend , and saw [him]1696-his friend [home]1541-home , and entered [the house]247-the house with [him]1696-his friend . It was dark , and past supper - time , but [the Judge]315-the judge was not thinking of supper ; [he]315-the judge was eager to hear the slander refuted from [headquarters]1576-headquarters , and as eager to have [Howard]78-howard hear it , too . [Tom]83-tom was sent for , and [he]83-tom came immediately . [He]83-tom was bruised and lame , and was not a happy - looking object . [[His]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle made [him]83-tom sit down , and said-- "[78-howard] [We]783-we have been hearing about [your]784-you adventure , [Tom]83-tom , with a handsome lie added to it for embellishment . Now pulverize that lie to dust ! What measures have [you]784-you taken ? How does the thing stand ? " [Tom]83-tom answered guilelessly : "[785-it] [It]785-it do n't stand at all ; it 's all over . [I]0-i had [him]786-him up in [court]787-court and beat [him]786-him . [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson defended [him]786-him -- first case [he]786-him ever had , and lost it . [The judge]315-the judge fined the miserable hound five dollars for the assault . " [Howard]78-howard and [the Judge]315-the judge sprang to [their]2244-their feet with the opening sentence -- why , [neither]2245-neither knew ; then [they]2244-their stood gazing vacantly at [each other]2045-each other . [Howard]78-howard stood a moment , then sat mournfully down without saying anything . [The Judge]315-the judge 's wrath began to kindle , and [he]315-the judge burst out-- "[315-the judge] [You]784-you cur ! [[You]784-you scum]789-you scum ! [[You]784-you vermin]790-you vermin ! Do [you]784-you mean to tell [me]0-i that blood of [my]0-i race has suffered a blow and crawled to a court of law about it ? Answer [me]0-i ! " [Tom]83-tom 's head drooped , and [he]83-tom answered with an eloquent silence . [[His]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle stared at [him]83-tom with a mixed expression of amazement and shame and incredulity that was sorrowful to see . At last [he]83-tom said-- "[0-i] Which of [the twins]1762-the twins was it ? " "[119-luigi] [Count Luigi]119-luigi . " "[784-you] [You]784-you have challenged [him]119-luigi ? " "[784-you] N -- no , " hesitated [Tom]83-tom , turning pale . "[784-you] [You]784-you will challenge [him]119-luigi to - night . [Howard]78-howard will carry it . " [Tom]83-tom began to turn sick , and to show [it]2249-it . [He]83-tom turned [his]83-tom hat round and round in [his]83-tom hand , [[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle glowering blacker and blacker upon [him]83-tom as the heavy seconds drifted by ; then at last [he]0-i began to stammer , and said piteously-- "[78-howard] Oh , please do n't ask [me]0-i to do it , [uncle]615-uncle ! [He]119-luigi is a murderous devil -- [I]0-i never could -- [I]0-i -- [I'm]0-i afraid of [him]119-luigi ! " [Old Driscoll]161-old driscoll 's mouth opened and closed three times before [he]0-i could get it to perform [its office]2251-its office ; then [he]0-i stormed out-- "[119-luigi] [A coward in [[my]0-i family]249-my family]793-a coward in my family ! [A Driscoll]795-a driscoll [a coward]796-a coward ! Oh , what have [I]0-i done to deserve this infamy ! " [He]0-i tottered to [[his]0-i secretary]2252-his secretary in the corner repeating that lament again and again in heartbreaking tones , and got out of a drawer a paper , which [he]0-i slowly tore to bits scattering the bits absently in [his]0-i track as [he]0-i walked up and down [the room]1731-the room , still grieving and lamenting . At last [he]0-i said-- "[797-you] There it is , shreds and fragments once more -- [my]0-i will . Once more [you]797-you have forced [me]0-i to disinherit [you]797-you , [[you]797-you base son of [a most noble father]799-a most noble father]798-you base son of a most noble father ! Leave [my]0-i sight ! Go -- before [I]0-i spit on [you]797-you ! " [The young man]2151-the young man did not tarry . Then [the Judge]315-the judge turned to [Howard]78-howard : "[0-i] [You]797-you will be [my]0-i second , [old friend]781-old friend ? " "[797-you] Of course . " "[797-you] There is pen and paper . Draft [the cartel]801-the cartel , and lose no time . " "[802-the count] [The Count]802-the count shall have it in [his]802-the count hands in fifteen minutes , " said [Howard]78-howard . [Tom]83-tom was very heavy - hearted . [His]83-tom appetite was gone with [his]83-tom property and [his]83-tom self - respect . [He]83-tom went out the back way and wandered down [the obscure lane]2256-the obscure lane grieving , and wondering if any course of future conduct , however discreet and carefully perfected and watched over , could win back [[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle 's favor and persuade [him]83-tom to reconstruct once more that generous will which had just gone to ruin before [his]83-tom eyes . [He]83-tom finally concluded that it could . [He]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom that [he]83-tom had accomplished this sort of triumph once already , and that what had been done once could be done again . [He]83-tom would set about it . [He]83-tom would bend every energy to the task , and [he]83-tom would score that triumph once more , cost what it might to [his]83-tom convenience , limit as it might [his]83-tom frivolous and liberty - loving life . "[802-the count] To begin , " [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i , "[802-the count] [I]0-i 'll square up with the proceeds of [my]0-i raid , and then gambling has got to be stopped -- and stopped short off . It 's the worst vice [I]0-i 've got -- from [my]0-i standpoint , anyway , because it 's the one [he]803-he can most easily find out , through the impatience of [[my]0-i creditors]804-my creditors . [He]803-he thought it expensive to have to pay two hundred dollars to [them]804-my creditors for [me]0-i once . Expensive -- that ! Why , it cost [me]0-i the whole of [his]803-he fortune -- but of course [he]803-he never thought of that ; [some people]805-some people ca n't think of any but [their]805-some people own side of a case . If [he]803-he had known how deep [I]0-i am in , now , the will would have gone to pot without waiting for a duel to help . Three hundred dollars ! It 's a pile ! But [he]803-he 'll never hear of it , [I]0-i 'm thankful to say . The minute [I]0-i 've cleared it off , [I]0-i 'm safe ; and [I]0-i 'll never touch a card again . Anyway , [I]0-i wo n't while [he]803-he lives , [I]0-i make oath to that . [I]0-i 'm entering on [my]0-i last reform -- [I]0-i know it -- yes , and [I]0-i 'll win ; but after that , if [I]0-i ever slip again [I]0-i 'm gone . " CHAPTER XIII . [Tom]83-tom Stares at [Ruin]162-ruin . When [I]0-i reflect upon the number of [disagreeable people who [I]0-i know]2258-disagreeable people who i know have gone to [a better world]2259-a better world , [I]0-i am moved to lead a different life.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . October . This is one of the peculiarly dangerous months to speculate in stocks in . The others are July , January , September , April , November , May , March , June , December , August , and [February.--Pudd'nhead Wilson]163-wilson 's Calendar . Thus mournfully communing with [himself]83-tom [Tom]83-tom moped along [the lane]1895-the lane past [[Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson 's house]1986-pudd'nhead wilson 's house , and still on and on between fences inclosing [vacant country]2262-vacant country on each hand till [he]83-tom neared [the haunted house]1978-the haunted house , then [he]83-tom came moping back again , with many sighs and heavy with trouble . [He]83-tom sorely wanted cheerful company . [Rowena]118-rowena ! [His]83-tom heart gave a bound at the thought , but the next thought quieted it -- [the detested twins]2264-the detested twins would be [there]1623-there . [He]83-tom was on the inhabited side of [[Wilson]163-wilson 's house]2266-wilson 's house , and now as [he]83-tom approached [it]2266-wilson 's house [he]83-tom noticed that [the sitting - room]2267-the sitting - room was lighted . This would do ; [others]1566-others made [him]83-tom feel unwelcome sometimes , but [Wilson]163-wilson never failed in courtesy toward [him]83-tom , and a kindly courtesy does at least save [one]345-one 's feelings , even if it is not professing to stand for a welcome . [Wilson]163-wilson heard footsteps at [his]163-wilson threshold , then the clearing of a throat . Whoever goes is going to get [himself]866-himself nabbed , for [their]1762-the twins ai n't [any pawnbroker that 's going to lose the chance to--]867-any pawnbroker that 's going to lose the chance to-- " If [anybody]1438-anybody had noticed [Tom]83-tom 's face at that time , the gray - green color of it might have provoked curiosity ; but [nobody]1501-nobody did . " "[0-i] Softly , softly , " said [Wilson]86-wilson to [Blake]175-blake . " There were strong signs of a general curiosity , and [Buckstone]155-buckstone said-- "[0-i] Well , [you]0-i have whetted [us]869-us up pretty sharp , [Wilson]86-wilson , and [I]0-i 'm free to say that if [you]0-i do n't mind telling [us]869-us in confidence-- " "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i 'd as soon tell as not , [Buckstone]155-buckstone , but as long as [the twins]1762-the twins and [I]0-i agreed to say nothing about it , [we]869-us must let it stand so .
