" [The constable]2276-the constable was disappointed , and also perplexed . [He]0-i said-- "[0-i] It may all be -- yes , and [I]0-i hope it will , but [I]0-i 'm blamed if [I]0-i can see [my]0-i way through it . It 's too many for [yours]0-i truly . " The subject seemed about talked out . [Nobody]1501-nobody seemed to have anything further to offer . After a silence [the justice of the peace]2281-the justice of the peace informed [Wilson]86-wilson that [he]86-wilson and [Buckstone]155-buckstone and [the constable]2276-the constable had come as a committee , on the part of the Democratic party , to ask [him]86-wilson to run for [mayor]2283-mayor -- for [the little town]2284-the little town was about to become [a city]2285-a city and the first charter election was approaching . It was the first attention which [Wilson]86-wilson had ever received at the hands of [any party]2286-any party ; it was a sufficiently humble one , but it was a recognition of [his]86-wilson début into [the town]289-the town 's life and activities at last ; it was a step upward , and [he]86-wilson was deeply gratified . [He]86-wilson accepted , and [the committee]2288-the committee departed , followed by [young Tom]83-tom . CHAPTER XIV . [Roxana]81-roxy Insists Upon Reform . The true Southern watermelon is a boon apart , and not to be mentioned with commoner things . It is chief of [this world]1703-this world 's luxuries , king by the grace of [God]100-god over [all the fruits of [the earth]2191-the earth]2290-all the fruits of the earth . When [one]345-one has tasted it , [he]345-one knows what [the angels]2293-the angels eat . It was not a Southern watermelon that [Eve]110-eve took : [we]2294-we know it because [she]110-eve repented.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . About the time that [Wilson]86-wilson was bowing [the committee]2288-the committee out , [Pembroke Howard]78-howard was entering [the next house]2296-the next house to report . [He]78-howard found [the old Judge]2225-the old judge sitting grim and straight in [his]2225-the old judge chair , waiting . "[78-howard] Well , [Howard]78-howard -- the news ? " "[78-howard] The best in [the world]263-the world . " "[874-he] Accepts , does [he]874-he ? " and the light of battle gleamed joyously in [the Judge]315-the judge 's eye . "[874-he] Accepts ? Why , [he]874-he jumped at it . " "[874-he] Did , did [he]874-he ? Now that 's fine -- that 's very fine . [I]0-i like that . When is it to be ? " "[0-i] Now ! Straight off ! To - night ! [An admirable fellow]875-an admirable fellow -- admirable ! " "[875-an admirable fellow] Admirable ? [He]875-an admirable fellow 's [a darling]876-a darling ! Why , it 's an honor as well as a pleasure to stand up before [such a man]877-such a man . Come -- off with [you]0-i ! Go and arrange everything -- and give [him]875-an admirable fellow [my]0-i heartiest compliments . [A rare fellow]878-a rare fellow , indeed ; [an admirable fellow]875-an admirable fellow , as [you]0-i have said ! " [Howard]78-howard hurried away , saying-- "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll have [him]875-an admirable fellow in [the vacant stretch between [Wilson]86-wilson 's]880-the vacant stretch between wilson 's and [the haunted house]1978-the haunted house within the hour , and [I]0-i 'll bring [my]0-i own pistols . " [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll began to walk the floor in a state of pleased excitement ; but presently [he]0-i stopped , and began to think -- began to think of [Tom]83-tom . Twice [he]0-i moved toward [the secretary]2299-the secretary , and twice [he]0-i turned away again ; but finally [he]0-i said-- "[0-i] This may be [my]0-i last night in [the world]263-the world -- [I]0-i must not take the chance . [He]875-an admirable fellow is worthless and unworthy , but it is largely [my]0-i fault . [He]875-an admirable fellow was intrusted to [me]0-i by [[my]0-i brother]1737-my brother on [his]1737-my brother dying bed , and [I]0-i have indulged [him]875-an admirable fellow to [his]875-an admirable fellow hurt , instead of training [him]875-an admirable fellow up severely , and making [a man of [him]875-an admirable fellow]884-a man of him . [I]0-i have violated [my]0-i trust , and [I]0-i must not add the sin of desertion to that . [I]0-i have forgiven [him]875-an admirable fellow once already , and would subject [him]875-an admirable fellow to a long and hard trial before forgiving [him]875-an admirable fellow again , if [I]0-i could live ; but [I]0-i must not run that risk . No , [I]0-i must restore the will . But if [I]0-i survive the duel , [I]0-i will hide it away , and [he]875-an admirable fellow will not know , and [I]0-i will not tell [him]875-an admirable fellow until [he]875-an admirable fellow reforms , and [I]0-i see that [his]875-an admirable fellow reformation is going to be permanent . " [He]875-an admirable fellow re - drew the will , and [[his]875-an admirable fellow ostensible nephew]2300-his ostensible nephew was heir to a fortune again . As [he]875-an admirable fellow was finishing [his]875-an admirable fellow task , [Tom]83-tom , wearied with [another brooding tramp]2301-another brooding tramp , entered [the house]247-the house and went tiptoeing past the sitting - room door . [He]83-tom glanced in , and hurried on , for the sight of [[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle had nothing but terrors for [him]83-tom to - night . But [[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle was writing ! That was unusual at this late hour . What could [he]1660-his uncle be writing ? A chill of anxiety settled down upon [Tom]83-tom 's heart . Did that writing concern [him]83-tom ? [He]83-tom was afraid so . [He]83-tom reflected that when ill luck begins , it does not come in sprinkles , but in showers . [He]83-tom said [he]83-tom would get a glimpse of that document or know the reason why . [He]83-tom heard [some one]731-some one coming , and stepped out of sight and hearing . It was [Pembroke Howard]78-howard . What could be hatching ? [Howard]78-howard said , with great satisfaction : "[0-i] Everything 's right and ready . [He]885-his 's gone to the battle - ground with [[his]885-his second]886-his second and [the surgeon]887-the surgeon -- also with [[his]885-his brother]1537-his brother . [I]0-i 've arranged it all with [Wilson]86-wilson -- [Wilson]86-wilson 's [his]885-his second . [We]889-we are to have three shots apiece . " "[889-we] Good ! How is the moon ? " "[86-wilson] Bright as day , nearly . Perfect , for the distance -- fifteen yards . No wind -- not a breath ; hot and still . " "[86-wilson] All good ; all first - rate . Here , [Pembroke]78-howard , read this , and witness it . " [Pembroke]78-howard read and witnessed the will , then gave [the old man]2231-the old man 's hand a hearty shake and said : "[78-howard] Now that 's right , [York]115-mrs. york driscoll -- but [I]0-i knew [you]115-mrs. york driscoll would do it . [You]115-mrs. york driscoll could n't leave [that poor chap]890-that poor chap to fight along without means or profession , with certain defeat before [him]885-his , and [I]0-i knew [you]115-mrs. york driscoll would n't , for [[his]890-that poor chap father]1580-his father 's sake if not for [his]890-that poor chap own . " "[115-mrs. york driscoll] For [[his]890-that poor chap dead father]892-his dead father 's sake [I]0-i could n't , [I]0-i know ; for [poor Percy]82-percy driscoll -- but [you]115-mrs. york driscoll know what [Percy]82-percy driscoll was to [me]0-i . But mind -- [Tom]83-tom is not to know of this unless [I]0-i fall to - night . " "[0-i] [I]0-i understand . [I]0-i 'll keep the secret . " [The Judge]315-the judge put the will away , and [the two]1991-the two started for [the battle - ground]2309-the battle - ground . In another minute the will was in [Tom]83-tom 's hands . [His]83-tom misery vanished , [his]83-tom feelings underwent a tremendous revulsion . [He]83-tom put the will carefully back in its place , and spread [his]83-tom mouth and swung [his]83-tom hat once , twice , three times around [his]83-tom head , in imitation of three rousing huzzas , no sound issuing from [his]83-tom lips . [He]83-tom fell to communing with [himself]83-tom excitedly and joyously , but every now and then [he]83-tom let off another volley of dumb hurrahs . [He]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom : "[0-i] [I]0-i 've got the fortune again , but [I]0-i 'll not let on that [I]0-i know about it . And this time [I]0-i 'm going to hang on to it . [I]0-i take no more risks . [I]0-i 'll gamble no more , [I]0-i 'll drink no more , because -- well , because [I]0-i 'll not go where there is any of that sort of thing going on , again . It 's the sure way , and the only sure way ; [I]0-i might have thought of that sooner -- well , yes , if [I]0-i had wanted to . But now -- dear [me]0-i , [I]0-i 've had a scare this time , and [I]0-i 'll take no more chances . Not a single chance more . [Land]56-land ! [I]0-i persuaded [myself]0-i this evening that [I]0-i could fetch [him]893-he around without any great amount of effort , but [I]0-i 've been getting more and more heavy - hearted and doubtful straight along , ever since . If [he]893-he tells [me]0-i about this thing , all right ; but if [he]893-he does n't , [I]0-i sha'n't let on . [I]0-i -- well , [I]0-i 'd like to tell [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson , but -- no , [I]0-i 'll think about that ; perhaps [I]0-i wo n't . " [He]0-i whirled off another dead huzza , and said , "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm reformed , and this time [I]0-i 'll stay so , sure ! " [He]0-i was about to close with a final grand silent demonstration , when [he]0-i suddenly recollected that [Wilson]86-wilson had put it out of [his]86-wilson power to pawn or sell the Indian knife , and that [he]86-wilson was once more in awful peril of exposure by [[his]86-wilson creditors]2310-his creditors for that reason . [His]0-i joy collapsed utterly , and [he]0-i turned away and moped toward the door moaning and lamenting over the bitterness of [his]0-i luck . [He]0-i dragged [himself]0-i up - stairs , and brooded in [[his]0-i room]1973-his room a long time disconsolate and forlorn , with [Luigi]119-luigi 's Indian knife for a text . At last [he]0-i sighed and said : "[0-i] When [I]0-i supposed these stones were glass and this ivory bone , the thing had n't any interest for [me]0-i because it had n't any value , and could n't help [me]0-i out of [my]0-i trouble . But now -- why , now it is full of interest ; yes , and of a sort to break a body 's heart . It 's a bag of gold that has turned to dirt and ashes in [my]0-i hands . It could save [me]0-i , and save [me]0-i so easily , and yet [I]0-i 've got to go to ruin . It 's like drowning with a life - preserver in [my]0-i reach . All the hard luck comes to [me]0-i , and all the good luck goes to [other people]541-other people -- [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson , for instance ; even [his]86-wilson career has got a sort of a little start at last , and what has [he]86-wilson done to deserve it , [I]0-i should like to know ? Yes , [he]86-wilson has opened [[his]86-wilson own road]895-his own road , but [he]86-wilson is n't content with that , but must block [mine]0-i . It 's [a sordid , selfish world]896-a sordid , selfish world , and [I]0-i wish [I]0-i was out of it . " [He]0-i allowed the light of the candle to play upon the jewels of the sheath , but the flashings and sparklings had no charm for [his]0-i eye ; they were only just so many pangs to [his]0-i heart . "[0-i] [I]0-i must not say anything to [Roxy]81-roxy about this thing , " [he]0-i said , "[0-i] [she]81-roxy is too daring . [She]81-roxy would be for digging these stones out and selling them , and then -- why , [she]81-roxy would be arrested and the stones traced , and then-- " The thought made [him]0-i quake , and [he]0-i hid the knife away , trembling all over and glancing furtively about , like [a criminal who fancies that [the accuser]2037-the accuser is already at hand]2312-a criminal who fancies that the accuser is already at hand . Should [he]0-i try to sleep ? Oh , no , sleep was not for [him]0-i ; [his]0-i trouble was too haunting , too afflicting for that . [He]0-i must have [somebody to mourn with]2314-somebody to mourn with . [He]0-i would carry [his]0-i despair to [Roxy]81-roxy . [He]0-i had heard several distant gunshots , but that sort of thing was not uncommon , and they had made no impression upon [him]0-i . [He]0-i went out at the back door , and turned westward . [He]0-i passed [[Wilson]86-wilson 's house]2266-wilson 's house and proceeded along [the lane]1895-the lane , and presently saw [several figures]2317-several figures approaching [[Wilson]86-wilson 's place]2318-wilson 's place through [the vacant lots]398-the vacant lots . [These]2317-several figures were [the duelists]2320-the duelists returning from the fight ; [he]0-i thought [he]0-i recognized [them]2317-several figures , but as [he]0-i had no desire for [white people]403-white people 's company , [he]0-i stooped down behind the fence until [they]2317-several figures were out of [his]0-i way . [Roxy]81-roxy was feeling fine . [She]81-roxy said : "[81-roxy] Whah was [you]897-you , [child]734-child ? Warn't [you]897-you in it ? " "[81-roxy] In what ? " "[81-roxy] In de duel . " "[81-roxy] Duel ? Has there been a duel ? " "[899-dey] ' Co'se [dey]899-dey has . [De ole Jedge]176-de jedge has be'n havin' a duel wid [one o ' [dem twins]901-dem twins]900-one o ' dem twins . " "[152-great scott] [Great Scott]152-great scott ! " Then [he]0-i added to [himself]0-i : "[152-great scott] That 's what made [him]152-great scott re - make the will ; [he]152-great scott thought [he]152-great scott might get killed , and it softened [him]152-great scott toward [me]0-i . And that 's what [he]152-great scott and [Howard]78-howard were so busy about .... Oh dear , if [the twin]780-the twin had only killed [him]152-great scott , [I]0-i should be out of [my--]903-my-- " "[0-i] What is [you]897-you mumblin ' bout , [Chambers]95-chambers ? [Whah]904-whah was [you]897-you ? Did n't [you]897-you know [dey]905-dey was gwyne to be a duel ? " "[897-you] No , [I]0-i did n't . [The old man]2231-the old man tried to get [me]0-i to fight one with [Count Luigi]119-luigi , but [he]2231-the old man did n't succeed , so [I]0-i reckon [he]2231-the old man concluded to patch up [the family]1730-the family honor [himself]2231-the old man . " [He]0-i laughed at the idea , and went rambling on with a detailed account of [his]0-i talk with [the Judge]315-the judge , and how shocked and ashamed [the Judge]315-the judge was to find that [he]0-i had [a coward in [[his]0-i family]747-his family]2324-a coward in his family . [He]0-i glanced up at last , and got a shock [himself]0-i . [Roxana]81-roxy 's bosom was heaving with suppressed passion , and [she]81-roxy was glowering down upon [him]0-i with measureless contempt written in [her]81-roxy face . "[2231-the old man] En [you]908-you refuse ' to fight [a man dat kicked [you]908-you , ' stid o ' jumpin ' at de chance]909-a man dat kicked you , ' stid o ' jumpin ' at de chance ! En [you]908-you ai n't got no mo ' feelin ' den to come en tell [me]0-i , [dat]910-dat fetched [sich]911-sich a po ' low - down ornery rabbit into de worl ' ! [Pah]912-pah ! it make [me]0-i sick ! It 's de nigger in [you]908-you , dat 's what it is . Thirty - one parts o ' [you]908-you is white , en on'y [one part nigger]913-one part nigger , en dat po ' little one part is [yo]908-you ' soul . Tain't wuth savin ' ; tain't wuth totin ' out on a shovel en throwin ' in de gutter . [You]908-you has disgraced [yo]908-you ' birth . What would [[yo]908-you ' pa]914-yo ' pa think o ' [you]908-you ? It 's enough to make [him]914-yo ' pa turn in [his]914-yo ' pa grave . " The last three sentences stung [Tom]83-tom into a fury , and [he]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom that if [[his]83-tom father]1580-his father were only alive and in reach of assassination [[his]83-tom mother]575-his mother would soon find that [he]83-tom had a very clear notion of the size of [his]83-tom indebtedness to [that man]2328-that man , and was willing to pay it up in full , and would do it too , even at risk of [his]83-tom life ; but [he]83-tom kept this thought to [himself]83-tom ; that was safest in [[his]83-tom mother]575-his mother 's present state . "[914-yo ' pa] Whatever has come o ' [yo]908-you ' [Essex]146-cunnel cecil burleigh essex blood ? Dat 's what [I]0-i ca n't understan ' . En it ai n't on'y jist Essex blood dat 's in [you]908-you , not by a long sight--'deed it ai n't ! [[My]0-i great - great - great - gran'father en [yo]908-you ' great - great - great - great - [gran'father]916-gran'father]915-my great - great - great - gran'father en yo ' great - great - great - great - gran'father was [Ole Cap'n John Smith]89-john smith , [de highest blood dat Ole Virginny]177-de highest blood dat ole virginny ever turned out , en [his]89-john smith great - great - gran'mother or somers along back dah , was [Pocahontas]57-pocahontas [de Injun queen]917-de injun queen , en [her]57-pocahontas husbun ' was [a nigger king]918-a nigger king outen [Africa]58-africa -- en yit here [you]908-you is , a slinkin ' outen a duel en disgracin ' [our]919-our whole line like a ornery low - down hound ! Yes , it 's [de nigger]920-de nigger in [you]908-you ! " [She]57-pocahontas sat down on [her]57-pocahontas candle - box and fell into a reverie . [Tom]83-tom did not disturb [her]57-pocahontas ; [he]83-tom sometimes lacked prudence , but it was not in circumstances of this kind , [Roxana]81-roxy 's storm went gradually down , but it died hard , and even when it seemed to be quite gone , it would now and then break out in a distant rumble , so to speak , in the form of muttered ejaculations . One of these was , "[908-you] Ai n't [nigger]921-nigger enough in [him]89-john smith to show in [his]89-john smith finger - nails , en dat takes mighty little -- yit dey 's enough to paint [his]89-john smith soul . " Presently [she]57-pocahontas muttered . "[920-de nigger] Yassir , enough to paint a whole thimbleful of 'em . " At last [her]57-pocahontas ramblings ceased altogether , and [her]57-pocahontas countenance began to clear -- a welcome sign to [Tom]83-tom , who had learned [her]57-pocahontas moods , and knew [she]57-pocahontas was on the threshold of good - humor , now . [He]83-tom noticed that from time to time [she]57-pocahontas unconsciously carried [her]57-pocahontas finger to the end of [her]57-pocahontas nose . [He]83-tom looked closer and said : "[920-de nigger] Why , [mammy]1472-mammy , the end of [your]1472-mammy nose is skinned . How did that come ? " [She]57-pocahontas sent out the sort of whole - hearted peal of laughter which [God]100-god had vouchsafed in its perfection to none but [the happy angels in heaven]2330-the happy angels in heaven and [the bruised and broken black slave]2331-the bruised and broken black slave on [the earth]2191-the earth , and said : "[98-dad] [Dad]98-dad fetch dat duel , [I]0-i be'n in it [myself]0-i . " "[0-i] Gracious ! did a bullet do that ? " "[139-yassir] [Yassir]139-yassir , [you]139-yassir bet it did ! " "[139-yassir] Well , [I]0-i declare ! Why , how did that happen ? " "[139-yassir] Happened dis - away . [I]0-i ' uz a - sett'n ' here kinder dozin ' in de dark , en che - bang ! goes a gun , right out dah . [I]0-i skips along out towards [t'other end o ' [de house]542-de house]923-t'other end o ' de house to see what 's gwyne on , en stops by de ole winder on de side towards [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson [[Wilson]86-wilson 's house]2266-wilson 's house dat ai n't got no sash in it,--but [dey]926-dey ai n't none of 'em got any sashes , fur as dat 's concerned,--en [I]0-i stood [dah]927-dah in de dark en look out , en dar in de moonlight , right down under [me]0-i ' uz one o ' [de twins]928-de twins a - cussin'--not much , but jist a - cussin ' soft -- it ' uz de brown one dat ' uz cussin ' , ' ca'se [he]929-he ' uz hit in de shoulder . En [Doctor Claypool]178-doctor claypool [he]929-he ' uz a - workin ' at [him]929-he , en [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson [Wilson]86-wilson [he]929-he ' uz a - he'pin ' , en [ole Jedge Driscoll en Pem Howard]107-jedge driscoll ' uz a - standin ' out yonder a little piece waitin ' for ['em]930-'em to git ready agin . En treckly [dey]926-dey squared off en give de word , en bang - bang went de pistols , en [de twin]931-de twin [he]931-de twin say , ' Ouch!'--hit [him]929-he on de han ' dis time,--en [I]0-i hear dat same bullet go spat ! ag'in , de logs under [de winder]932-de winder ; en de nex ' time [dey]926-dey shoot , [de twin]931-de twin say , ' Ouch ! ' ag'in , en [I]0-i done it too , ' ca'se de bullet glance ' on [his]929-he cheek - bone en skip up here en glance on de side o ' de winder en whiz right acrost [my]0-i face en tuck [de]926-dey hide off'n [my]0-i nose -- why , if [I]0-i 'd ' a ' be'n jist a inch or a inch en a half furder ' t would ' a ' tuck [de]926-dey whole nose en disfiggered [me]0-i . Here 's [de bullet]934-de bullet ; [I]0-i hunted [her]934-de bullet up . " "[0-i] Did [you]0-i stand there all the time ? " "[0-i] [Dat]935-dat 's a question to ask , ai n't it ? What else would [I]0-i do ? Does [I]0-i git a chance to see a duel every day ? " "[0-i] Why , [you]0-i were right in range ! Were n't [you]0-i afraid ? " [The woman]1993-the woman gave a sniff of scorn . "[0-i] ' Fraid ! [De Smith]179-de smith - Pocahontases ai n't ' fraid o ' nothin' , let alone bullets . " "[179-de smith] [They]936-they 've got pluck enough , [I]0-i suppose ; what [they]936-they lack is judgment . [I]0-i would n't have stood there . " "[0-i] [Nobody]1501-nobody 's accusin ' [you]0-i ! " "[1501-nobody] Did [anybody else]938-anybody else get hurt ? " "[938-anybody else] Yes , [we]939-we all got hit ' cep ' de blon ' twin en [de doctor]940-de doctor en de seconds . [De Jedge]176-de jedge did n't git hurt , but [I]0-i hear [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson say [de bullet]934-de bullet snip some o ' [his]86-wilson ha'r off . " "[180-george] ' [George]180-george ! " said [Tom]83-tom to [himself]83-tom , "[180-george] to come so near being out of [my]0-i trouble , and miss it by an inch . Oh dear , [dear]809-dear , [he]943-he will live to find [me]0-i out and sell [me]0-i to [some nigger - trader]944-some nigger - trader yet -- yes , and [he]943-he would do it in a minute . " Then [he]83-tom said aloud , in a grave tone-- "[943-he] [Mother]181-mother , [we]939-we are in an awful fix . " [Roxana]81-roxy caught [her]81-roxy breath with a spasm , and said-- "[105-de chile] [Chile]105-de chile ! What [you]105-de chile hit a body so sudden for , like dat ? What 's be'n en gone en happen ' ? " "[943-he] Well , there 's one thing [I]0-i did n't tell [you]105-de chile . When [I]0-i would n't fight , [he]943-he tore up the will again , and-- " [Roxana]81-roxy 's face turned a dead white , and [she]81-roxy said-- "[943-he] Now [you]105-de chile 's done!--done forever ! Dat 's de end . Bofe un [us]939-we is gwyne to starve to-- " "[0-i] Wait and hear [me]0-i through , ca n't [you]105-de chile ! [I]0-i reckon that when [he]943-he resolved to fight , [himself]943-he , [he]943-he thought [he]943-he might get killed and not have a chance to forgive [me]0-i any more in this life , so [he]943-he made the will again , and [I]0-i 've seen it , and it 's all right . But-- " "[943-he] Oh , thank goodness , den [we]939-we 's safe ag'in!--safe ! en so what did [you]105-de chile want to come here en talk sich dreadful-- " "[0-i] Hold on , [I]0-i tell [you]105-de chile , and let [me]0-i finish . The swag [I]0-i gathered wo n't half square [me]0-i up , and the first thing [we]939-we know , [[my]0-i creditors]804-my creditors -- well , [you]105-de chile know what 'll happen . " [Roxana]81-roxy dropped [her]81-roxy chin , and told [[her]81-roxy son]1627-her son to leave [her]81-roxy alone -- [she]81-roxy must think this matter out . Presently [she]81-roxy said impressively : "[105-de chile] [You]105-de chile got to go mighty keerful now , [I]0-i tell [you]105-de chile ! En here 's what [you]105-de chile got to do . [He]946-he did n't git killed , en if [you]105-de chile gives [him]946-he [de]947-de least reason , [he]946-he 'll bust [de]947-de will ag'in , en dat 's de las ' time , now [you]105-de chile hear [me]0-i ! So -- [you]105-de chile 's got to show [him]946-he what [you]105-de chile kin do in [de nex]948-de nex ' few days . [You]105-de chile 's got to be pison good , en let [him]946-he see it ; [you]105-de chile got to do everything dat'll make [him]946-he b'lieve in [you]105-de chile , en [you]105-de chile got to sweeten aroun ' ole [Aunt Pratt]165-aunt mary pratt , too,--she 's pow'ful strong wid [de Jedge]176-de jedge , en [de]947-de bes ' frien ' [you]105-de chile got . [Nex]182-nex ' , [you]105-de chile 'll go ' long away to Sent [Louis]183-louis , en dat'll keep [him]946-he in [yo]105-de chile ' favor . Den [you]105-de chile go en make a bargain wid [dem people]949-dem people . [You]105-de chile tell 'em [he]946-he ai n't gwyne to live long -- en dat 's de fac ' , too,--en tell ['em]950-'em [you]105-de chile 'll pay 'em intrust , en big intrust , too,--ten per -- what [you]105-de chile call it ? " "[105-de chile] Ten per cent . a month ? " "[105-de chile] Dat 's it . [Den]579-den [you]105-de chile take and sell [yo]105-de chile ' truck aroun ' , a little at a time , en pay de intrust . How long will it las ' ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i think there 's enough to pay the interest five or six months . " "[0-i] Den [you]105-de chile 's all right . If [he]946-he do n't die in six months , [dat]952-dat do n't make no diff'rence -- [Providence'll]184-providence'll provide . [You]105-de chile 's gwyne to be safe -- if [you]105-de chile behaves . " [She]105-de chile bent an austere eye on [him]946-he and added , "[105-de chile] En [you]105-de chile is gwyne to behave -- does [you]105-de chile know dat ? " [He]946-he laughed and said [he]946-he was going to try , anyway . [She]105-de chile did not unbend . [She]105-de chile said gravely : "[105-de chile] Tryin ' ai n't de thing . [You]105-de chile 's gwyne to do it . [You]105-de chile ai n't gwyne to steal a pin--'ca'se it ai n't safe no mo ' ; en [you]105-de chile ai n't gwyne into no bad comp'ny -- not even once , [you]105-de chile understand ; en [you]105-de chile ai n't gwyne to drink a drop -- nary single drop ; en [you]105-de chile ai n't gwyne to gamble one single gamble -- not one ! Dis ai n't what [you]105-de chile 's gwyne to try to do , it 's what [you]105-de chile 's gwyne to do . En [I]0-i 'll tell [you]105-de chile how [I]0-i knows it . Dis is how . [I]0-i 's gwyne to foller along to Sent Louis [[my]0-i own self]953-my own self ; en [you]105-de chile 's gwyne to come to [me]0-i every day o ' [yo]105-de chile ' life , en [I]0-i 'll look [you]105-de chile over ; en if [you]105-de chile fails in one single one o ' dem things -- jist one -- [I]0-i take [my]0-i oath [I]0-i 'll come straight down to [dis town]499-dis town en tell [de Jedge]176-de jedge [you]105-de chile 's [a nigger]1452-a nigger en [a slave]408-a slave -- en prove it ! " [She]1817-mother paused to let [her]1817-mother words sink home . Then [she]1817-mother added , "[95-chambers] [Chambers]95-chambers , does [you]95-chambers b'lieve [me]0-i when [I]0-i says dat ? " [Tom]83-tom was sober enough now . There was no levity in [his]0-i voice when [he]0-i answered : "[95-chambers] Yes , [mother]1817-mother , [I]0-i know , now , that [I]0-i am reformed -- and permanently . Permanently -- and beyond the reach of any human temptation . " "[95-chambers] [Den g ' long home]958-den g ' long home en begin ! " CHAPTER XV . [The Robber Robbed]2335-the robber robbed . Nothing so needs reforming as [other people]541-other people 's habits.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . Behold , [the fool saith]2337-the fool saith , "[95-chambers] Put not all thine eggs in the one basket"--which is but a manner of saying , "[95-chambers] Scatter [your]959-your money and [your]959-your attention ; " but [the wise man]2338-the wise man saith , "[95-chambers] Put all [your]959-your eggs in the one basket and -- watch that basket"--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . What a time of it [Dawson]113-dawson 's Landing was having ! All [its]2339-its life it had been asleep , but now it hardly got a chance for a nod , so swiftly did big events and crashing surprises come along in one another 's wake : Friday morning , first glimpse of [Real Nobility]185-real nobility , also grand reception at [Aunt Patsy Cooper]117-aunt patsy 's , also great robber - raid ; Friday evening , dramatic kicking of [the heir of [the chief citizen]303-the chief citizen in presence of [four hundred people]2342-four hundred people]2340-the heir of the chief citizen in presence of four hundred people ; Saturday morning , emergence as [practising lawyer of [the long - submerged Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson]2343-practising lawyer of the long - submerged pudd'nhead wilson ; Saturday night , duel between [chief citizen]2344-chief citizen and [titled stranger]2345-titled stranger . [The people]332-the people took more pride in the duel than in all the other events put together , perhaps . It was a glory to [[their]332-the people town]2347-their town to have such a thing happen [there]1623-there . In [their]332-the people eyes [the principals]2349-the principals had reached the summit of human honor . [Everybody]367-everybody paid homage to [their]367-everybody names ; [their]367-everybody praises were in all mouths . Even [[the duelists]2320-the duelists ' subordinates]2352-the duelists ' subordinates came in for a handsome share of the public approbation : wherefore [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson was suddenly become [a man of consequence]2353-a man of consequence . When asked to run for the mayoralty Saturday night [he]86-wilson was risking defeat , but Sunday morning found [him]86-wilson [a made man]2354-a made man and [his]86-wilson success assured . [The twins]1762-the twins were prodigiously great , now ; [the town]289-the town took [them]1762-the twins to [its]289-the town bosom with enthusiasm . Day after day , and night after night , [they]1762-the twins went dining and visiting from [house]2357-house to [house]2357-house , making [friends]1786-friends , enlarging and solidifying [their]1762-the twins popularity , and charming and surprising all with [their]1762-the twins musical prodigies , and now and then heightening the effects with samples of what [they]1762-the twins could do in other directions , out of [their]1762-the twins stock of rare and curious accomplishments . [They]1762-the twins were so pleased that [they]1762-the twins gave the regulation thirty days ' notice , the required preparation for citizenship , and resolved to finish [their]1762-the twins days in [this pleasant place]2360-this pleasant place . That was the climax . [The delighted community]2361-the delighted community rose as [one man]2362-one man and applauded ; and when [the twins]1762-the twins were asked to stand for seats in [the forthcoming aldermanic board]2364-the forthcoming aldermanic board , and consented , the public contentment was rounded and complete . [Tom Driscoll]83-tom was not happy over these things ; they sunk deep , and hurt all the way down . [He]83-tom hated [the one twin]2365-the one twin for kicking [him]83-tom , and [the other one]767-the other one for being [[the kicker]2367-the kicker 's brother]2368-the kicker 's brother . Now and then [the people]332-the people wondered why nothing was heard of [the raider]2370-the raider , or of the stolen knife or the other plunder , but [nobody]1501-nobody was able to throw any light on that matter . Nearly a week had drifted by , and still the thing remained a vexed mystery . On Saturday [Constable Blake]175-blake and [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson met on [the street]274-the street , and [Tom Driscoll]83-tom joined [them]1762-the twins in time to open [their]1762-the twins conversation for [them]1762-the twins . [He]83-tom said to [Blake--"You]186-blake--"you[95-chambers] are not looking well , [Blake]175-blake ; [you]175-blake seem to be annoyed about something . Has anything gone wrong in the detective business ? [I]0-i believe [you]175-blake fairly and justifiably claim to have a pretty good reputation in that line , is n't it so?"--which made [Blake]175-blake feel good , and look it ; but [Tom]83-tom added , "[2373-a country detective"--which] for [a country detective"--which]2373-a country detective"--which made [Blake]175-blake feel the other way , and not only look it , but betray it in [his]83-tom voice-- "[2373-a country detective"--which] Yes , [sir]1436-sir , [I]0-i have got a reputation ; and it 's as good as [anybody]1438-anybody 's in the profession , too , [country]962-country or [no country]963-no country . " "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i beg pardon ; [I]0-i did n't mean any offense . What [I]0-i started out to ask was only about [the old woman that raided [the town]289-the town]964-the old woman that raided the town -- [the stoop - shouldered old woman]966-the stoop - shouldered old woman , [you]175-blake know , that [you]175-blake said [you]175-blake were going to catch ; and [I]0-i knew [you]175-blake would , too , because [you]175-blake have the reputation of never boasting , and -- well , [you]175-blake -- [you've]175-blake caught [the old woman]862-the old woman ? " "[175-blake] D------ [the old woman]862-the old woman ! " "[862-the old woman] Why , [sho]969-sho ! [you]969-sho do n't mean to say [you]969-sho have n't caught [her]862-the old woman ? " "[969-sho] No ; [I]0-i have n't caught [her]862-the old woman . If [anybody]1438-anybody could have caught [her]862-the old woman , [I]0-i could ; but [nobody]1501-nobody could n't , [I]0-i do n't care who [he]1438-anybody is . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry , real sorry -- for [your]969-sho sake ; because , when it gets around that [a detective]972-a detective has expressed [himself]972-a detective so confidently , and then-- " "[972-a detective] Do n't [you]969-sho worry , that 's all -- don't [you]969-sho worry ; and as for [the town]289-the town , [the town]289-the town need n't worry , either . [She]862-the old woman 's [my]0-i meat -- make [yourself]969-sho easy about that . [I]0-i 'm on [her]862-the old woman track ; [I]0-i 've got clues that-- " "[862-the old woman] That 's good ! Now if [you]969-sho could get [an old veteran detective]975-an old veteran detective down from [St. Louis]8-st. louis to help [you]969-sho find out what the clues mean , and where they lead to , and then-- " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm plenty veteran enough [myself]0-i , and [I]0-i do n't need [anybody]1438-anybody 's help . [I]0-i 'll have [her]862-the old woman inside of a [we]977-we -- inside of a month . That [I]0-i 'll swear to ! " [Tom]83-tom said carelessly-- "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose that will answer -- yes , that will answer . But [I]0-i reckon [she]862-the old woman is pretty old , and [old people]978-old people do n't often outlive the cautious pace of [the professional detective]979-the professional detective when [he]979-the professional detective has got [his]979-the professional detective clues together and is out on [his]979-the professional detective still - hunt . " [Blake]175-blake 's dull face flushed under this gibe , but before [he]175-blake could set [his]175-blake retort in order [Tom]83-tom had turned to [Wilson]86-wilson , and was saying , with placid indifference of manner and voice-- "[980-who got the reward] [Who got the reward]980-who got the reward , [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson ? " [Wilson]86-wilson winced slightly , and saw that [his]86-wilson own turn was come . "[980-who got the reward] What reward ? " "[980-who got the reward] Why , the reward for [the thief]428-the thief , and the other one for the knife . " [Wilson]86-wilson answered -- and rather uncomfortably , to judge by [his]86-wilson hesitating fashion of delivering [himself--]2374-himself-- "[980-who got the reward] Well , the -- well , in fact , [nobody]1501-nobody has claimed it yet . " [Tom]83-tom seemed surprised . "[1501-nobody] Why , is that so ? " [Wilson]86-wilson showed a trifle of irritation when [he]86-wilson replied-- "[1501-nobody] Yes , it 's so . And what of it ? " "[1501-nobody] Oh , nothing . Only [I]0-i thought [you]0-i had struck out a new idea , and invented a scheme that was going to revolutionize the time - worn and ineffectual methods of the-- " [He]0-i stopped , and turned to [Blake]175-blake , who was happy now that another had taken [his]175-blake place on the gridiron : "[175-blake] [Blake]175-blake , did n't [you]175-blake understand [him]175-blake to intimate that it would n't be necessary for [you]175-blake to hunt [the old woman]862-the old woman down ? " "[175-blake] B'George , [he]175-blake said [he]175-blake 'd have [thief]984-thief and swag both inside of three days -- [he]175-blake did , by hokey ! and that 's just about a week ago . Why , [I]0-i said at the time that [no thief]985-no thief and [no thief 's pal]986-no thief 's pal was going to try to pawn or sell a thing where [he]175-blake knowed [the pawnbroker]987-the pawnbroker could get both rewards by taking [him]175-blake into [camp]988-camp with [the swag]989-the swag . It was the blessedest idea that ever [I]0-i struck ! " "[0-i] [You]175-blake 'd change [your]175-blake mind , " said [Wilson]86-wilson , with irritated bluntness , "[175-blake] if [you]175-blake knew the entire scheme instead of only part of it . " "[175-blake] Well , " said [the constable]2276-the constable , pensively , "[175-blake] [I]0-i had the idea that it would n't work , and up to now [I]0-i 'm right anyway . " "[0-i] Very well , then , let it stand at that , and give it a further show . [It]990-it has worked at least as well as [your]175-blake own methods , [you]175-blake perceive . " [The constable]2276-the constable had n't anything handy to hit back with , so [he]2276-the constable discharged a discontented sniff , and said nothing . After the night that [Wilson]86-wilson had partly revealed [his]86-wilson scheme at [[his]86-wilson house]344-his house , [Tom]83-tom had tried for several days to guess out the secret of the rest of it , but had failed . Then it occurred to [him]83-tom to give [Roxana]81-roxy 's smarter head a chance at it . [He]83-tom made up a supposititious case , and laid it before [her]991-her . [She]991-her thought it over , and delivered [her]991-her verdict upon it . [Tom]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom , "[991-her] [She]991-her 's hit it , sure ! " [He]83-tom thought [he]83-tom would test that verdict , now , and watch [Wilson]86-wilson 's face ; so [he]83-tom said reflectively-- "[86-wilson] [Wilson]86-wilson , [you]86-wilson 're not [a fool]1423-a fool -- a fact of recent discovery . Whatever [your]86-wilson scheme was , it had sense in it , [Blake]175-blake 's opinion to the contrary notwithstanding . [I]0-i do n't ask [you]86-wilson to reveal it , but [I]0-i will suppose a case -- a case which will answer as a starting - point for the real thing [I]0-i am going to come at , and that 's all [I]0-i want . [You]86-wilson offered five hundred dollars for the knife , and five hundred for [the thief]428-the thief . [We]994-we will suppose , for argument 's sake , that the first reward is advertised and the second offered by private letter to [pawnbrokers]861-pawnbrokers and-- " [Blake]175-blake slapped [his]175-blake thigh , and cried out-- "[187-jackson] By [Jackson]187-jackson , [he]175-blake 's got [you]86-wilson , [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson ! Now why could n't [I]0-i or [any fool]996-any fool have thought of that ? " [Wilson]86-wilson said to [himself]86-wilson , "[0-i] [Anybody with a reasonably good head]997-anybody with a reasonably good head would have thought of it . " [He]86-wilson said nothing aloud , and [Tom]83-tom went on : "[428-the thief] Very well . [The thief]428-the thief would not suspect that there was a trap , and [he]428-the thief would bring or send the knife , and say [he]428-the thief bought it for a song , or found it in [the road]2023-the road , or something like that , and try to collect the reward , and be arrested -- wouldn't [he]428-the thief ? " "[428-the thief] Yes , " said [Wilson]86-wilson . "[428-the thief] [I]0-i think so , " said [Tom]83-tom . "[0-i] There ca n't be any doubt of it . Have [you]0-i ever seen that knife ? " "[0-i] No . " "[0-i] Has [any friend of yours]1000-any friend of yours ? " "[1000-any friend of yours] Not that [I]0-i know of . " asked [Wilson]86-wilson , with a dawning sense of discomfort . "[83-tom] Why , that there is n't any such knife . " "[83-tom] Look here , [Wilson]86-wilson , " said [Blake]175-blake , "[86-wilson] [Tom Driscoll]83-tom 's right , for a thousand dollars -- if [I]0-i had it . " [Wilson]86-wilson 's blood warmed a little , and [he]86-wilson wondered if [he]86-wilson had been played upon by [those strangers]2378-those strangers ; it certainly had something of that look . But what could [they]2378-those strangers gain by it ? [He]86-wilson threw out that suggestion . [Tom]83-tom replied : "[0-i] Gain ? Oh , nothing that [you]86-wilson would value , maybe . But [they]1001-they are [strangers]533-strangers making [their]1001-they way in [a new community]1003-a new community . Is it nothing to [them]1001-they to appear as pets of [an Oriental prince]1004-an oriental prince -- at no expense ? Is it nothing to [them]1001-they to be able to dazzle [this poor little town]1005-this poor little town with thousand - dollar rewards -- at no expense ? [Wilson]86-wilson , there is n't any such knife , or [your]86-wilson scheme would have fetched it to light . Or if there is any such knife , [they]1001-they 've got it yet . " [Blake]175-blake said-- "[1001-they] It looks mighty reasonable , the way [Tom]83-tom puts it ; it most certainly does . " [Tom]83-tom responded , turning to leave-- "[83-tom] [You]86-wilson find [the old woman]862-the old woman , [Blake]175-blake , and if [she]862-the old woman ca n't furnish the knife , go and search [the twins]1762-the twins ! " [Tom]83-tom sauntered away . [Wilson]86-wilson felt a good deal depressed . [He]86-wilson hardly knew what to think . [He]86-wilson was loath to withdraw [his]86-wilson faith from [the twins]1762-the twins , and was resolved not to do it on the present indecisive evidence ; but -- well , [he]86-wilson would think , and then decide how to act . "[175-blake] [Blake]175-blake , what do [you]175-blake think of this matter ? " "[175-blake] Well , [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson , [I]0-i 'm bound to say [I]0-i put it up the way [Tom]83-tom does . [They]1762-the twins had n't the knife ; or if [they]1762-the twins had it , [they]1762-the twins 've got it yet . " [The men]1539-the men parted . [Wilson]86-wilson said to [himself]86-wilson : "[1762-the twins] [I]0-i believe [they]1762-the twins had it ; if it had been stolen , the scheme would have restored it , that is certain . And so [I]0-i believe [they]1762-the twins 've got it yet . " [Tom]83-tom had no purpose in [his]83-tom mind when [he]83-tom encountered [those two men]2381-those two men . When [he]83-tom began [his]83-tom talk [he]83-tom hoped to be able to gall [them]2381-those two men a little and get a trifle of malicious entertainment out of it . But when [he]83-tom left , [he]83-tom left in great spirits , for [he]83-tom perceived that just by pure luck and no troublesome labor [he]83-tom had accomplished several delightful things : [he]83-tom had touched [both men]2382-both men on a raw spot and seen [them]2382-both men squirm ; [he]83-tom had modified [Wilson]86-wilson 's sweetness for [the twins]1762-the twins with one small bitter taste that [he]83-tom would n't be able to get out of [his]83-tom mouth right away ; and , best of all , [he]83-tom had taken [the hated twins]2384-the hated twins down a peg with [the community]319-the community ; for [Blake]175-blake would gossip around freely , after the manner of [detectives]2386-detectives , and within a week [the town]289-the town would be laughing at [them]2381-those two men in [its]289-the town sleeve for offering a gaudy reward for a bauble which [they]2381-those two men either never possessed or had n't lost . [Tom]83-tom was very well satisfied with [himself]83-tom . [Tom]83-tom 's behavior at [home]1541-home had been perfect during the entire week . [[His]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle and [aunt]2390-aunt had seen nothing like it before . [They]2381-those two men could find no fault with [him]83-tom anywhere . Saturday evening [he]0-i said to [the Judge--]2391-the judge-- "[0-i] [I]0-i 've had something preying on [my]0-i mind , [uncle]615-uncle , and as [I]0-i am going away , and might never see [you]615-uncle again , [I]0-i ca n't bear it any longer . [I]0-i made [you]615-uncle believe [I]0-i was afraid to fight [that Italian adventurer]1010-that italian adventurer . [I]0-i had to get out of it on some pretext or other , and maybe [I]0-i chose badly , being taken unawares , but [no honorable person]1011-no honorable person could consent to meet [him]1010-that italian adventurer in [the field]1012-the field , knowing what [I]0-i knew about [him]1010-that italian adventurer . " "[0-i] Indeed ? What was that ? " "[0-i] [Count Luigi]119-luigi is [a confessed assassin]1013-a confessed assassin . " "[1013-a confessed assassin] Incredible ! " "[1013-a confessed assassin] It 's perfectly true . [Wilson]86-wilson detected it in [his]1010-that italian adventurer hand , by palmistry , and charged [him]1010-that italian adventurer with it , and cornered [him]1010-that italian adventurer up so close that [he]1010-that italian adventurer had to confess ; but [both twins]2103-both twins begged [us]1015-us on [their]2103-both twins knees to keep the secret , and swore [they]2103-both twins would lead straight lives here ; and it was all so pitiful that [we]1015-us gave [our]1015-us word of honor never to expose [them]2103-both twins while [they]2103-both twins kept that promise . [You]1016-you would have done it [yourself]1016-you , [uncle]615-uncle . " "[1016-you] [You]1016-you are right , [[my]0-i boy]808-my boy ; [I]0-i would . [A man]432-a man 's secret is still [his]432-a man own property , and sacred , when it has been surprised out of [him]432-a man like that . [You]1016-you did well , and [I]0-i am proud of [you]1016-you . " Then [he]0-i added mournfully , "[0-i] But [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could have been saved the shame of meeting [an assassin on the field of honor]1020-an assassin on the field of honor . " "[615-uncle] It could n't be helped , [uncle]615-uncle . If [I]0-i had known [you]615-uncle were going to challenge [him]1020-an assassin on the field of honor [I]0-i should have felt obliged to sacrifice [my]0-i pledged word in order to stop it , but [Wilson]86-wilson could n't be expected to do otherwise than keep silent . " "[86-wilson] Oh , no ; [Wilson]86-wilson did right , and is in no way to blame . [Tom]83-tom , [Tom]83-tom , [you]83-tom have lifted a heavy load from [my]0-i heart ; [I]0-i was stung to the very soul when [I]0-i seemed to have discovered that [I]0-i had [a coward in [[my]0-i family]249-my family]793-a coward in my family . " "[615-uncle] [You]615-uncle may imagine what it cost [me]0-i to assume such a part , [uncle]615-uncle . " "[615-uncle] Oh , [I]0-i know it , [poor boy]1025-poor boy , [I]0-i know it . And [I]0-i can understand how much it has cost [you]83-tom to remain under that unjust stigma to this time . But it is all right now , and no harm is done . [You]83-tom have restored [my]0-i comfort of mind , and with it [your]83-tom own ; and both of [us]1026-us had suffered enough . " [The old man]2231-the old man sat awhile plunged in thought ; then [he]2231-the old man looked up with a satisfied light in [his]2231-the old man eye , and said : "[83-tom] That [this assassin]1027-this assassin should have put the affront upon [me]0-i of letting [me]0-i meet [him]1027-this assassin on the field of honor as if [he]1027-this assassin were [a gentleman]306-a gentleman is a matter which [I]0-i will presently settle -- but not now . [I]0-i will not shoot [him]1027-this assassin until after election . [I]0-i see a way to ruin [them]1029-them both before ; [I]0-i will attend to that first . [Neither of [them]1029-them]1030-neither of them shall be elected , that [I]0-i promise . [You]0-i are sure that the fact that [he]1027-this assassin is [an assassin]1031-an assassin has not got abroad ? " "[0-i] Perfectly certain of it , [sir]1436-sir . " "[0-i] It will be a good card . [I]0-i will fling a hint at it from the stump on the polling - day . It will sweep the ground from under both of [them]1029-them . " "[0-i] There 's not a doubt of it . It will finish [them]1029-them . " "[0-i] That and outside work among [the voters]1033-the voters will , to a certainty . [I]0-i want [you]0-i to come down here by and by and work privately among [the rag - tag and bobtail]1034-the rag - tag and bobtail . [You]0-i shall spend money among [them]1034-the rag - tag and bobtail ; [I]0-i will furnish it . " Another point scored against [the detested twins]2264-the detested twins ! Really it was a great day for [Tom]83-tom . [He]83-tom was encouraged to chance a parting shot , now , at the same target , and did it . "[0-i] [You]0-i know that wonderful Indian knife that [the twins]1762-the twins have been making such a to - do about ? Well , there 's no track or trace of it yet ; so [the town]289-the town is beginning to sneer and gossip and laugh . [Half the people]1037-half the people believe [they]1037-half the people never had any such knife , [the other half]1427-the other half believe [they]1427-the other half had it and have got it still . [I]0-i 've heard [twenty people]1039-twenty people talking like that to - day . " Yes , [Tom]83-tom 's blemishless week had restored [him]83-tom to the favor of [[his]83-tom aunt]2059-his aunt and [uncle]615-uncle . [[His]83-tom mother]575-his mother was satisfied with [him]83-tom , too . Privately , [she]575-his mother believed [she]575-his mother was coming to love [him]83-tom , but [she]575-his mother did not say so . [She]575-his mother told [him]83-tom to go along to [St. Louis]8-st. louis , now , and [she]575-his mother would get ready and follow . Then [she]575-his mother smashed [her]575-his mother whisky bottle and said-- "[1039-twenty people] Dah now ! [I]0-i 's a - gwyne to make [you]1040-you walk as straight as a string , [Chambers]95-chambers , en so [I]0-i 's bown ' [you]1040-you ai n't gwyne to git no bad example out o ' [yo]1040-you ' mammy . [I]0-i tole [you]1040-you [you]1040-you could n't go into no bad comp'ny . Well , [you]1040-you 's gwyne into [my]0-i comp'ny , en [I]0-i 's gwyne to fill de bill . Now , den , trot along , trot along ! " [Tom]83-tom went aboard one of [the big transient boats]2397-the big transient boats that night with [his]83-tom heavy satchel of miscellaneous plunder , and slept the sleep of the unjust , which is serener and sounder than the other kind , as [we]2398-we know by the hanging - eve history of [a million rascals]2399-a million rascals . But when [he]83-tom got up in the morning , luck was against [him]83-tom again : [A brother - thief]2400-a brother - thief had robbed [him]83-tom while [he]83-tom slept , and gone ashore at [some intermediate landing]2401-some intermediate landing . CHAPTER XVI . Sold Down [the River]59-the river . If [you]1040-you pick up a starving dog and make [him]2402-him prosperous , [he]2402-him will not bite [you]1040-you . This is the principal difference between a dog and a man.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . [We]2398-we know all about the habits of the ant , [we]2398-we know all about the habits of the bee , but [we]2398-we know nothing at all about the habits of the oyster . It seems almost certain that [we]2398-we have been choosing the wrong time for studying the oyster.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . When [Roxana]81-roxy arrived , [she]81-roxy found [[her]81-roxy son]1627-her son in such despair and misery that [her]81-roxy heart was touched and [her]81-roxy motherhood rose up strong in [her]81-roxy . [He]1627-her son was ruined past hope , now ; [his]1627-her son destruction would be immediate and sure , and [he]1627-her son would be [an outcast and friendless]2404-an outcast and friendless . That was reason enough for [a mother]1563-a mother to love [a child]313-a child ; so [she]81-roxy loved [him]1627-her son , and told [him]1627-her son so . It made [him]1627-her son wince , secretly -- for [she]81-roxy was [a "[1042-she] nigger]1625-a " nigger . " That [he]1627-her son was one [himself]1627-her son was far from reconciling [him]1627-her son to [that despised race]2408-that despised race . [Roxana]81-roxy poured out endearments upon [him]1627-her son , to which [he]1627-her son responded uncomfortably , but as well as [he]1627-her son could . And [she]81-roxy tried to comfort [him]1627-her son , but that was not possible . These intimacies quickly became horrible to [him]1627-her son , and within the hour [he]1627-her son began to try to get up courage enough to tell [her]81-roxy so , and require that they be discontinued or very considerably modified . But [he]1627-her son was afraid of [her]81-roxy ; and besides , there came a lull , now , for [she]81-roxy had begun to think . [She]81-roxy was trying to invent a saving plan . Finally [she]81-roxy started up , and said [she]81-roxy had found a way out . [Tom]83-tom was almost suffocated by the joy of this sudden good news . [Roxana]81-roxy said : "[1042-she] Here is [de plan]1041-de plan , en [she]1042-she 'll win , sure . [I]0-i 's [a nigger]1452-a nigger , en nobody ai n't gwyne to doubt it dat hears [me]0-i talk . [I]0-i 's wuth six hund'd dollahs . Take en sell [me]0-i , en pay off [dese gamblers]1044-dese gamblers . " [Tom]83-tom was dazed . [He]83-tom was not sure [he]83-tom had heard aright . [He]83-tom was dumb for a moment ; then [he]83-tom said : "[0-i] Do [you]0-i mean that [you]0-i would be sold into slavery to save [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] Ai n't [you]0-i [[my]0-i chile]1469-my chile ? En does [you]0-i know anything dat [a mother]1563-a mother wo n't do for [[her]1563-a mother chile]1520-her chile ? Day ai n't nothin' [a white mother]1048-a white mother wo n't do for [[her]1048-a white mother chile]1520-her chile . Who made ['em]1050-'em so ? [De Lord]1503-de lord done it . En who made [de niggers]1052-de niggers ? [De Lord]1503-de lord made ['em]1050-'em . In [de]1054-de inside , [mothers]1055-mothers is all de same . [De good Lord]1488-de good lord [he]1503-de lord made 'em so . [I]0-i 's gwyne to be [sole into slavery]1057-sole into slavery , en in a year [you]0-i 's gwyne to buy [yo]0-i ' ole mammy free ag'in . [I]0-i 'll show [you]0-i how . Dat 's de plan . " [Tom]83-tom 's hopes began to rise , and [his]83-tom spirits along with [them]1055-mothers . [He]83-tom said-- "[0-i] It 's lovely of [you]0-i , [mammy]1472-mammy -- it 's just-- " "[0-i] Say it ag'in ! [En]1059-en keep on sayin ' it ! It 's all [de]1054-de pay a body kin want in dis worl ' , en it 's mo ' den enough . Laws bless [you]0-i , [honey]1471-honey , when [I]0-i 's slavin ' aroun ' , en [dey]1054-de ' buses [me]0-i , if [I]0-i knows [you]0-i 's a - sayin ' dat , ' way off yonder somers , it 'll heal up all de sore places , en [I]0-i kin stan ' ' [em]1061-em . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do say it again , [mammy]1472-mammy , and [I]0-i 'll keep on saying it , too . But how am [I]0-i going to sell [you]0-i ? [You]0-i 're free , [you]0-i know . " "[0-i] Much diff'rence dat make ! [White folks]1478-white folks ai n't partic'lar . [De]1054-de law kin sell [me]0-i now if [dey]1054-de tell [me]0-i to leave [de State]1064-de state in six months en [I]0-i do n't go . [You]0-i draw up a paper -- bill o ' sale -- en put it ' way off yonder , down in [de middle o ' Kaintuck somers]1065-de middle o ' kaintuck somers , en sign some names to it , en say [you]0-i 'll sell [me]0-i cheap ' ca'se [you]0-i 's hard up ; [you]0-i 'll find [you]0-i ai n't gwyne to have no trouble . [You]0-i take [me]0-i up [de country]1066-de country a piece , en sell [me]0-i on [a farm]1067-a farm ; [dem people]949-dem people ai n't gwyne to ask no questions if [I]0-i 's a bargain . " [Tom]83-tom forged a bill of sale and sold [[his]83-tom mother]575-his mother to [an Arkansas cotton - planter]2410-an arkansas cotton - planter for a trifle over six hundred dollars . [He]83-tom did not want to commit this treachery , but luck threw [the man]692-the man in [his]83-tom way , and this saved [him]83-tom the necessity of going up [country]962-country to hunt up [a purchaser]2413-a purchaser , with the added risk of having to answer a lot of questions , whereas [this planter]2414-this planter was so pleased with [Roxy]81-roxy that [he]2414-this planter asked next to none at all . Besides , [the planter]2415-the planter insisted that [Roxy]81-roxy would n't know where [she]81-roxy was , at first , and that by the time [she]81-roxy found out [she]81-roxy would already have become contented . And [Tom]83-tom argued with [himself]83-tom that it was an immense advantage for [Roxy]81-roxy to have [a master who was so pleased with [her]81-roxy , as [this planter]2414-this planter manifestly was]2416-a master who was so pleased with her , as this planter manifestly was . In almost no time [his]0-i flowing reasonings carried [him]0-i to the point of even half believing [he]0-i was doing [Roxy]81-roxy a splendid surreptitious service in selling [her]81-roxy "[0-i] down [the river]269-the river . " And then [he]0-i kept diligently saying to [himself]0-i all the time : "[0-i] It 's for only a year . In a year [I]0-i buy [her]1070-her free again ; [she]1070-her 'll keep that in mind , and it 'll reconcile [her]1070-her . " Yes ; the little deception could do no harm , and everything would come out right and pleasant in the end , any way . By agreement , the conversation in [Roxy]81-roxy 's presence was all about [[the man]692-the man 's "[1070-her] [upcountry " farm]2420-upcountry " farm]2419-the man 's " upcountry " farm , and how pleasant a place it was , and how happy [the slaves]2421-the slaves were [there]1623-there ; so poor [Roxy]81-roxy was entirely deceived ; and easily , for [she]81-roxy was not dreaming that [[her]81-roxy own son]2423-her own son could be guilty of treason to [a mother who , in voluntarily going into slavery -- slavery of any kind , mild or severe , or of any duration , brief or long]2424-a mother who , in voluntarily going into slavery -- slavery of any kind , mild or severe , or of any duration , brief or long -- was making a sacrifice for [him]0-i compared with which death would have been a poor and commonplace one . [She]81-roxy lavished tears and loving caresses upon [him]0-i privately , and then went away with [[her]81-roxy owner]2425-her owner -- went away broken - hearted , and yet proud of what [she]81-roxy was doing , and glad it was in [her]81-roxy power to do it . [Tom]83-tom squared [his]83-tom accounts , and resolved to keep to the very letter of [his]83-tom reform , and never to put that will in jeopardy again . [He]83-tom had three hundred dollars left . According to [[his]83-tom mother]575-his mother 's plan , [he]83-tom was to put that safely away , and add [her]81-roxy half of [his]83-tom pension to it monthly . In one year this fund would buy [her]81-roxy free again . For a whole week [he]83-tom was not able to sleep well , so much the villainy which [he]83-tom had played upon [[his]83-tom trusting mother]2427-his trusting mother preyed upon [his]83-tom rag of a conscience ; but after that [he]83-tom began to get comfortable again , and was presently able to sleep like [any other miscreant]2428-any other miscreant . [The boat]1920-the boat bore [Roxy]81-roxy away from [St. Louis]8-st. louis at four in the afternoon , and [she]81-roxy stood on the lower guard abaft the paddle - box and watched [Tom]83-tom through a blur of tears until [he]83-tom melted into [the throng of people]2430-the throng of people and disappeared ; then [she]81-roxy looked no more , but sat there on a coil of cable crying till far into the night . When [she]81-roxy went to [[her]81-roxy foul steerage - bunk]2431-her foul steerage - bunk at last , between the clashing engines , it was not to sleep , but only to wait for the morning , and , waiting , grieve . It had been imagined that [she]81-roxy "[100-god] would not know , " and would think [she]81-roxy was traveling up [stream]2432-stream . [She]81-roxy ! Why , [she]81-roxy had been steamboating for years . At dawn [she]81-roxy got up and went listlessly and sat down on the cable - coil again . [She]81-roxy passed many [a snag whose "[1070-her] break "]2433-a snag whose " break " could have told [her]81-roxy a thing to break [her]81-roxy heart , for it showed a current moving in the same direction that [the boat]1920-the boat was going ; but [her]81-roxy thoughts were elsewhere , and [she]81-roxy did not notice . But at last the roar of a bigger and nearer break than usual brought [her]81-roxy out of [her]81-roxy torpor , and [she]81-roxy looked up , and [her]81-roxy practised eye fell upon that telltale rush of water . For one moment [her]81-roxy petrified gaze fixed itself there . Then [her]81-roxy head dropped upon [her]81-roxy breast , and [she]81-roxy said-- "[1070-her] Oh , de good Lord [God]100-god have mercy on po ' sinful [me]0-i -- [I]0-i 's sole down [de river]1447-de river ! " CHAPTER XVII . [The Judge]315-the judge Utters Dire Prophecy . Even popularity can be overdone . In [Rome]60-rome , along at first , [you]2436-you are full of regrets that [Michelangelo]188-michelangelo died ; but by and by [you]2436-you only regret that [you]2436-you did n't see [him]188-michelangelo do it.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . July 4 . Statistics show that [we]2437-we lose [more fools]2438-more fools on this day than in all the other days of the year put together . This proves , by the number left in stock , that one Fourth of July per year is now inadequate , [the country]2439-the country has grown so.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . The summer weeks dragged by , and then the political campaign opened -- opened in pretty warm fashion , and waxed hotter and hotter daily . [The twins]1762-the twins threw [themselves]1762-the twins into it with [their]1762-the twins whole heart , for [their]1762-the twins self - love was engaged . [Their]1762-the twins popularity , so general at first , had suffered afterward ; mainly because [they]1762-the twins had been too popular , and so a natural reaction had followed . Besides , it had been diligently whispered around that it was curious -- indeed , very curious -- that that wonderful knife of theirs did not turn up -- if it was so valuable , or if it had ever existed . And with the whisperings went chucklings and nudgings and winks , and such things have an effect . [The twins]1762-the twins considered that success in the election would reinstate [them]1762-the twins , and that defeat would work [them]1762-the twins irreparable damage . Therefore [they]1762-the twins worked hard , but not harder than [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll and [Tom]83-tom worked against [them]1762-the twins in the closing days of the canvas . [Tom]83-tom 's conduct had remained so letter - perfect during two whole months , now , that [[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle not only trusted [him]83-tom with money with which to persuade [voters]2443-voters , but trusted [him]83-tom to go and get it [himself]83-tom out of the safe in [the private sitting - room]2444-the private sitting - room . The closing speech of the campaign was made by [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll , and [he]88-judge driscoll made it against [both of [the foreigners]1793-the foreigners]2445-both of the foreigners . It was disastrously effective . [He]88-judge driscoll poured out rivers of ridicule upon [them]1762-the twins , and forced the big mass - meeting to laugh and applaud . [He]88-judge driscoll scoffed at [them]1762-the twins as [adventurers]2447-adventurers , [mountebanks]2448-mountebanks , side - show riff - raff , [dime museum freaks]2449-dime museum freaks ; [he]88-judge driscoll assailed [their]1762-the twins showy titles with measureless derision ; [he]88-judge driscoll said [they]1762-the twins were [back - alley barbers disguised as [nobilities]2451-nobilities]2450-back - alley barbers disguised as nobilities , [peanut peddlers]2452-peanut peddlers masquerading as [gentlemen]1439-gentlemen , [organ - grinders]2454-organ - grinders bereft of [[their]1762-the twins brother]2455-their brother monkey . At last [he]88-judge driscoll stopped and stood still . [He]88-judge driscoll waited until [the place]2456-the place had become absolutely silent and expectant , then [he]88-judge driscoll delivered [his]88-judge driscoll deadliest shot ; delivered it with ice - cold seriousness and deliberation , with a significant emphasis upon the closing words : [he]88-judge driscoll said that [he]88-judge driscoll believed that the reward offered for the lost knife was humbug and buncombe , and that [its owner]2457-its owner would know where to find it whenever [he]88-judge driscoll should have occasion to assassinate [somebody]358-somebody . Then [he]88-judge driscoll stepped from the stand , leaving a startled and impressive hush behind [him]88-judge driscoll instead of the customary explosion of cheers and party cries . The strange remark flew far and wide over [the town]289-the town and made an extraordinary sensation . [Everybody]367-everybody was asking , "[1072-he] What could [he]1072-he mean by that ? " And [everybody]367-everybody went on asking that question , but in vain ; for [the Judge]315-the judge only said [he]88-judge driscoll knew what [he]88-judge driscoll was talking about , and stopped there ; [Tom]83-tom said [he]83-tom had n't any idea what [[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle meant , and [Wilson]86-wilson , whenever [he]86-wilson was asked what [he]86-wilson thought it meant , parried the question by asking [the questioner]2464-the questioner what [he]86-wilson thought it meant . [Wilson]86-wilson was elected , [the twins]1762-the twins were defeated -- crushed , in fact , and left forlorn and substantially friendless . [Tom]83-tom went back to [St. Louis]8-st. louis happy . [[Dawson]113-dawson 's Landing]1644-dawson 's landing had a week of repose , now , and it needed it . But it was in an expectant state , for the air was full of rumors of a new duel . [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll 's election labors had prostrated [him]88-judge driscoll , but it was said that as soon as [he]88-judge driscoll was well enough to entertain a challenge [he]88-judge driscoll would get one from [Count Luigi]119-luigi . [The brothers]1809-the brothers withdrew entirely from [society]1681-society , and nursed [their]1809-the brothers humiliation in privacy . [They]1809-the brothers avoided [the people]332-the people , and went out for exercise only late at night , when [the streets]266-the streets were deserted . CHAPTER XVIII . [Roxana]81-roxy Commands . Gratitude and treachery are merely the two extremities of the same procession . [You]2471-you have seen all of it that is worth staying for when [the band]2472-the band and [the gaudy officials]2473-the gaudy officials have gone by.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . Thanksgiving Day . Let [all]2005-all give humble , hearty , and sincere thanks , now , but the turkeys . In [the island of [Fiji]61-fiji]2475-the island of fiji [they]2475-the island of fiji do not use turkeys ; [they]2475-the island of fiji use plumbers . It does not become [you]2471-you and [me]1072-he to sneer at [Fiji.--Pudd'nhead Wilson]189-fiji.--pudd'nhead wilson 's Calendar . The Friday after the election was a rainy one in [St. Louis]8-st. louis . It rained all day long , and rained hard , apparently trying its best to wash [that soot - blackened town]2476-that soot - blackened town white , but of course not succeeding . Toward midnight [Tom Driscoll]83-tom arrived at [[his]83-tom lodgings]1869-his lodgings from [the theatre]2478-the theatre in the heavy downpour , and closed [his]83-tom umbrella and let [himself]83-tom in ; but when [he]83-tom would have shut the door , [he]83-tom found that there was [another person]1429-another person entering -- doubtless [another lodger]2480-another lodger ; [this person]2481-this person closed the door and tramped up - stairs behind [Tom]83-tom . [Tom]83-tom found [his]83-tom door in the dark , and entered it and turned up the gas . When [he]83-tom faced about , lightly whistling , [he]83-tom saw the back of [a man]432-a man . [The man]692-the man was closing and locking [his]692-the man door for [him]692-the man . [His]83-tom whistle faded out and [he]83-tom felt uneasy . [The man]692-the man turned around , [a wreck of shabby old clothes , sodden with rain and all a - drip]2485-a wreck of shabby old clothes , sodden with rain and all a - drip , and showed a black face under an old slouch hat . [Tom]83-tom was frightened . [He]83-tom tried to order [the man]692-the man out , but the words refused to come , and [the other man]2487-the other man got the start . [He]2487-the other man said , in a low voice-- "[1072-he] Keep still -- [I]0-i 's [[yo]1073-yo ' mother]648-yo ' mother ! " [Tom]83-tom sunk in a heap on a chair , and gasped out-- "[0-i] It was mean of [me]0-i , and base -- [I]0-i know it ; but [I]0-i meant it for the best , [I]0-i did indeed -- [I]0-i can swear it . " [Roxana]81-roxy stood awhile looking mutely down on [him]83-tom while [he]83-tom writhed in shame and went on incoherently babbling self - accusations mixed with pitiful attempts at explanation and palliation of [his]83-tom crime ; then [she]81-roxy seated [herself]81-roxy and took off [her]81-roxy hat , and [her]81-roxy unkept masses of long brown hair tumbled down about [her]81-roxy shoulders . "[0-i] It ai n't no fault o ' yo'n dat dat ai n't gray , " [she]81-roxy said sadly , noticing the hair . "[0-i] [I]0-i know it , [I]0-i know it ! [I]0-i 'm [a scoundrel]1075-a scoundrel . But [I]0-i swear [I]0-i meant it for the best . It was a mistake , of course , but [I]0-i thought it was for the best , [I]0-i truly did . " [Roxana]81-roxy began to cry softly , and presently words began to find their way out between [her]81-roxy sobs . They were uttered lamentingly , rather than angrily-- "[0-i] Sell a pusson down [de river]1447-de river -- down the river!--for de bes ' ! [I]0-i would n't treat a dog so ! [I]0-i is all broke down en wore out , now , en so [I]0-i reckon it ai n't in [me]0-i to storm aroun ' no mo ' , like [I]0-i used to when [I]0-i ' uz trompled on en ' bused . [I]0-i do n't know -- but maybe it 's so . Leastways , [I]0-i 's suffered so much dat mournin ' seem to come mo ' handy to [me]0-i now den stormin ' . " These words should have touched [Tom Driscoll]83-tom , but if they did , that effect was obliterated by a stronger one -- one which removed the heavy weight of fear which lay upon [him]83-tom , and gave [his]83-tom crushed spirit a most grateful rebound , and filled all [his]83-tom small soul with a deep sense of relief . But [he]83-tom kept prudently still , and ventured no comment . There was a voiceless interval of some duration , now , in which no sounds were heard but the beating of the rain upon the panes , the sighing and complaining of the winds , and now and then a muffled sob from [Roxana]81-roxy . The sobs became more and more infrequent , and at last ceased . Then [the refugee]2488-the refugee began to talk again : "[1077-shet] [Shet]1077-shet down dat light a little . More . More yit . A pusson dat is hunted do n't like de light . [Dah]1078-dah -- dat'll do . [I]0-i kin see whah [you]1079-you is , en dat 's enough . [I]0-i 's gwine to tell [you]1079-you de tale , en cut it jes as short as [I]0-i kin , en den [I]0-i 'll tell [you]1079-you what [you]1079-you 's got to do . [[Dat]1080-dat man]497-dat man dat bought [me]0-i ai n't [a bad man]1082-a bad man ; [he]497-dat man 's good enough , as [planters]1083-planters goes ; en if [he]497-dat man could ' a ' had [his]497-dat man way [I]0-i 'd ' a ' be'n [a house servant in [his]497-dat man fambly en be'n comfortable]1084-a house servant in his fambly en be'n comfortable : but [[his]497-dat man wife]310-his wife [she]310-his wife was [a Yank]1086-a yank , en not right down good lookin ' , en [she]310-his wife riz up agin [me]0-i straight off ; so den [dey]1087-dey sent [me]0-i out to de quarter ' mongst [de common fiel ' han 's]1088-de common fiel ' han 's . [Dat woman]1089-dat woman warn't satisfied even wid dat , but [she]1089-dat woman worked up [de]1087-dey overseer ag'in ' [me]0-i , [she]1089-dat woman ' uz dat jealous en hateful ; so [de]1087-dey overseer [he]497-dat man had [me]0-i out befo ' day in de mawnin 's en worked [me]0-i de whole long day as long as [dey]1087-dey ' uz any light to see by ; en many 's de lashin 's [I]0-i got ' ca'se [I]0-i could n't come up to de work o ' [de stronges]1090-de stronges ' . [Dat]1087-dey overseer wuz [a Yank]1086-a yank , too , outen [New Englan]190-new englan ' , en anybody down [South]62-south kin tell [you]1092-you what [dat]1087-dey mean . [Dey]1087-dey knows how to work [a nigger to death]1093-a nigger to death , en [dey]1087-dey knows how to whale ['em]1094-'em , too -- whale 'em till [dey]1087-dey backs is welted like a washboard . ' Long at fust [[my]0-i marster]1095-my marster say de good word for [me]0-i to [de overseer]1096-de overseer , but dat ' uz bad for [me]0-i ; for [de mistis]191-de mistis [she]191-de mistis fine it out , en arter dat [I]0-i jist ketched it at every turn -- [dey]1087-dey warn't no mercy for [me]0-i no mo ' . " [Tom]83-tom 's heart was fired -- with fury against [[the planter]2415-the planter 's wife]2490-the planter 's wife ; and [he]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom , "[1087-dey] But for [that meddlesome fool]1097-that meddlesome fool , everything would have gone all right . " [He]83-tom added a deep and bitter curse against [her]2490-the planter 's wife . The expression of this sentiment was fiercely written in [his]83-tom face , and stood thus revealed to [Roxana]81-roxy by a white glare of lightning which turned the somber dusk of [the room]1731-the room into dazzling day at that moment . [She]81-roxy was pleased -- pleased and grateful ; for did not that expression show that [[her]81-roxy child]407-her child was capable of grieving for [[his]407-her child mother]575-his mother 's wrongs and of feeling resentment toward [her]81-roxy persecutors?--a thing which [she]81-roxy had been doubting . But [her]81-roxy flash of happiness was only a flash , and went out again and left [her]81-roxy spirit dark ; for [she]81-roxy said to [herself]81-roxy , "[1098-she] [He]1098-she sole [me]0-i down [de river]1447-de river -- [he]1098-she ca n't feel for a body long : dis'll pass en go . " Then [she]81-roxy took up [her]81-roxy tale again . "[1098-she] ' Bout ten days ago [I]0-i ' uz sayin ' to [myself]0-i dat [I]0-i could n't las ' many mo ' weeks [I]0-i ' uz so wore out wid [de]1100-de awful work en de lashin 's , en so downhearted en misable . En [I]0-i did n't care no mo ' , nuther -- life warn't wuth noth'n ' to [me]0-i , if [I]0-i got to go on like dat . Well , when a body is in a frame o ' [mine]1101-mine like dat , what do [a body]1102-a body care what [a body]1102-a body do ? [Dey]1098-she was [a little sickly nigger wench 'bout]1104-a little sickly nigger wench 'bout ten year ole dat ' uz good to [me]0-i , en had n't no mammy , po ' thing , en [I]0-i loved [her]1098-she en [she]1098-she loved [me]0-i ; en [she]1098-she come out whah [I]0-i ' uz workin ' en [she]1098-she had a roasted tater , en tried to slip it to me,--robbin ' [herself]1098-she , [you]1105-you see , ' ca'se [she]1098-she knowed [de overseer]1096-de overseer did n't gimme enough to eat,--en [he]1096-de overseer ketched [her]1098-she at it , en give [her]1098-she a lick acrost de back wid [his]1096-de overseer stick , which ' uz as thick as a broom - handle , en [she]1098-she drop ' screamin ' on de groun ' , en squirmin ' en wallerin ' aroun ' in de dust like a spider dat 's got crippled . [I]0-i could n't stan ' it . All de hell - fire dat ' uz ever in [my]0-i heart flame ' up , en [I]0-i snatch de stick outen [his]1096-de overseer han ' en laid [him]1096-de overseer flat . [He]1096-de overseer laid [dah]1107-dah moanin ' en cussin ' , en all out of [his]1096-de overseer head , [you]1105-you know , en [de niggers]1052-de niggers ' uz plumb sk'yred to death . [Dey]1096-de overseer gathered roun ' [him]1096-de overseer to he'p [him]1096-de overseer , en [I]0-i jumped on [his]1096-de overseer hoss en took out for [de river]1447-de river as tight as [I]0-i could go . [I]0-i knowed what [dey]1096-de overseer would do wid [me]0-i . Soon as [he]1096-de overseer got well [he]1096-de overseer would start in en work [me]0-i to death if [marster]1461-marster let [him]1096-de overseer ; en if [dey]1096-de overseer did n't do dat , [they]1461-marster 'd sell [me]0-i furder down [de river]1447-de river , en dat 's de same thing . So [I]0-i ' lowed to drown [myself]0-i en git out o ' [my]0-i troubles . It ' uz gitt'n ' towards dark . [I]0-i ' uz at [de river]1447-de river in two minutes . Den [I]0-i see [a canoe]1600-a canoe , en [I]0-i says [dey]1096-de overseer ai n't no use to drown [myself]0-i tell [I]0-i got to ; so [I]0-i ties de hoss in de edge o ' de timber en shove out down [de river]1447-de river , keepin ' in under [de shelter o ' [de bluff bank]1116-de bluff bank]1115-de shelter o ' de bluff bank en prayin ' for de dark to [shet]1117-shet down quick . [I]0-i had a pow'ful good start , ' ca'se [de big house]1118-de big house ' uz three mile back f'om [de river]63-de river en on'y [de work - mules]1119-de work - mules to ride [dah]1120-dah on , en on'y niggers to ride 'em , en [dey]1096-de overseer warn't gwine to hurry -- [dey'd]1096-de overseer gimme all de chance [dey]1096-de overseer could . Befo ' a body could go to [de house]542-de house en back it would be long pas ' dark , en [dey]1096-de overseer could n't track de hoss en fine out which way [I]0-i went tell mawnin ' , en [de niggers]1052-de niggers would tell ['em]1123-'em all de lies [dey]1096-de overseer could 'bout it . " Well , de dark come , en [I]1052-de niggers went on a - spinnin ' down [de river]1447-de river . [I]1052-de niggers paddled mo'n two hours , den [I]1052-de niggers warn't worried no mo ' , so [I]1052-de niggers quit paddlin , en floated down de current , considerin ' what [I]1052-de niggers ' uz gwine to do if [I]1052-de niggers did n't have to drown [myself]1052-de niggers . [I]1052-de niggers made up some plans , en floated along , turnin ' 'em over in [[my]1052-de niggers mine]2495-my mine . Well , when it ' uz a little pas ' midnight , as [I]1052-de niggers reckoned , en [I]1052-de niggers had come fifteen or twenty mile , [I]1052-de niggers see de lights o ' [a steamboat]1665-a steamboat layin ' at [de bank]2497-de bank , whah [dey]1096-de overseer warn't [no town]2498-no town en no woodyard , en putty soon [I]1052-de niggers ketched de shape o ' [de chimbly - tops ag'in ' de stars]2499-de chimbly - tops ag'in ' de stars , en den good gracious [me]1052-de niggers , [I]1052-de niggers ' most jumped out o ' [my]1052-de niggers skin for joy !
