It ' uz [de Gran ' Mogul]2500-de gran ' mogul -- [I]1052-de niggers ' uz chambermaid on [her]2500-de gran ' mogul for eight seasons in [de [Cincinnati]44-cincinnati en [Orleans]13-orleans trade]2501-de cincinnati en orleans trade . [I]1052-de niggers slid ' long pas'--don't see [nobody]1501-nobody stirrin ' nowhah -- hear ['em]2503-'em a - hammerin ' away in [de engine - room]2504-de engine - room , den [I]1052-de niggers knowed what de matter was -- some o ' [de]1096-de overseer machinery 's broke . [I]1052-de niggers got asho ' below [de boat]2505-de boat and turn ' [de canoe]2506-de canoe loose , den [I]1052-de niggers goes ' long up , en [dey]2507-dey ' uz jes one plank out , en [I]1052-de niggers step ' ' board [de boat]2505-de boat . It ' uz pow'ful hot , deckhan 's en roustabouts ' uz sprawled aroun ' asleep on de fo'cas'l ' , [de second mate]2509-de second mate , [Jim Bangs]192-jim bangs , [he]192-jim bangs sot [dah]2510-dah on de bitts wid [his]192-jim bangs head down , asleep--'ca'se dat 's [de]1096-de overseer way [de second mate]2509-de second mate stan ' [de]1096-de overseer cap'n 's watch!--en [de ole watchman]2512-de ole watchman , [Billy Hatch]193-billy hatch , [he]193-billy hatch ' uz a - noddin ' on de companionway;--en [I]1052-de niggers knowed 'em all ; ' en , lan ' , but [dey]2507-dey did look good ! [I]1052-de niggers says to [myself]1052-de niggers , [I]1052-de niggers wished old marster'd come along now [en]2513-en try to take [me]1052-de niggers -- bless [yo]2513-en ' heart , [I]1052-de niggers 's ' mong frien 's , [I]1052-de niggers is . So [I]1052-de niggers tromped right along ' mongst 'em , en went up on [de b'iler deck]2514-de b'iler deck en ' way back aft to [[de ladies]2515-de ladies ' cabin guard]2516-de ladies ' cabin guard , en sot down [dah]2517-dah in de same cheer dat [I]1052-de niggers 'd sot in ' mos ' a hund'd million times , [I]1052-de niggers reckon ; en it ' uz jist [home]1541-home ag'in , [I]1052-de niggers tell [you]2519-you ! "[1052-de niggers] In 'bout an hour [I]0-i heard de ready - bell jingle , en den de racket begin . Putty soon [I]0-i hear [de gong]1124-de gong strike . ' Set [her]1125-her back on de outside , ' [I]0-i says to myself--'I reckon [I]0-i knows dat music ! ' [I]0-i hear [de gong]1124-de gong ag'in . ' Come ahead on de inside , ' [I]0-i says . Gong ag'in . ' Stop de outside . ' [Gong]194-gong ag'in . ' Come ahead on de outside -- now [we]1127-we 's pinted for Sent [Louis]183-louis , en [I]0-i 's outer de woods en ai n't got to drown [myself]0-i at all . ' [I]0-i knowed [de Mogul]136-the grand mogul ' uz in de Sent [Louis]183-louis trade now , [you]1128-you see . It ' uz jes fair daylight when [we]1127-we passed [[our]1127-we plantation]1129-our plantation , en [I]0-i seed [a gang o ' niggers]1130-a gang o ' niggers en [white folks]1478-white folks huntin ' up en down de sho ' , en troublin ' [deyselves]1132-deyselves a good deal 'bout [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i warn't troublin ' [myself]0-i none 'bout [dem]1133-i . " ' Bout dat time [Sally Jackson]187-jackson , dat used to be [[my]1133-i second chambermaid]2520-my second chambermaid en ' uz [head chambermaid]1915-head chambermaid now , [she]187-jackson come out on de guard , en ' uz pow'ful glad to see [me]1133-i , en so ' uz [all de officers]2522-all de officers ; en [I]1133-i tole 'em [I]1133-i 'd got kidnapped en sole down [de river]1447-de river , en [dey]1133-i made [me]1133-i up twenty dollahs en give it to [me]1133-i , en [Sally]187-jackson [she]187-jackson rigged [me]1133-i out wid good clo'es , en when [I]1133-i got [here]232-here [I]1133-i went straight to [whah]2525-whah [you]2526-you used to wuz , en den [I]1133-i come to [dis house]2527-dis house , en [dey]1133-i say [you]2526-you 's away but ' spected back every day ; so [I]1133-i did n't dast to go down [de river]1447-de river to [Dawson 's]75-dawson 's landing , ' ca'se [I]1133-i might miss [you]2526-you . "[1133-i] Well , las ' Monday [I]0-i ' uz pass'n ' by [one o ' dem places in [Fourth street]1135-fourth street]1134-one o ' dem places in fourth street [whah]1136-whah [deh]1136-whah sticks up runaway - nigger bills , en he'ps to ketch 'em , en [I]0-i seed [my]0-i marster ! [I]0-i ' mos ' flopped down on de groun ' , [I]0-i felt so gone . [He]1137-he had [his]1137-he back to [me]0-i , en ' uz talkin ' to [de man]646-de man en givin ' [him]1137-he some bills -- nigger - bills , [I]0-i reckon , en [I'se]0-i [de nigger]920-de nigger . [He]1137-he 's offerin ' a reward -- dat 's it . Ai n't [I]0-i right , do n't [you]1140-you reckon ? " [Tom]83-tom had been gradually sinking into a state of ghastly terror , and [he]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom , now : "[1140-you] [I]0-i 'm lost , no matter what turn things take ! [This man]1141-this man has said to [me]0-i that [he]1141-this man thinks there was something suspicious about that sale . [He]1141-this man said [he]1141-this man had a letter from [a passenger on the Grand Mogul]1142-a passenger on the grand mogul saying that [Roxy]81-roxy came here on [that boat]1917-that boat and that [everybody on board]1144-everybody on board knew all about the case ; so [he]1141-this man says that [her]81-roxy coming here instead of flying to [a free State]1145-a free state looks bad for [me]0-i , and that if [I]0-i do n't find [her]81-roxy for [him]1141-this man , and that pretty soon , [he]1141-this man will make trouble for [me]0-i . [I]0-i never believed that story ; [I]0-i could n't believe [she]81-roxy would be so dead to all motherly instincts as to come here , knowing the risk [she]81-roxy would run of getting [me]0-i into irremediable trouble . And after all , here [she]81-roxy is ! And [I]0-i stupidly swore [I]0-i would help [him]1141-this man find [her]81-roxy , thinking it was a perfectly safe thing to promise . If [I]0-i venture to deliver [her]81-roxy up , [she]81-roxy -- [she]81-roxy -- but how can [I]0-i help [myself]0-i ? [I]0-i 've got to do that or pay the money , and where 's the money to come from ? [I]0-i -- [I]0-i -- well , [I]0-i should think that if [he]1141-this man would swear to treat [her]81-roxy kindly hereafter -- and [she]81-roxy says , [herself]81-roxy , that [he]1141-this man is [a good man]1146-a good man -- and if [he]1141-this man would swear to never allow [her]81-roxy to be overworked , or ill fed , or-- " A flash of lightning exposed [Tom]83-tom 's pallid face , drawn and rigid with these worrying thoughts . [Roxana]81-roxy spoke up sharply now , and there was apprehension in [her]81-roxy voice-- "[1141-this man] Turn up dat light ! [I]0-i want to see [yo]1147-you ' face better . [Dah]1148-dah now -- lemme look at [you]1147-you . [Chambers]95-chambers , [you]1147-you 's as white as [yo]1147-you ' shirt ! Has [you]1147-you see [dat man]497-dat man ? Has [he]497-dat man be'n to see [you]1147-you ? " "[1147-you] [Ye]1147-you - s. " "[1147-you] When ? " "[1147-you] Monday noon . " "[1147-you] Monday noon ! Was [he]497-dat man on [[my]0-i track]1150-my track ? " "[497-dat man] [He]497-dat man -- well , [he]497-dat man thought [he]497-dat man was . That is , [he]497-dat man hoped [he]497-dat man was . This is the bill [you]1147-you saw . " [He]0-i took it out of [his]0-i pocket . "[497-dat man] Read it to [me]0-i ! " [She]1147-you was panting with excitement , and there was a dusky glow in [her]1147-you eyes that [Tom]83-tom could not translate with certainty , but there seemed to be something threatening about it . The handbill had the usual rude woodcut of [a turbaned negro woman]2529-a turbaned negro woman running , with the customary bundle on a stick over [her]1147-you shoulder , and the heading in bold type , "[497-dat man] $ 100 Reward . " [Tom]83-tom read the bill aloud -- at least the part that described [Roxana]81-roxy and named [the master]458-the master and [his]458-the master [St. Louis]8-st. louis address and the address of [the Fourth - street agency]2531-the fourth - street agency ; but [he]83-tom left out the item that [applicants for the reward]2532-applicants for the reward might also apply to [Mr. Thomas Driscoll]83-tom . "[497-dat man] Gimme de bill ! " [Tom]83-tom had folded it and was putting it in [his]83-tom pocket . [He]83-tom felt a chilly streak creeping down [his]83-tom back , but said as carelessly as [he]83-tom could-- "[497-dat man] The bill ? Why , it is n't any use to [you]1151-you , [you]1151-you ca n't read it . What do [you]1151-you want with it ? " "[1151-you] Gimme de bill ! " [Tom]83-tom gave it to [her]1151-you , but with a reluctance which [he]83-tom could not entirely disguise . "[1151-you] Did [you]1151-you read it all to [me]0-i ? " "[1151-you] Certainly [I]0-i did . " "[0-i] Hole up [yo]1152-yo ' han ' en swah to it . " [Tom]83-tom did it . [Roxana]81-roxy put the bill carefully away in [her]81-roxy pocket , with [her]81-roxy eyes fixed upon [Tom]83-tom 's face all the while ; then [she]81-roxy said-- "[0-i] [Yo]0-i 's lyin ' ! " "[0-i] What would [I]0-i want to lie about it for ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know -- but [you]0-i is . Dat 's [my]0-i opinion , anyways . But nemmine 'bout dat . When [I]0-i seed [dat man]497-dat man [I]0-i ' uz [dat]1154-dat sk'yerd dat [I]0-i could sca'cely wobble [home]1541-home . Den [I]0-i give [a nigger man]1156-a nigger man a dollar for dese clo'es , en [I]0-i ai n't be'n in [a house]1157-a house sence , night ner day , till now . [I]0-i blacked [my]0-i face en laid hid in [de cellar of [a ole house dat 's]1159-a ole house dat 's burnt down]1158-de cellar of a ole house dat 's burnt down , daytimes , en robbed de sugar hogsheads en grain sacks on [de wharf]1160-de wharf , nights , to git somethin' to eat , en never dast to try to buy noth'n ' , en [I]0-i 's ' mos ' starved . En [I]0-i never dast to come near [dis place]1161-dis place till dis rainy night , when [dey]1162-dey ai n't [no people]1163-no people roun ' sca'cely . But to - night [I]0-i be'n a - stannin ' in [de dark alley]1164-de dark alley ever sence night come , waitin ' for [you]1165-you to go by . En here [I]0-i is . " [She]2533-she fell to thinking . Presently [she]2533-she said-- "[0-i] [You]0-i seed [dat man]497-dat man at noon , las ' Monday ? " "[0-i] Yes . " "[0-i] [I]0-i seed [him]497-dat man [de middle o ' dat arternoon]1167-de middle o ' dat arternoon . [He]497-dat man hunted [you]0-i up , did n't [he]497-dat man ? " "[497-dat man] Yes . " "[497-dat man] Did [he]497-dat man give [you]0-i de bill dat time ? " "[497-dat man] No , [he]497-dat man had n't got it printed yet . " [Roxana]81-roxy darted a suspicious glance at [him]0-i . "[497-dat man] Did [you]0-i he'p [him]497-dat man fix up [de bill]1168-de bill ? " [Tom]83-tom cursed [himself]83-tom for making that stupid blunder , and tried to rectify it by saying [he]83-tom remembered , now , that it was at noon Monday that [the man]692-the man gave [him]83-tom the bill . [Roxana]81-roxy said-- "[0-i] [You]0-i 's lyin ' ag'in , [sho]969-sho . " Then [she]81-roxy straightened up and raised [her]81-roxy finger : "[0-i] Now den ! [I]0-i 's gwine to ask [you]0-i a question , en [I]0-i wants to know how [you]0-i 's gwine to git aroun ' it . [You]0-i knowed [he]497-dat man ' uz arter [me]0-i ; en if [you]0-i run off , ' stid o ' stayin ' here to he'p [him]497-dat man , [he]497-dat man 'd know [dey]1170-dey ' uz somethin' wrong 'bout dis business , en den [he]497-dat man would inquire 'bout [you]0-i , en dat would take [him]497-dat man to [[yo]0-i ' uncle]598-yo ' uncle , en [[yo]0-i ' [uncle]615-uncle]598-yo ' uncle would read [de bill]1168-de bill en see dat [you]0-i be'n sellin ' a free nigger down [de river]1447-de river , en [you]0-i know [him]497-dat man , [I]0-i reckon ! [He]497-dat man 'd t'ar up [de]1170-dey will en kick [you]0-i outen [de house]542-de house . Now , [den]579-den , [you]579-den answer [me]0-i dis question : hain't [you]579-den tole [dat man]497-dat man dat [I]0-i would be sho ' to come [here]232-here , en [den]579-den [you]579-den would fix it so [he]497-dat man could set a trap en ketch [me]0-i ? " [Tom]83-tom recognized that neither lies nor arguments could help [him]83-tom any longer -- [he]83-tom was in a vise , with the screw turned on , and out of it there was no budging . [His]83-tom face began to take on an ugly look , and presently [he]83-tom said , with a snarl-- "[579-den] Well , what could [I]0-i do ? [You]579-den see , [yourself]579-den , that [I]0-i was in [his]497-dat man grip and could n't get out . " [Roxy]81-roxy scorched [him]83-tom with a scornful gaze awhile , then [she]81-roxy said-- "[0-i] What could [you]0-i do ? [You]0-i could be [Judas]195-judas to [[yo]0-i ' own mother]1181-yo ' own mother to save [[yo]0-i ' wuthless hide]1182-yo ' wuthless hide ! Would [anybody]1438-anybody b'lieve it ? No -- a dog could n't ! [You]0-i is [de]1184-de low - downest orneriest hound dat was ever pup'd into dis worl'--en [I]0-i 's ' sponsible for it!"--and [she]81-roxy spat on [him]0-i . [He]0-i made no effort to resent this . [Roxy]81-roxy reflected a moment , then [she]81-roxy said-- "[0-i] Now [I]0-i 'll tell [you]0-i what [you]0-i 's gwine to do . [You]0-i 's gwine to give [dat man]497-dat man de money dat [you]0-i 's got laid up , en make [him]497-dat man wait till [you]0-i kin go to [de Judge]656-de judge en git de res ' en buy [me]0-i free agin . " "[196-thunder] [Thunder]196-thunder ! what are [you]0-i thinking of ? Go and ask [him]497-dat man for three hundred dollars and odd ? What would [I]0-i tell [him]497-dat man [I]0-i want with it , pray ? " [Roxy]81-roxy 's answer was delivered in a serene and level voice-- "[0-i] [You]0-i 'll tell [him]497-dat man [you]0-i 's sole [me]0-i to pay [yo]0-i ' gamblin ' debts en dat [you]0-i lied to [me]0-i en was [a villain]1187-a villain , en dat [I]0-i ' quires [you]0-i to git dat money en buy [me]0-i back ag'in . " "[0-i] Why , [you]0-i 've gone stark mad ! [He]497-dat man would tear the will to shreds in a minute -- don't [you]0-i know that ? " "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i does . " "[0-i] Then [you]0-i do n't believe [I]0-i 'm idiot enough to go to [him]497-dat man , do [you]0-i ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't b'lieve nothin' 'bout it -- [I]0-i knows [you]0-i 's a - goin' . [I]0-i knows it ' ca'se [you]0-i knows dat if [you]0-i do n't raise dat money [I]0-i 'll go to [him]497-dat man [myself]0-i , en [den]579-den [he]497-dat man 'll sell [you]0-i down [de river]1447-de river , en [you]0-i kin see how [you]0-i like it ! " [Tom]83-tom rose , trembling and excited , and there was an evil light in [his]83-tom eye . [He]83-tom strode to the door and said [he]83-tom must get out of [this suffocating place]2535-this suffocating place for a moment and clear [his]83-tom brain in the fresh air so that [he]83-tom could determine what to do . The door would n't open . [Roxy]81-roxy smiled grimly , and said-- "[0-i] [I]0-i 's got [de]579-den key , [honey]1471-honey -- set down . [You]1471-honey need n't cle'r up [yo]1471-honey ' brain none to fine out what [you]1471-honey gwine to do -- [I]0-i knows what [you]1471-honey 's gwine to do . " [Tom]83-tom sat down and began to pass [his]83-tom hands through [his]83-tom hair with a helpless and desperate air . [Roxy]81-roxy said , "[0-i] Is [dat man in [dis house]2527-dis house]1191-dat man in dis house ? " [Tom]83-tom glanced up with a surprised expression , and asked-- "[0-i] What gave [you]0-i such an idea ? " "[0-i] [You]0-i done it . [Gwine]197-gwine out to cle'r [yo]1471-honey ' brain ! In de fust place [you]1471-honey ai n't got none to cle'r , en in de second place [yo]1471-honey ' ornery eye tole on [you]1471-honey . [You]1471-honey 's [de]1471-honey low - downest hound dat ever -- but [I]0-i done tole [you]1471-honey dat befo ' . Now den , dis is Friday . [You]1471-honey kin fix it up wid [dat man]497-dat man , en tell [him]497-dat man [you]1471-honey 's gwine away to git [de res ' o ' de money]1194-de res ' o ' de money , en dat [you]1471-honey 'll be back wid it nex ' Tuesday , or maybe Wednesday . [You]1471-honey understan ' ? " [Tom]83-tom answered sullenly-- "[1471-honey] Yes . " "[1471-honey] En when [you]0-i gits de new bill o ' sale dat sells [me]0-i to [[my]0-i own self]953-my own self , take en send it in de mail to [Mr. Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson , en write on de back dat [he]497-dat man 's to keep it tell [I]0-i come . [You]1471-honey understan ' ? " "[1471-honey] Yes . " "[1471-honey] [Dat]1196-dat 's all den . Take [yo]1471-honey ' umbreller , en put on [yo]1471-honey ' hat . " "[1471-honey] Why ? " "[1471-honey] Beca'se [you]1471-honey 's gwine to see [me]0-i [home]1541-home to [de wharf]1160-de wharf . [You]1471-honey see dis knife ? [I]0-i 's toted it aroun ' sence de day [I]0-i seed [dat man]497-dat man en bought dese clo'es en it . If [he]497-dat man ketch [me]0-i , [I]0-i 's gwine to kill [myself]0-i wid it . Now start along , en go sof ' , en lead de way ; en if [you]1471-honey gives a sign in [dis house]2527-dis house , or if [anybody]1438-anybody comes up to [you]1471-honey in [de street]1202-de street , [I]0-i 's gwine to jam it right into [you]1471-honey . [Chambers]95-chambers , does [you]95-chambers b'lieve [me]0-i when [I]0-i says dat ? " "[95-chambers] It 's no use to bother [me]0-i with that question . [I]0-i know [your]95-chambers word 's good . " "[0-i] Yes , it 's diff'rent from [yo'n]1203-yo'n ! Shet de light out en move along -- here 's de key . " [They]2536-they were not followed . [Tom]83-tom trembled every time [a late straggler]2537-a late straggler brushed by [them]2536-they on [the street]274-the street , and half expected to feel the cold steel in [his]83-tom back . [Roxy]81-roxy was right at [his]83-tom heels and always in reach . After tramping a mile [they]2536-they reached a wide vacancy on [the deserted wharves]2539-the deserted wharves , and in [this dark and rainy desert]2540-this dark and rainy desert [they]2536-they parted . As [Tom]83-tom trudged [home]1541-home [his]83-tom mind was full of dreary thoughts and wild plans ; but at last [he]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom , wearily-- "[1204-her] There is but the one way out . [I]0-i must follow [her]1204-her plan . But with a variation -- [I]0-i will not ask for the money and ruin [myself]0-i ; [I]0-i will rob the old skinflint . " CHAPTER XIX . The Prophecy Realized . Few things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . It were not best that [we]2542-we should all think alike ; it is difference of opinion that makes horse - races.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . [Dawson]113-dawson 's Landing was comfortably finishing its season of dull repose and waiting patiently for the duel . [Count Luigi]119-luigi was waiting , too ; but not patiently , rumor said . [Sunday]198-sunday came , and [Luigi]119-luigi insisted on having [his]119-luigi challenge conveyed . [Wilson]86-wilson carried it . [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll declined to fight with an assassin--"that[1204-her] is , " [he]88-judge driscoll added significantly , "[1204-her] in [the field of honor]1205-the field of honor . " Elsewhere , of course , [he]88-judge driscoll would be ready . [Wilson]86-wilson tried to convince [him]88-judge driscoll that if [he]88-judge driscoll had been present [himself]88-judge driscoll when [Angelo]120-angelo told about the homicide committed by [Luigi]119-luigi , [he]88-judge driscoll would not have considered the act discreditable to [Luigi]119-luigi ; but [the obstinate old man]2543-the obstinate old man was not to be moved . [Wilson]86-wilson went back to [[his]86-wilson principal]2544-his principal and reported the failure of [his]86-wilson mission . [Luigi]119-luigi was incensed , and asked how it could be that [the old gentleman]2236-the old gentleman , who was by no means dull - witted , held [[his]1206-his trifling nephew]2546-his trifling nephew 's evidence and inferences to be of more value than [Wilson]86-wilson 's . But [Wilson]86-wilson laughed , and said-- "[1204-her] That is quite simple ; that is easily explicable . [I]0-i am not [[his]1206-his doll]1207-his doll -- [[his]1206-his baby]1208-his baby -- [his]1206-his infatuation : [[his]1206-his nephew]1209-his nephew is . [The Judge]315-the judge and [[his]315-the judge late wife]1211-his late wife never had [any children]1212-any children . [The Judge]315-the judge and [[his]315-the judge wife]310-his wife were past middle age when this treasure fell into [their]1215-their lap . [One]345-one must make allowances for a parental instinct that has been starving for twenty - five or thirty years . [It]1217-it is famished , it is crazed with hunger by that time , and will be entirely satisfied with anything that comes handy ; its taste is atrophied , it ca n't tell mud - cat from shad . [A devil born to [a young couple]1219-a young couple]1218-a devil born to a young couple is measurably recognizable by [them]1219-a young couple as [a devil]1220-a devil before long , but [a devil adopted by [an old couple]1222-an old couple]1221-a devil adopted by an old couple is an angel to [them]1222-an old couple , and remains so , through thick and thin . [Tom]83-tom is [[this old man]1223-this old man 's angel]1224-this old man 's angel ; [he]83-tom is infatuated with [him]83-tom . [Tom]83-tom can persuade [him]1223-this old man into things which [other people]541-other people can't -- not all things ; [I]0-i do n't mean that , but a good many -- particularly one class of things : the things that create or abolish personal partialities or prejudices in [the old man]2231-the old man 's mind . [The old man]2231-the old man liked both of [you]1228-you . [Tom]83-tom conceived a hatred for [you]1228-you . That was enough ; it turned [the old man]2231-the old man around at once . The oldest and strongest friendship must go to the ground when one of [these late - adopted darlings]1230-these late - adopted darlings throws a brick at it . " "[1230-these late - adopted darlings] It 's a curious philosophy , " said [Luigi]119-luigi . "[1230-these late - adopted darlings] It ai n't a philosophy at all -- it 's a fact . And there is something pathetic and beautiful about it , too . [I]0-i think there is nothing more pathetic than to see one of [these poor old childless couples]1231-these poor old childless couples taking a menagerie of yelping little worthless dogs to [their]1222-an old couple hearts ; and then adding some cursing and squawking parrots and [a jackass - voiced macaw]1232-a jackass - voiced macaw ; and next a couple of hundred screeching song - birds , and presently some fetid guinea - pigs and rabbits , and a howling colony of cats . It is all a groping and ignorant effort to construct out of base metal and brass filings , so to speak , something to take the place of that golden treasure denied [them]1222-an old couple by Nature , [a child]313-a child . But this is a digression . The unwritten law of [this region]1234-this region requires [you]1228-you to kill [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll on sight , and [he]88-judge driscoll and [the community]319-the community will expect that attention at [your]1228-you hands -- though of course [your]1228-you own death by [his]88-judge driscoll bullet will answer every purpose . Look out for [him]88-judge driscoll ! Are [you]1228-you heeled -- that is , fixed ? " "[88-judge driscoll] Yes , [he]88-judge driscoll shall have [his]88-judge driscoll opportunity . If [he]88-judge driscoll attacks [me]0-i [I]0-i will respond . " As [Wilson]86-wilson was leaving , [he]86-wilson said-- "[315-the judge] [The Judge]315-the judge is still a little used up by [his]315-the judge campaign work , and will not get out for a day or so ; but when [he]88-judge driscoll does get out , [you]1228-you want to be on the alert . " About eleven at night [the twins]1762-the twins went out for exercise , and started on a long stroll in the veiled moonlight . [Tom Driscoll]83-tom had landed at [[Hackett]199-hackett 's Store]2548-hackett 's store , two miles below [[Dawson]113-dawson 's]75-dawson 's landing , just about half an hour earlier , [the only passenger for [that lonely spot]2550-that lonely spot]2549-the only passenger for that lonely spot , and had walked up [the shore road]2551-the shore road and entered [[Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll 's house]373-judge driscoll 's house without having encountered any one either on [the road]2023-the road or under the roof . [He]83-tom pulled down [his]83-tom window - blinds and lighted [his]83-tom candle . [He]83-tom laid off [his]83-tom coat and hat and began [his]83-tom preparations . [He]83-tom unlocked [his]83-tom trunk and got [his]83-tom suit of [girl]2064-girl 's clothes out from under the male attire in it , and laid it by . Then [he]83-tom blacked [his]83-tom face with burnt cork and put the cork in [his]83-tom pocket . [His]83-tom plan was , to slip down to [[[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle 's private sitting - room below]2556-his uncle 's private sitting - room below , pass into [the bedroom]1881-the bedroom , steal the safe - key from [the old gentleman]2236-the old gentleman 's clothes , and then go back and rob the safe . [He]83-tom took up [his]83-tom candle to start . [His]83-tom courage and confidence were high , up to this point , but both began to waver a little , now . Suppose [he]83-tom should make a noise , by some accident , and get caught -- say , in the act of opening the safe ? Perhaps it would be well to go armed . [He]83-tom took the Indian knife from its hiding - place , and felt a pleasant return of [his]83-tom wandering courage . [He]83-tom slipped stealthily down [the narrow stair]2559-the narrow stair , [his]83-tom hair rising and [his]83-tom pulses halting at the slightest creak . When [he]83-tom was half - way down , [he]83-tom was disturbed to perceive that [the landing below]2560-the landing below was touched by a faint glow of light . What could that mean ? Was [[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle still up ? No , that was not likely ; [he]1660-his uncle must have left [his]1660-his uncle night - taper there when [he]1660-his uncle went to bed . [Tom]83-tom crept on down , pausing at every step to listen . [He]83-tom found the door standing open , and glanced in . What [he]83-tom saw pleased [him]83-tom beyond measure . [[His]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle was asleep on the sofa ; on a small table at the head of the sofa a lamp was burning low , and by it stood [the old man]2231-the old man 's small tin cash - box , closed . Near the box was a pile of bank - notes and a piece of paper covered with figures in pencil . The safe - door was not open . Evidently [the sleeper]2564-the sleeper had wearied [himself]2564-the sleeper with work upon [his]2564-the sleeper finances , and was taking a rest . [Tom]83-tom set [his]83-tom candle on [the stairs]2565-the stairs , and began to make [his]83-tom way toward the pile of notes , stooping low as [he]83-tom went . When [he]83-tom was passing [[his]83-tom uncle]1660-his uncle , [the old man]2231-the old man stirred in [his]2231-the old man sleep , and [Tom]83-tom stopped instantly -- stopped , and softly drew the knife from its sheath , with [his]83-tom heart thumping , and [his]83-tom eyes fastened upon [[his]83-tom benefactor]2568-his benefactor 's face . After a moment or two [he]83-tom ventured forward again -- one step -- reached for [his]83-tom prize and seized it , dropping the knife - sheath . Then [he]83-tom felt [the old man]2231-the old man 's strong grip upon [him]83-tom , and a wild cry of "[1237-those old maids] Help ! help ! " rang in [his]83-tom ear . Without hesitation [he]83-tom drove the knife home -- and was free . Some of the notes escaped from [his]83-tom left hand and fell in the blood on the floor . [He]83-tom dropped the knife and snatched them up and started to fly ; transferred them to [his]83-tom left hand , and seized the knife again , in [his]83-tom fright and confusion , but remembered [himself]83-tom and flung it from [him]83-tom , as being [a dangerous witness to carry away with [him]83-tom]2570-a dangerous witness to carry away with him . [He]83-tom jumped for the stair - foot , and closed the door behind [him]83-tom ; and as [he]83-tom snatched [his]83-tom candle and fled upward , the stillness of the night was broken by the sound of urgent footsteps approaching [the house]247-the house . In another moment [he]83-tom was in [[his]83-tom room]1973-his room and [the twins]1762-the twins were standing aghast over the body of [the murdered man]2574-the murdered man ! [Tom]83-tom put on [his]83-tom coat , buttoned [his]83-tom hat under it , threw on [his]83-tom suit of [girl]2064-girl 's clothes , dropped the veil , blew out [his]83-tom light , locked the room door by which [he]83-tom had just entered , taking the key , passed through [his]83-tom other door into [the back hall]2576-the back hall , locked that door and kept the key , then worked [his]83-tom way along in the dark and descended [the back stairs]2577-the back stairs . [He]83-tom was not expecting to meet [anybody]1438-anybody , for all interest was centered in [the other part of [the house]247-the house]2579-the other part of the house , now ; [his]83-tom calculation proved correct . By the time [he]83-tom was passing through [the back - yard]2581-the back - yard , [Mrs. Pratt]77-mrs. pratt , [[her]77-mrs. pratt servants]2582-her servants , and [a dozen half - dressed neighbors]2583-a dozen half - dressed neighbors had joined [the twins]1762-the twins and [the dead]2585-the dead , and [accessions]2586-accessions were still arriving at the front door . As [Tom]83-tom , quaking as with a palsy , passed out at the gate , [three women]2587-three women came flying from [the house]247-the house on the opposite side of [the lane]1895-the lane . [They]1237-those old maids rushed by [him]83-tom and in at the gate , asking [him]83-tom what the trouble was there , but not waiting for an answer . [Tom]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom , "[1237-those old maids] [Those old maids]1237-those old maids waited to dress -- [they]1237-those old maids did the same thing the night [[Stevens]200-stevens 's house]1238-stevens 's house burned down next door . " In a few minutes [he]83-tom was in [the haunted house]1978-the haunted house . [He]83-tom lighted a candle and took off [his]83-tom girl - clothes . There was blood on [him]83-tom all down [his]83-tom left side , and [his]83-tom right hand was red with the stains of the blood - soaked notes which [he]83-tom had crushed in it ; but otherwise [he]83-tom was free from this sort of evidence . [He]83-tom cleansed [his]83-tom hand on the straw , and cleaned most of the smut from [his]83-tom face . Then [he]83-tom burned [his]83-tom male and female attire to ashes , scattered the ashes , and put on a disguise proper for [a tramp]2591-a tramp . [He]83-tom blew out [his]83-tom light , went below , and was soon loafing down [the river road]2592-the river road with the intent to borrow and use one of [Roxy]81-roxy 's devices . [He]83-tom found [a canoe]1600-a canoe and paddled off [down - stream]2594-down - stream , setting [the canoe]2595-the canoe adrift as dawn approached , and making [his]83-tom way by [land]2596-land to [the next village]2597-the next village , where [he]83-tom kept out of sight till [a transient steamer]2598-a transient steamer came along , and then took deck passage for [St. Louis]8-st. louis . [He]83-tom was ill at ease until [[Dawson]113-dawson 's Landing]1644-dawson 's landing was behind [him]83-tom ; then [he]83-tom said to [himself]83-tom , "[1237-those old maids] All [the detectives on earth]1239-the detectives on earth could n't trace [me]0-i now ; there 's not a vestige of a clue left in [the world]263-the world ; that homicide will take its place with the permanent mysteries , and [people]388-people wo n't get done trying to guess out the secret of it for fifty years . " In [St. Louis]8-st. louis , next morning , [he]83-tom read this brief telegram in the papers -- dated at [Dawson 's Landing]75-dawson 's landing : [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll , [an old and respected citizen]2600-an old and respected citizen , was assassinated [here]232-here about midnight by [a profligate Italian nobleman or barber]2602-a profligate italian nobleman or barber on account of a quarrel growing out of the recent election . [The assassin]2603-the assassin will probably be lynched . "[1242-one of the twins] [One of [the twins]1762-the twins]1242-one of the twins ! " soliloquized [Tom]83-tom ; "[1242-one of the twins] how lucky ! It is the knife that has done [him]1242-one of the twins this grace . [We]1244-we never know when fortune is trying to favor [us]1244-we . [I]0-i actually cursed [Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson in [my]0-i heart for putting it out of [my]0-i power to sell that knife . [I]0-i take it back , now . " [Tom]83-tom was now rich and independent . [He]83-tom arranged with [the planter]2415-the planter , and mailed to [Wilson]86-wilson the new bill of sale which sold [Roxana]81-roxy to [herself]81-roxy ; then [he]83-tom telegraphed [[his]83-tom Aunt]2059-his aunt [Pratt]77-mrs. pratt : Have seen the awful news in the papers and am almost prostrated with grief . Shall start by packet to - day . Try to bear up till [I]0-i come . When [Wilson]86-wilson reached [the house of mourning]2606-the house of mourning and had gathered such details as [Mrs. Pratt]77-mrs. pratt and [the rest of [the crowd]2136-the crowd]2607-the rest of the crowd could tell [him]86-wilson , [he]86-wilson took command as [mayor]2283-mayor , and gave orders that nothing should be touched , but everything left as it was until [Justice Robinson]123-justice robinson should arrive and take the proper measures as [coroner]2610-coroner . [He]86-wilson cleared [everybody]367-everybody out of [the room]1731-the room but [the twins]1762-the twins and [himself]86-wilson . [The sheriff]2614-the sheriff soon arrived and took [the twins]1762-the twins away to [jail]2616-jail . [Wilson]86-wilson told [them]1762-the twins to keep heart , and promised to do [his]86-wilson best in [their]1762-the twins defense when the case should come to trial . [Justice Robinson]123-justice robinson came presently , and with [him]86-wilson [Constable Blake]175-blake . [They]1762-the twins examined [the room]1731-the room thoroughly . [They]1762-the twins found the knife and the sheath . [Wilson]86-wilson noticed that there were finger - prints on the knife - handle . That pleased [him]86-wilson , for [the twins]1762-the twins had required [the earliest comers]2619-the earliest comers to make a scrutiny of [their]1762-the twins hands and clothes , and [neither these people]2620-neither these people nor [Wilson]86-wilson [himself]86-wilson had found any blood - stains upon [them]1762-the twins . Could there be a possibility that [the twins]1762-the twins had spoken the truth when [they]1762-the twins said [they]1762-the twins found [the man]692-the man dead when [they]1762-the twins ran into [the house]247-the house in answer to the cry for help ? [He]86-wilson thought of [that mysterious girl]2624-that mysterious girl at once . But this was not the sort of work for [a girl]2625-a girl to be engaged in . No matter ; [[Tom Driscoll]83-tom 's room]2626-tom driscoll 's room must be examined . After [the coroner]2627-the coroner 's jury had viewed the body and its surroundings , [Wilson]86-wilson suggested a search up - [stairs]2628-stairs , and [he]86-wilson went along . [The jury]2629-the jury forced an entrance to [[Tom]83-tom 's room]2630-tom 's room , but found nothing , of course . [The coroner 's jury]2631-the coroner 's jury found that the homicide was committed by [Luigi]119-luigi , and that [Angelo]120-angelo was accessory to it . [The town]289-the town was bitter against [the unfortunates]2633-the unfortunates , and for the first few days after the murder [they]2633-the unfortunates were in constant danger of being lynched . [The grand jury]2634-the grand jury presently indicted [Luigi]119-luigi for murder in the first degree , and [Angelo]120-angelo as [accessory before the fact]2635-accessory before the fact . [The twins]1762-the twins were transferred from [the city jail]2637-the city jail to [the county prison]2638-the county prison to await trial . [Wilson]86-wilson examined the finger - marks on the knife - handle and said to [himself]86-wilson , "[0-i] [Neither of [the twins]1762-the twins]1245-neither of the twins made those marks . " Then manifestly there was [another person concerned]2639-another person concerned , either in [his]86-wilson own interest or as [hired assassin]2640-hired assassin . But who could it be ? That , [he]86-wilson must try to find out . [The safe]2641-the safe was not open , the cash - box was closed , and had three thousand dollars in it . Then robbery was not the motive , and revenge was . Where had [the murdered man]2574-the murdered man an enemy except [Luigi]119-luigi ? There was but [that one person in [the world]263-the world with a deep grudge against [him]119-luigi]2643-that one person in the world with a deep grudge against him . [The mysterious girl]2275-the mysterious girl ! [The girl]421-the girl was a great trial to [Wilson]86-wilson . If the motive had been robbery , [the girl]421-the girl might answer ; but there was n't [any girl that would want to take [this old man]1223-this old man 's life for revenge]2648-any girl that would want to take this old man 's life for revenge . [He]1223-this old man had no quarrels with [girls]2650-girls ; [he]1223-this old man was [a gentleman]306-a gentleman . [Wilson]86-wilson had perfect tracings of the finger - marks of the knife - handle ; and among [his]86-wilson glass - records [he]86-wilson had a great array of finger - prints of [women]2652-women and [girls]2650-girls , collected during the last fifteen or eighteen years , but [he]86-wilson scanned them in vain , they successfully withstood every test ; among them were no duplicates of the prints on the knife . The presence of the knife on the stage of the murder was a worrying circumstance for [Wilson]86-wilson . A week previously [he]86-wilson had as good as admitted to [himself]86-wilson that [he]86-wilson believed [Luigi]119-luigi had possessed such a knife , and that [he]119-luigi still possessed it notwithstanding [his]119-luigi pretense that it had been stolen . And now here was the knife , and with it [the twins]1762-the twins . Half [the town]289-the town had said [the twins]1762-the twins were humbugging when [they]1762-the twins claimed that [they]1762-the twins had lost [their]1762-the twins knife , and now [these people]2657-these people were joyful , and said , "[1245-neither of the twins] [I]0-i told [you]0-i so ! " If [their]1762-the twins finger - prints had been on the handle -- but it was useless to bother any further about that ; the finger - prints on the handle were not theirs -- that [he]86-wilson knew perfectly . [Wilson]86-wilson refused to suspect [Tom]83-tom ; for first , [Tom]83-tom could n't murder [anybody]1438-anybody -- [he]83-tom had n't character enough ; secondly , if [he]83-tom could murder [a person]2031-a person [he]83-tom would n't select [[his]83-tom doting benefactor]2660-his doting benefactor and [nearest relative]2661-nearest relative ; thirdly , self - interest was in the way ; for while [the uncle]2662-the uncle lived , [Tom]83-tom was sure of a free support and a chance to get the destroyed will revived again , but with [the uncle]2662-the uncle gone , that chance was gone , too . It was true the will had really been revived , as was now discovered , but [Tom]83-tom could not have been aware of it , or [he]83-tom would have spoken of it , in [his]83-tom native talky , unsecretive way . Finally , [Tom]83-tom was in [St. Louis]8-st. louis when the murder was done , and got the news out of the morning journals , as was shown by [his]83-tom telegram to [[his]83-tom aunt]2059-his aunt . These speculations were unemphasized sensations rather than articulated thoughts , for [Wilson]86-wilson would have laughed at the idea of seriously connecting [Tom]83-tom with the murder . [Wilson]86-wilson regarded the case of [the twins]1762-the twins as desperate -- in fact , about hopeless . For [he]86-wilson argued that if [a confederate]2666-a confederate was not found , [an enlightened Missouri jury]2667-an enlightened missouri jury would hang [them]1762-the twins , sure ; if [a confederate]2666-a confederate was found , that would not improve the matter , but simply furnish one more person for [the sheriff]2614-the sheriff to hang . Nothing could save [the twins]1762-the twins but the discovery of [a person who did the murder]2671-a person who did the murder on [his]2671-a person who did the murder sole personal account -- an undertaking which had all the aspect of the impossible . Still , [the person who made the finger - prints]2672-the person who made the finger - prints must be sought . [The twins]1762-the twins might have no case with [him]2671-a person who did the murder , but [they]1762-the twins certainly would have none without [him]2671-a person who did the murder . So [Wilson]86-wilson mooned around , thinking , thinking , guessing , guessing , day and night , and arriving nowhere . Whenever [he]86-wilson ran across [a girl]2625-a girl or [a woman [he]86-wilson was not acquainted with]2675-a woman he was not acquainted with , [he]86-wilson got [her]2625-a girl finger - prints , on one pretext or another ; and they always cost [him]86-wilson a sigh when [he]86-wilson got [home]1541-home , for [they]1762-the twins never tallied with the finger - marks on the knife - handle . As to [the mysterious girl]2275-the mysterious girl , [Tom]83-tom swore [he]83-tom knew [no such girl]2678-no such girl , and did not remember ever seeing [a girl wearing a dress like the one described by [Wilson]86-wilson]2679-a girl wearing a dress like the one described by wilson . [He]83-tom admitted that [he]83-tom did not always lock [[his]83-tom room]1973-his room , and that sometimes [the servants]1940-the servants forgot to lock [the house]247-the house doors ; still , in [his]83-tom opinion [the girl]421-the girl must have made but few visits or [she]421-the girl would have been discovered . When [Wilson]86-wilson tried to connect [her]421-the girl with the stealing - raid , and thought [she]421-the girl might have been [[the old woman]862-the old woman 's confederate]2685-the old woman 's confederate , if not [the very thief]2686-the very thief [herself]421-the girl disguised as [an old woman]2687-an old woman , [Tom]83-tom seemed stuck , and also much interested , and said [he]83-tom would keep a sharp eye out for [this person]2481-this person or [persons]2689-persons , although [he]83-tom was afraid that [she]2481-this person or [they]2689-persons would be too smart to venture again into [a town where [everybody]367-everybody would now be on the watch for a good while to come]2690-a town where everybody would now be on the watch for a good while to come . [Everybody]367-everybody was pitying [Tom]83-tom , [he]83-tom looked so quiet and sorrowful , and seemed to feel [his]83-tom great loss so deeply . [He]83-tom was playing a part , but it was not all a part . The picture of [[his]83-tom alleged uncle]2693-his alleged uncle , as [he]83-tom had last seen [him]2693-his alleged uncle , was before [him]83-tom in the dark pretty frequently , when [he]83-tom was awake , and called again in [his]83-tom dreams , when [he]83-tom was asleep . [He]83-tom would n't go into [the room where the tragedy had happened]2694-the room where the tragedy had happened . This charmed [the doting Mrs. Pratt]2695-the doting mrs. pratt , who realized now , "[1247-she] as [she]1247-she had never done before , " [she]1247-she said , what a sensitive and delicate nature [[her]1247-she darling]419-her darling had , and how [he]83-tom adored [[his]83-tom poor uncle]2697-his poor uncle . CHAPTER XX . [The Murderer Chuckles]2698-the murderer chuckles . Even the clearest and most perfect circumstantial evidence is likely to be at fault , after all , and therefore ought to be received with great caution . Take the case of any pencil , sharpened by [any woman]2699-any woman : if [you]2700-you have [witnesses]2701-witnesses , [you]2700-you will find [she]2699-any woman did it with a knife ; but if [you]2700-you take simply the aspect of the pencil , [you]2700-you will say [she]2699-any woman did it with [her]2699-any woman teeth.--Pudd'nhead [[Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar]2702-wilson 's calendar . The weeks dragged along , [no friend]2703-no friend visiting [the jailed twins]2704-the jailed twins but [[their]2704-the jailed twins counsel]2705-their counsel and [Aunt Patsy Cooper]117-aunt patsy , and the day of trial came at last -- the heaviest day in [Wilson]86-wilson 's life ; for with all [his]86-wilson tireless diligence [he]86-wilson had discovered no sign or trace of [the missing confederate]2706-the missing confederate . "[1247-she] Confederate " was the term [he]86-wilson had long ago privately accepted for [that person]2707-that person -- not as being unquestionably the right term , but as being at least possibly the right one , though [he]86-wilson was never able to understand why [the twins]1762-the twins did not vanish and escape , as [the confederate]2709-the confederate had done , instead of remaining by [the murdered man]2574-the murdered man and getting caught [there]1623-there . [The court - house]2712-the court - house was crowded , of course , and would remain so to the finish , for not only in [the town itself]2713-the town itself , but in [the country]2439-the country for miles around , the trial was the one topic of conversation among [the people]332-the people . [Mrs. Pratt]77-mrs. pratt , in deep mourning , and [Tom]83-tom with a weed on [his]83-tom hat , had seats near [Pembroke Howard]78-howard , [the public prosecutor]2716-the public prosecutor , and back of [them]1762-the twins sat [a great array of [friends of [the family]1730-the family]2718-friends of the family]2717-a great array of friends of the family . [The twins]1762-the twins had but [one friend present to keep [their]1762-the twins counsel]2721-one friend present to keep their counsel in countenance , [[their]1762-the twins poor old sorrowing landlady]2722-their poor old sorrowing landlady . [She]2722-their poor old sorrowing landlady sat near [Wilson]86-wilson , and looked [[her]2722-their poor old sorrowing landlady friendliest]2723-her friendliest . In the "[0-i] nigger corner " sat [Chambers]95-chambers ; also [Roxy]81-roxy , with good clothes on , and [her]81-roxy bill of sale in [her]81-roxy pocket . It was [her]81-roxy most precious possession , and [she]81-roxy never parted with it , day or night . [Tom]83-tom had allowed [her]81-roxy thirty - five dollars a month ever since [he]83-tom came into [[his]83-tom property]2724-his property , and had said that [he]83-tom and [she]81-roxy ought to be grateful to [the twins]1762-the twins for making [them]1762-the twins rich ; but had roused such a temper in [her]81-roxy by this speech that [he]83-tom did not repeat the argument afterward . [She]81-roxy said [the old Judge]2225-the old judge had treated [[her]81-roxy child]407-her child a thousand times better than [he]83-tom deserved , and had never done [her]81-roxy an unkindness in [his]83-tom life ; so [she]81-roxy hated [these outlandish devils]2728-these outlandish devils for killing [him]83-tom , and should n't ever sleep satisfied till [she]81-roxy saw [them]2728-these outlandish devils hanged for it . [She]81-roxy was here to watch the trial , now , and was going to lift up just one "[0-i] hooraw " over it if [the County Judge]2729-the county judge put [her]81-roxy in [jail]2616-jail a year for it . [She]81-roxy gave [her]81-roxy turbaned head a toss and said , "[0-i] When dat verdic ' comes , [I]0-i 's gwine to lif ' dat roof , now , [I]0-i tell [you]1248-you . " [Pembroke Howard]78-howard briefly sketched [the State]2731-the state 's case . [He]83-tom said [he]83-tom would show by a chain of circumstantial evidence without break or fault in it anywhere , that [the principal prisoner at the bar]2732-the principal prisoner at the bar committed the murder ; that the motive was partly revenge , and partly a desire to take [his]83-tom own life out of jeopardy , and that [[his]83-tom brother]1537-his brother , by [his]83-tom presence , was [a consenting accessory to the crime]2734-a consenting accessory to the crime ; a crime which was the basest known to the calendar of human misdeeds -- assassination ; that it was conceived by [the blackest of hearts and consummated by the cowardliest of hands]2735-the blackest of hearts and consummated by the cowardliest of hands ; a crime which had broken [a loving sister]2736-a loving sister 's heart , blighted the happiness of [a young nephew who was as dear as [a son]2738-a son]2737-a young nephew who was as dear as a son , brought inconsolable grief to [many friends]2739-many friends , and sorrow and loss to [the whole community]2740-the whole community . The utmost penalty of the outraged law would be exacted , and upon [the accused , now present at the bar]2741-the accused , now present at the bar , that penalty would unquestionably be executed . [He]83-tom would reserve further remark until [his]83-tom closing speech . [He]83-tom was strongly moved , and so also was [the whole house]2742-the whole house ; [Mrs. Pratt]77-mrs. pratt and [several other women]2743-several other women were weeping when [he]83-tom sat down , and many an eye that was full of hate was riveted upon [the unhappy prisoners]2744-the unhappy prisoners . [Witness]2745-witness after [witness]2745-witness was called by [the State]2731-the state , and questioned at length ; but the cross - questioning was brief . [Wilson]86-wilson knew [they]2748-they could furnish nothing valuable for [his]83-tom side . [People]388-people were sorry for [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson ; [his]86-wilson budding career would get hurt by this trial . [Several witnesses]2750-several witnesses swore [they]2750-several witnesses heard [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll say in [his]88-judge driscoll public speech that [the twins]1762-the twins would be able to find [their]1762-the twins lost knife again when [they]1762-the twins needed it to assassinate [somebody with]2752-somebody with . This was not news , but now it was seen to have been sorrowfully prophetic , and a profound sensation quivered through [the hushed court - room]2753-the hushed court - room when those dismal words were repeated . [The public prosecutor]2716-the public prosecutor rose and said that it was within [his]2716-the public prosecutor knowledge , through a conversation held with [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll on the last day of [his]2716-the public prosecutor life , that [counsel for the defense]2755-counsel for the defense had brought [him]2716-the public prosecutor a challenge from [the person charged at [this bar]2757-this bar with murder]2756-the person charged at this bar with murder ; that [he]2716-the public prosecutor had refused to fight with [a confessed assassin--"that]2758-a confessed assassin--"that[0-i] is , on the field of honor , " but had added significantly , that [he]2716-the public prosecutor would be ready for [him]2716-the public prosecutor elsewhere . Presumably [the person here charged with murder]2759-the person here charged with murder was warned that [he]2716-the public prosecutor must kill or be killed the first time [he]2716-the public prosecutor should meet [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll . If [counsel for [the defense]2761-the defense]2755-counsel for the defense chose to let the statement stand so , [he]2716-the public prosecutor would not call [him]2716-the public prosecutor to [the witness]2762-the witness stand . [Mr. Wilson]86-wilson said [he]86-wilson would offer no denial . [ [Murmurs]201-murmurs in [the house--"It]2763-the house--"it[0-i] is getting worse and worse for [Wilson]86-wilson 's case . " ] [Mrs. Pratt]77-mrs. pratt testified that [she]77-mrs. pratt heard no outcry , and did not know what woke [her]77-mrs. pratt up , unless it was the sound of rapid footsteps approaching the front door . [She]77-mrs. pratt jumped up and ran out in [the hall]1795-the hall just as [she]77-mrs. pratt was , and heard the footsteps flying up the front steps and then following behind [her]77-mrs. pratt as [she]77-mrs. pratt ran to [the sitting - room]2267-the sitting - room . There [she]77-mrs. pratt found [the accused]2766-the accused standing over [[her]77-mrs. pratt murdered brother]2767-her murdered brother . [ Here [she]77-mrs. pratt broke down and sobbed . Sensation in [the court]2768-the court . ] Resuming , [she]77-mrs. pratt said [the persons entering]2769-the persons entering behind [her]77-mrs. pratt were [Mr. Rogers]202-mr. rogers and [Mr. Buckstone]203-mr. buckstone . Cross - examined by [Wilson]86-wilson , [she]77-mrs. pratt said [the twins]1762-the twins proclaimed [their]1762-the twins innocence ; declared that [they]1762-the twins had been taking a walk , and had hurried to [the house]247-the house in response to a cry for help which was so loud and strong that [they]1762-the twins had heard it at a considerable distance ; that [they]1762-the twins begged [her]77-mrs. pratt and [the gentlemen]718-the gentlemen just mentioned to examine [their]1762-the twins hands and clothes -- which was done , and no blood stains found . Confirmatory evidence followed from [Rogers]202-mr. rogers and [Buckstone]203-mr. buckstone . The finding of the knife was verified , the advertisement minutely describing it and offering a reward for it was put in evidence , and its exact correspondence with that description proved . Then followed a few minor details , and the case for [the State]2731-the state was closed . [Wilson]86-wilson said that [he]86-wilson had [three witnesses]2774-three witnesses , [the Misses Clarkson]204-the misses clarkson , who would testify that [they]2774-three witnesses met [a veiled young woman leaving [[Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll 's premises]2776-judge driscoll 's premises by the back gate a few minutes after the cries for help were heard , and that [their]2774-three witnesses evidence , taken with certain circumstantial evidence which [he]86-wilson would call [the court]2768-the court 's attention to]2775-a veiled young woman leaving judge driscoll 's premises by the back gate a few minutes after the cries for help were heard , and that their evidence , taken with certain circumstantial evidence which he would call the court 's attention to , would in [his]86-wilson opinion convince [the court]2768-the court that there was still [one person concerned in this crime who had not yet been found , and also that a stay of proceedings]2779-one person concerned in this crime who had not yet been found , and also that a stay of proceedings ought to be granted , in justice to [[his]86-wilson clients]2780-his clients , until [that person]2707-that person should be discovered . As it was late , [he]86-wilson would ask leave to defer the examination of [[his]86-wilson three witnesses]2782-his three witnesses until the next morning . [The crowd]2136-the crowd poured out of [the place]2456-the place and went flocking away in [excited groups]2785-excited groups and [couples]2786-couples , talking the events of the session over with vivacity and consuming interest , and [everybody]367-everybody seemed to have had a satisfactory and enjoyable day except [the accused]2766-the accused , [[their]2774-three witnesses counsel]2705-their counsel , and [[their]2774-three witnesses old - lady friend]2790-their old - lady friend . There was no cheer among these , and no substantial hope . In parting with [the twins]1762-the twins [Aunt Patsy]117-aunt patsy did attempt a good - night with a gay pretense of hope and cheer in it , but broke down without finishing . Absolutely secure as [Tom]83-tom considered [himself]83-tom to be , the opening solemnities of the trial had nevertheless oppressed [him]83-tom with a vague uneasiness , [his]83-tom being a nature sensitive to even the smallest alarms ; but from the moment that the poverty and weakness of [Wilson]86-wilson 's case lay exposed to the court , [he]83-tom was comfortable once more , even jubilant . [He]83-tom left [the court - room]2792-the court - room sarcastically sorry for [Wilson]86-wilson . "[86-wilson] [The Clarksons]205-the clarksons met [an unknown woman in [the back lane]1250-the back lane]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane , " [he]83-tom said to [himself--"that]2793-himself--"that[1249-an unknown woman in the back lane] is [his]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane case ! [I]0-i 'll give [him]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane a century to find [her]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane in -- a couple of [them]1251-them if [he]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane likes . [A woman who does n't exist any longer]1252-a woman who does n't exist any longer , and the clothes that gave [her]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane [her]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane sex burnt up and the ashes thrown away -- oh , certainly , [he]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane 'll find [her]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane easy enough ! " This reflection set [him]0-i to admiring , for the hundredth time , the shrewd ingenuities by which [he]0-i had insured [himself]0-i against detection -- more , against even suspicion . "[1249-an unknown woman in the back lane] Nearly always in cases like this there is some little detail or other overlooked , some wee little track or trace left behind , and detection follows ; but here there 's not even the faintest suggestion of a trace left . No more than a bird leaves when it flies through the air -- yes , through the night , [you]1253-you may say . [The man that can track a bird through the air in the dark and find that bird]1254-the man that can track a bird through the air in the dark and find that bird is [the man to track [me]0-i out and find [[the Judge]315-the judge 's assassin]1257-the judge 's assassin]1255-the man to track me out and find the judge 's assassin -- no other need apply . And that is the job that has been laid out for [poor Pudd'nhead Wilson]86-wilson , of [all people in [the world]263-the world]1258-all people in the world ! [Lord]1260-lord , it will be pathetically funny to see [him]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane grubbing and groping after [that woman that do n't exist]1261-that woman that do n't exist , and [the right person]1262-the right person sitting under [his]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane very nose all the time ! " The more [he]0-i thought the situation over , the more the humor of it struck [him]0-i . Finally [he]0-i said , "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll never let [him]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane hear the last of [that woman]1263-that woman . Every time [I]0-i catch [him]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane in company , to [his]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane dying day , [I]0-i 'll ask [him]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane in the guileless affectionate way that used to gravel [him]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane so when [I]0-i inquired how [his]1249-an unknown woman in the back lane unborn law - business was coming along , ' Got on [her]1263-that woman track yet -- hey , [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson ? ' " [He]0-i wanted to laugh , but that would not have answered ; there were [people]388-people about , and [he]0-i was mourning for [[his]0-i uncle]1660-his uncle . [He]0-i made up [his]0-i mind that it would be good entertainment to look in on [Wilson]86-wilson that night and watch [him]86-wilson worry over [his]86-wilson barren law - case and goad [him]86-wilson with an exasperating word or two of sympathy and commiseration now and then . [Wilson]86-wilson wanted no supper , [he]86-wilson had no appetite . [He]86-wilson got out all the finger - prints of [girls]2650-girls and [women]2652-women in [his]86-wilson collection of records and pored gloomily over them an hour or more , trying to convince [himself]86-wilson that [that troublesome girl]2798-that troublesome girl 's marks were there somewhere and had been overlooked . But it was not so . [He]86-wilson drew back [his]86-wilson chair , clasped [his]86-wilson hands over [his]86-wilson head , and gave [himself]86-wilson up to dull and arid musings . [Tom Driscoll]83-tom dropped in , an hour after dark , and said with a pleasant laugh as [he]83-tom took a seat-- "[86-wilson] Hello , [we]1264-we 've gone back to the amusements of [our]1264-we days of neglect and obscurity for consolation , have [we]1264-we ? " and [he]83-tom took up one of the glass strips and held it against the light to inspect it . "[86-wilson] Come , cheer up , [old man]1265-old man ; there 's no use in losing [your]1265-old man grip and going back to this child's - play merely because this big sunspot is drifting across [your]1265-old man shiny new disk . It 'll pass , and [you]1265-old man 'll be all right again,"--and [he]83-tom laid the glass down . "[1265-old man] Did [you]1265-old man think [you]1265-old man could win always ? " "[1265-old man] Oh , no , " said [Wilson]86-wilson , with a sigh , "[1265-old man] [I]0-i did n't expect that , but [I]0-i ca n't believe [Luigi]119-luigi killed [[your]1265-old man uncle]1266-your uncle , and [I]0-i feel very sorry for [him]1266-your uncle . It makes [me]0-i blue . And [you]1265-old man would feel as [I]0-i do , [Tom]83-tom , if [you]1265-old man were not prejudiced against [those young fellows]1267-those young fellows . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know about that , " and [Tom]83-tom 's countenance darkened , for [his]83-tom memory reverted to [his]83-tom kicking ; "[0-i] [I]0-i owe [them]1267-those young fellows no good will , considering [the brunette one]1774-the brunette one 's treatment of [me]0-i that night . Prejudice or no prejudice , [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson , [I]0-i do n't like [them]1267-those young fellows , and when [they]1267-those young fellows get [their]1267-those young fellows deserts [you]1265-old man 're not going to find [me]0-i sitting on [the mourner]1269-the mourner 's bench . " [He]0-i took up another strip of glass , and exclaimed-- "[1265-old man] Why , here 's old [Roxy]81-roxy 's label ! Are [you]1265-old man going to ornament [the royal palaces]1270-the royal palaces with nigger paw - marks , too ? By the date here , [I]0-i was seven months old when this was done , and [she]81-roxy was nursing [me]0-i and [her]81-roxy little nigger cub . There 's a line straight across [her]81-roxy thumb - print . How comes that ? " and [Tom]83-tom held out the piece of glass to [Wilson]86-wilson . "[81-roxy] That is common , " said [the bored man]2799-the bored man , wearily . "[81-roxy] Scar of a cut or a scratch , usually"--and [he]0-i took the strip of glass indifferently , and raised it toward the lamp . All the blood sunk suddenly out of [his]0-i face ; [his]0-i hand quaked , and [he]0-i gazed at the polished surface before [him]0-i with the glassy stare of a corpse . "[81-roxy] [Great Heavens]206-great heavens , what 's the matter with [you]1265-old man , [Wilson]86-wilson ? Are [you]1265-old man going to faint ? " [Tom]83-tom sprang for a glass of water and offered it , but [Wilson]86-wilson shrank shuddering from [him]83-tom and said-- "[81-roxy] No , no!--take it away ! " [His]0-i breast was rising and falling , and [he]0-i moved [his]0-i head about in a dull and wandering way , like [a person who had been stunned]2800-a person who had been stunned . Presently [he]0-i said , "[0-i] [I]0-i shall feel better when [I]0-i get to bed ; [I]0-i have been overwrought to - day ; yes , and over worked for many days . " "[0-i] Then [I]0-i 'll leave [you]1265-old man and let [you]1265-old man to get to [your]1265-old man rest . Good - night , [old man]1265-old man . " But as [Tom]83-tom went out [he]83-tom could n't deny [himself]83-tom a small parting gibe : "[1265-old man] Do n't take it so hard ; a body ca n't win every time ; [you]1265-old man 'll hang [somebody]358-somebody yet . " [Wilson]86-wilson muttered to [himself]86-wilson , "[1265-old man] It is no lie to say [I]0-i am sorry [I]0-i have to begin with [you]1265-old man , miserable dog though [you]1265-old man are ! " [He]86-wilson braced [himself]86-wilson up with a glass of cold whisky , and went to work again . [He]86-wilson did not compare the new finger - marks unintentionally left by [Tom]83-tom a few minutes before on [Roxy]81-roxy 's glass with the tracings of the marks left on the knife - handle , there being no need for that ( for [his]86-wilson trained eye ) , but busied [himself]86-wilson with another matter , muttering from time to time , "[0-i] Idiot that [I]0-i was!--Nothing but [a girl]2625-a girl would do [me]0-i -- [a man in [girl]2064-girl 's clothes]1274-a man in girl 's clothes never occurred to [me]0-i . " First , [he]86-wilson hunted out the plate containing the finger - prints made by [Tom]83-tom when [he]83-tom was twelve years old , and laid it by itself ; then [he]86-wilson brought forth the marks made by [Tom]83-tom 's baby fingers when [he]83-tom was a suckling of seven months , and placed these two plates with the one containing [this subject]2801-this subject 's newly ( and unconsciously ) made record . "[2625-a girl] Now the series is complete , " [he]86-wilson said with satisfaction , and sat down to inspect these things and enjoy them . But [his]86-wilson enjoyment was brief . [He]86-wilson stared a considerable time at the three strips , and seemed stupefied with astonishment . At last [he]86-wilson put them down and said , "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't make it out at all -- hang it , [the baby]1276-the baby 's do n't tally with [the others]438-the others ! " [He]86-wilson walked the floor for half an hour puzzling over [his]86-wilson enigma , then [he]86-wilson hunted out two other glass plates . [He]86-wilson sat down and puzzled over these things a good while , but kept muttering , "[0-i] It 's no use ; [I]0-i ca n't understand it . [They]1278-they do n't tally right , and yet [I]0-i 'll swear the names and dates are right , and so of course they ought to tally . [I]0-i never labeled one of these thing carelessly in [my]0-i life . There is a most extraordinary mystery here . " [He]86-wilson was tired out , now , and [his]86-wilson brains were beginning to clog . [He]86-wilson said [he]86-wilson would sleep [himself]86-wilson fresh , and then see what [he]86-wilson could do with this riddle . [He]86-wilson slept through a troubled and unrestful hour , then unconsciousness began to shred away , and presently [he]86-wilson rose drowsily to a sitting posture . "[86-wilson] Now what was that dream ? " [he]86-wilson said , trying to recall it ; "[86-wilson] what was that dream?--it seemed to unravel that puz-- " [He]86-wilson landed in the middle of the floor at a bound , without finishing the sentence , and ran and turned up [his]86-wilson light and seized [his]86-wilson "[86-wilson] records . " [He]86-wilson took a single swift glance at [them]1278-they and cried out-- "[86-wilson] It 's so ! Heavens , what a revelation ! And for twenty - three years [no man]1489-no man has ever suspected it ! " CHAPTER XXI . Doom . [He]86-wilson is useless on top of the ground ; [he]86-wilson ought to be under it , inspiring the cabbages.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . April 1 . This is the day upon which [we]2802-we are reminded of what [we]2802-we are on the other three hundred and sixty - four.--Pudd'nhead [Wilson]86-wilson 's Calendar . [Wilson]86-wilson put on enough clothes for business purposes and went to work under a high pressure of steam . [He]86-wilson was awake all over . All sense of weariness had been swept away by the invigorating refreshment of the great and hopeful discovery which [he]86-wilson had made . [He]86-wilson made fine and accurate reproductions of a number of [his]86-wilson "[86-wilson] records , " and then enlarged them on a scale of ten to one with [his]86-wilson pantograph . [He]86-wilson did these pantograph enlargements on sheets of white cardboard , and made each individual line of the bewildering maze of whorls or curves or loops which constituted the "[86-wilson] pattern , " of a "[86-wilson] record " stand out bold and black by reinforcing it with ink . To the untrained eye the collection of delicate originals made by the human finger on the glass plates looked about alike ; but when enlarged ten times they resembled the markings of a block of wood that has been sawed across the grain , and the dullest eye could detect at a glance , and at a distance of many feet , that no two of the patterns were alike . When [Wilson]86-wilson had at last finished [his]86-wilson tedious and difficult work , [he]86-wilson arranged its results according to a plan in which a progressive order and sequence was a principal feature ; then [he]86-wilson added to the batch several pantograph enlargements which [he]86-wilson had made from time to time in bygone years . The night was spent and the day well advanced , now . By the time [he]86-wilson had snatched a trifle of breakfast it was nine o'clock , and [the court]2768-the court was ready to begin [its]2768-the court sitting . [He]86-wilson was in [his]86-wilson place twelve minutes later with [his]86-wilson "[86-wilson] records . " [Tom Driscoll]83-tom caught a slight glimpse of the records , and nudged [[his]83-tom nearest friend]2804-his nearest friend and said , with a wink , "[86-wilson] [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson 's got a rare eye to business -- thinks that as long as [he]86-wilson ca n't win [his]86-wilson case it 's at least a noble good chance to advertise [[his]86-wilson palace]1280-his palace - window decorations without any expense . " [Wilson]86-wilson was informed that [[his]86-wilson witnesses]2805-his witnesses had been delayed , but would arrive presently ; but [he]86-wilson rose and said [he]86-wilson should probably not have occasion to make use of [their]2805-his witnesses testimony . [ An amused murmur ran through the room--"It[86-wilson] 's a clean backdown ! [he]86-wilson gives up without hitting a lick ! " ] [Wilson]86-wilson continued--"I[86-wilson] have other testimony -- and better . [ This compelled interest , and evoked murmurs of surprise that had a detectable ingredient of disappointment in them . ] If [I]0-i seem to be springing this evidence upon [the court]2768-the court , [I]0-i offer as [my]0-i justification for this , that [I]0-i did not discover its existence until late last night , and have been engaged in examining and classifying it ever since , until half an hour ago . [I]0-i shall offer it presently ; but first [I]0-i wish to say a few preliminary words . " May it please [the Court]2768-the court , the claim given the front place , the claim most persistently urged , the claim most strenuously and [I]86-wilson may even say aggressively and defiantly insisted upon by [the prosecution]2807-the prosecution , is this -- that [the person whose hand left the blood - stained finger - prints upon the handle of the Indian knife]2808-the person whose hand left the blood - stained finger - prints upon the handle of the indian knife is [the person who committed the murder]2809-the person who committed the murder . "[86-wilson] [Wilson]86-wilson paused , during several moments , to give impressiveness to what [he]86-wilson was about to say , and then added tranquilly , " [We]2807-the prosecution grant that claim . "[86-wilson] It was an electrical surprise . [No one]390-no one was prepared for such an admission . A buzz of astonishment rose on all sides , and [people]388-people were heard to intimate that [the overworked lawyer]1284-the overworked lawyer had lost [his]1284-the overworked lawyer mind . Even [the veteran judge]1285-the veteran judge , accustomed as [he]1285-the veteran judge was to legal ambushes and masked batteries in criminal procedure , was not sure that [his]1285-the veteran judge ears were not deceiving [him]1285-the veteran judge , and asked [counsel]1286-counsel what it was [he]1285-the veteran judge had said . [Howard]78-howard 's impassive face betrayed no sign , but [his]78-howard attitude and bearing lost something of [their]1287-their careless confidence for a moment . [Wilson]86-wilson resumed : " [We]2807-the prosecution not only grant that claim , but [we]2807-the prosecution welcome it and strongly endorse it . Leaving that matter for the present , [we]2807-the prosecution will now proceed to consider other points in the case which [we]2807-the prosecution propose to establish by evidence , and shall include that one in the chain in its proper place . "[86-wilson] [He]86-wilson had made up [his]86-wilson mind to try a few hardy guesses , in mapping out [his]86-wilson theory of the origin and motive of the murder -- guesses designed to fill up gaps in it -- guesses which could help if [they]1288-my hit , and would probably do no harm if [they]1288-my did n't . " To [my]1288-my mind , certain circumstances of the case before [the court]2768-the court seem to suggest a motive for the homicide quite different from the one insisted on by [the State]2731-the state . It is [my]1288-my conviction that the motive was not revenge , but robbery . It has been urged that the presence of [the accused brothers]2812-the accused brothers in [that fatal room]2813-that fatal room , just after notification that one of [them]1289-they must take the life of [Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll or lose [his]88-judge driscoll own the moment [the parties]2814-the parties should meet , clearly signifies that the natural instinct of self - preservation moved [[my]1288-my clients]2815-my clients to go [there]1623-there secretly and save [Count Luigi]119-luigi by destroying [[his]88-judge driscoll adversary]2817-his adversary . "[1288-my] Then why did [they]1289-they stay [there]1623-there , after the deed was done ? [Mrs. Pratt]77-mrs. pratt had time , although [she]77-mrs. pratt did not hear the cry for help , but woke up some moments later , to run to [that room]1291-that room -- and there [she]77-mrs. pratt found [these men]1292-these men standing and making no effort to escape . If [they]1289-they were guilty , [they]1289-they ought to have been running out of [the house]247-the house at the same time that [she]77-mrs. pratt was running to [that room]1291-that room . If [they]1289-they had had such a strong instinct toward self - preservation as to move [them]1289-they to kill [that unarmed man]1295-that unarmed man , what had become of it now , when it should have been more alert than ever ? Would [any of [us]1297-us]1296-any of us have remained [there]1623-there ? Let [us]1297-us not slander [our]1297-us intelligence to that degree . " Much stress has been laid upon the fact that [the accused]2766-the accused offered a very large reward for the knife with which this murder was done ; that [no thief]985-no thief came forward to claim that extraordinary reward ; that the latter fact was good circumstantial evidence that the claim that the knife had been stolen was a vanity and a fraud ; that these details taken in connection with the memorable and apparently prophetic speech of [the deceased]2820-the deceased concerning that knife , and the final discovery of that very knife in [the fatal room where [no living person]2822-no living person was found present with [the slaughtered man]2823-the slaughtered man but [the owner of the knife]2824-the owner of the knife and [[his]2823-the slaughtered man brother]1537-his brother]2821-the fatal room where no living person was found present with the slaughtered man but the owner of the knife and his brother , form an indestructible chain of evidence which fixes the crime upon [those unfortunate strangers]2826-those unfortunate strangers . "[1297-us] But [I]0-i shall presently ask to be sworn , and shall testify that there was a large reward offered for [the thief]428-the thief , also ; and it was offered secretly and not advertised ; that this fact was indiscreetly mentioned -- or at least tacitly admitted -- in what was supposed to be safe circumstances , but may not have been . [The thief]428-the thief may have been present [himself]428-the thief . [ [Tom Driscoll]83-tom had been looking at [the speaker]1301-the speaker , but dropped [his]83-tom eyes at this point . ] In that case [he]83-tom would retain the knife in [his]83-tom possession , not daring to offer it for sale , or for pledge in [a pawn - shop]1302-a pawn - shop . [ There was a nodding of heads among [the audience]1950-the audience by way of admission that this was not a bad stroke . ] [I]0-i shall prove to the satisfaction of [the jury]2629-the jury that there was [a person in [[Judge Driscoll]88-judge driscoll 's room]1306-judge driscoll 's room]1305-a person in judge driscoll 's room several minutes before [the accused]2766-the accused entered [it]1306-judge driscoll 's room . [ This produced a strong sensation ; [the last drowsy - head in [the court - room]2792-the court - room]1308-the last drowsy - head in the court - room roused up , now , and made preparation to listen . ] If it shall seem necessary , [I]0-i will prove by [the Misses Clarkson]204-the misses clarkson that [they]1310-they met [a veiled person]1311-a veiled person -- ostensibly [a woman]433-a woman -- coming out of the back gate a few minutes after the cry for help was heard . [This person]2481-this person was not [a woman]433-a woman , but [a man dressed in woman]1315-a man dressed in woman 's clothes . " Another sensation . [Wilson]86-wilson had [his]86-wilson eye on [Tom]83-tom when [he]86-wilson hazarded this guess , to see what effect it would produce . [He]86-wilson was satisfied with the result , and said to [himself]86-wilson , "[1315-a man dressed in woman] It was a success -- [he]2481-this person 's hit ! " "[1315-a man dressed in woman] The object of [that person]2707-that person in [that house]262-that house was robbery , not murder . It is true that the safe was not open , but there was an ordinary tin cash - box on the table , with three thousand dollars in it . It is easily supposable that [the thief]428-the thief was concealed in [the house]247-the house ; that [he]428-the thief knew of this box , and of [its owner]2457-its owner 's habit of counting its contents and arranging [his]428-the thief accounts at night -- if [he]428-the thief had that habit , which [I]0-i do not assert , of course;--that [he]428-the thief tried to take the box while [its owner]2457-its owner slept , but made a noise and was seized , and had to use the knife to save [himself]428-the thief from capture ; and that [he]428-the thief fled without [his]428-the thief booty because [he]428-the thief heard help coming . " [I]86-wilson have now done with [my]86-wilson theory , and will proceed to the evidences by which [I]86-wilson propose to try to prove its soundness . "[86-wilson] [Wilson]86-wilson took up several of [his]86-wilson strips of glass . When [the audience]1950-the audience recognized these familiar mementoes of [Pudd'nhead]86-wilson 's old - time childish " puttering "[1950-the audience] and folly , the tense and funereal interest vanished out of [their]1950-the audience faces , and [the house]247-the house burst into volleys of relieving and refreshing laughter , and [Tom]83-tom chirked up and joined in the fun [himself]83-tom ; but [Wilson]86-wilson was apparently not disturbed .
